Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O children, now that I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine and from whose completion through its expositions and declarations I have seen that you will reach the end of it, and by means of which, it is to me clear that you will reach it through this treatise, which is a part of the action with the hand, that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the action with the hand is now prohibited in our realm and in our times deprived of it, while greatly threatening the science of medicine; and its practices are obscured and only a few small descriptions remain of them in the books of the ancients, which they have altered and introduced into errors and delusions, closing their minds to it, lengthening their words, and losing the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has seemed good to me that you animate this through the arrangement of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it may come with the forms of the instruments of cautery and of the other instruments of the work as they are through addition of declaration, and through preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause for which no good artist is found with his hand in our time is because the art of medicine is long, and that it requires its practitioner to be exercised beforehand in the science of anatomy, which understands the joints of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and has knowledge of the bones, the nerves, and the veins, and the places of their origin.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And because of this, Hippocrates says that by name it is much, but in work little, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already spoken of that in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable of what we have told you of anatomy, it is not vacated that he will not fall into error by which men will die, as I have seen many of those, for some are formed in this science and they throw themselves from it without science or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen an old and experienced physician open a scrofulous abscess on the neck of a woman, and cut certain arteries in her neck so that much blood flowed, causing the woman to die under his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another physician who, after he had extracted a stone from a man that was large, and came to him and drew out that stone with a piece of the bladder, causing that man on the third day to die.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have called it to be extracted before, and I saw by the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I have seen another physician who took a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he treated a black slave who had a fracture in his thigh; and the physician, through his ignorance, drew out the fracture above the plague with powder and bandages with great tightness, and did not leave the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he closed it according to his wishes, and bound it up, and let it lie for several days and commanded that we not loosen the bandage; and so it went as the thigh and the foot became pustular, and he came to perdition.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to loosen the bandage, and tranquility came upon him and he ceased from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed corruption had been confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption did not cease to wander about the member as the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I have seen another physician who opened a cancerous ulcer and it was inflamed after several days, as the malice of it grew great with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the cold humor is pure, and it does not come to it with fire at all, but that there be a member which suffers that from everything it becomes hostile.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And because of this, children, it is necessary for you that the action with the hand be divided into two duties: one in operation that is associated with health, and in work in which there is peril in the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already touched on that in every place of this book in which occurs operation in which there is error and fear; so that it is necessary for you to keep to that and leave that aside, so that the unlearned do not find a way to speak and to reproach you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your arms with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God that they may attain health and laudable success, and lay aside the terrible maladies of difficult cure, and display your arms against what makes you afraid, so that idleness in your faith and in your name does not vanquish you; for more remains to your glory, and beyond all in the realm and in the world to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gauliah has already said in some of his books:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“Do not treat bad maladies poorly, so that bad physicians are not named.”
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered of the head, in the forms of the instruments and of the tools of cauteries, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of cauterization and puncturing, and of cupping-glasses, and of plasters, and of extraction of thorns and the like; all chapters and ordered of the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and of dislocation, and of cure of torture and of the like; a chapter ordered of the head, in the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and with acute medicine and remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will say what the quality of the humors of that cautery and of the pain of it are, and in what condition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech of the quality of the humor of cautery and of the pain of it is long and prolix, and subtle by science, and a secret hidden; and many wise men have spoken greatly of it, and they are disagreed among themselves, and for me a little of their speeches suffices, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery confers universally upon every complexional matter, excepting two complexions which are complexional without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complexional and dry matter they disagreed; for some said that cautery is beneficial to it, and the others said the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in disease which is by quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that the disease which is complexional and dry with what is cauterized and dry be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I say the contrary of that, that by cautery there is made humor in every disease which is complexional and dry that you see in men's bodies, for when you compare man's body to the complexions of fire, you moisten man's body.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by that speech that experiment that which I have discovered several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But indeed no one should venture upon this topic unless he is experienced and practiced in the chapter of cauterization through subsequent exercise, and has come to know the diversity of human complexions and the disposition of illnesses in their bodies, and the causes of these, and their accidents, and the span of time of these.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in the other complexions, there is no reason for fear, and especially in the moist and friction-based illnesses, for all doctors have agreed upon these, and are not disagreeing about the use of cauterization in them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing through cauterization with fire and the goodness of it is that fire is simple, the action of which does not spread except to the member which is cauterized, and does not affect another member joined to it, except with minor harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of burning medicine spreads to other members that are joined to it, and strongly brings about a difficult-to-heal illness in them, and strongly hurts.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do that except that it expels what is superfluous; and it has been known to us through experience and through long service of study of the truth of causes. And because of this I am excused from the length of speech; and if it were not that I did not have my free will in this pause, hidden from you a secret with fire, and the quality of its action in bodies and of its expulsion by which illnesses are expelled, demonstrated with philosophical speech, which would be acute for you.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when cauterization is convenient, and pause the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is convenient in all times, so that the harm from the accidental time is submerged by what is drawn out by cauterization; and especially if the cauterization is for pains or necessary pains, strong and violent, which do not endure delay because of what is feared to come from them, a maliciousness that is greater than minor harm.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And therefore do not fear in your hearts, O children, that this is not believed except by the common people and foolish doctors; for with that illness which is healed by cauterization there is not a reason to pause at all times, but they pause at what follows.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think, for cauterization is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries out the moistnesses that are the cause by which pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But cauterization is superfluous over medicine because of the willfulness of its strength and power of its action, and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible for his illness to return at some time of the year, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his illness, and the power of it, and what is prepared in his body from the accumulation of superfluities within him, and what is received by him in acquisition from foods and likenesses of those causes; unless the illness for which cauterization was administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and moistnesses, as with a toothache and its likeness, it is possible that this pain will not return to him but rather what happens to him is minor.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a true saying, not so that they understand it in it, for they believe that there is no healing that profits from medicine or other cause except cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer methods of healing in some illnesses, and those medicines do not confer, and especially at the end of the cause we administer to them cauterization, and profit from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And therefore we have that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the common people and foolish doctors understand it.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of cauterization does not matter, when it is not absolutely true, for I have seen and proven that it only matters in some bodies and not in others; but when you do cauterization with fire with gold, it is not declared to you because it is heated according to the amount that you want by the heat of the gold, and because it prepares itself to receive friction; and if you place over it ignition, it melts into the fire some leaves through which the artisan cuts for the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, cauterization is done with iron more lightly and more closely to correctness of action.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head among the feet, so that elsewhere you may demand from it what you want.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization of headache from coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers to moisture and coldness the serving accident of which there are two causes; it is a cause of soda and multitude of fluxes, called corissa, from the parts of the ears and from the nose flowing, and multitude of sleeping, and of toothache and of the jaw, and universally of all illnesses that come through frigidity, as with paralysis and apoplexy, and their likeness in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this: first, you command the patient to be evacuated by laxative medicine, the head being washed out, for three or four days, according to the power of the patient and his age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command that he wash his head with soap, and then rest between your knees on a low bench and place his hands over his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the edge of your palm, and then press upon the edge of his nose between his eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But indeed, when your middle finger is arrived at that place, mark it with your tent, and then ignite the cauterization olive of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place it upon the place marked with your tent, in such a way that it descends, and your hand be cramped little by little, and you revolve it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the place; and if you see that there has been discovered some amount of the head, as though the quantity of hair, then lift your hand again, and if it does not return with that iron, with another, if it is cooled off, between while it is seen by you what I have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve that over the place and let it be for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place on it wool that is saturated in vinegar and let it be upon it while the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place with tetramedicament within while it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when Roman plaster is opened up, then the greater number of blisters it has, for it is better and more healing.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that some of them that the tendon be cauterized within the bone, and have the cauterization within while some part of the tissue of the bone is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then it should be cut where it adheres to the bone, and then treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others said that with the cautery they reached the nerve, which presses strongly on the bone, and this is the form of the small alpecat:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place the vapors of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound has been open for a long time, it should be treated and allowed to heal over time.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery at all, except in a few cases due to fear; and I think that leaving it as it is better for health than removing it, because the head is delicate due to the continuity of its veins, as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and using it and performing that operation is healthier.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Two:
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head there is a chronic and long-lasting pain which is prolonged in the patient, and he uses leeches and cupping glasses and caputal poultices and plasters and guaiac wood and similar things, and especially if he has already been cauterized with a cautery which does not help him for any of these causes, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong creation in its nature, and not frail and finds great discomfort, then cauterize it again with another cautery after the first one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize it on the crown of his head with a cautery so that the vein is cut.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Having cut the vein and discovered it from the bone to the extent that we have mentioned, cauterize it with a cautery at the back of the head in the place which is called the windpipe, — and this is the place where the cupping glass is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And hold your hand over it, and do not uncover the bone, because the patient experiences great discomfort from this compared to all other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say this cautery in its place, because the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occipital is a more subtle cautery than that with which the middle of the head is cauterized; and this is how it is done.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Three:
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cauterization for non-ancient emigration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a sudden pain in the front of the head or an aching pain that extends to the eye, evacuate the head with purgatives, and administer the other treatment which I have described in the causes of diseases; and if this does not help, cauterization can be performed in two ways: either with an acute burning medicine or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But a cautery with a burning medicine is that you take a piece of wool, scorch it and put the ends of it on both sides of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then pierce the location of the pain in the temple with a small lance inserted so that it is under the vein and hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then tie it tightly with a descent constriction, and leave it there for the space of three hours; then remove the wool and treat the lance-wound, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then apply cold water to the spot until it heals over.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with an ointment so that it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the two treatises on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron is done like this: heat the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a closed claw nail, because the head of it is shaped like a claw with some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small projection.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then apply it to the location of the pain, and hold your hand — so that the cautery is not burnt — and move the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is burnt by the specifcality of the vein is equal to the thickness of it, and raise your hand so that the artery is not burnt which is underneath, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then wet a cloth in salt water and apply it to the spot, and leave it for three days; then apply cold water to it, and treat it with an ointment so that it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the tip of the scalpel according to cautery, and be careful not to cut the artery in this non-ancient emigration.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four:
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterization for ancient emigration.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you are treating emigration with what we have said about the previous cure, and what we have said in the divisions of the diseases, and the cure does not help, and you see that it does not suffice for the disease which is not abated by what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire, then wherever you ignite the cautery cuttler so that it turns white, press it onto the location of the pain with a line of length equal to the thickness of the tip, or longer; and holding your hand so that the cautery does not burn the artery underneath it.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuity of the mandible which is damaged due to chewing, and that the joint not be burnt and the nerve underneath it, and that there be no cramp.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about guarding against the flow of blood from the artery which is abscised, because there is danger in its abscision, and especially to one who does not know what he is doing and is unskilled; and let the operation begin in that place.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with remembrance of the regime for accidental flow of blood from the artery according to its own way, in your free time.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not suffice to this cautery and the patient's body is tolerable, cauterize it in the middle of the head as we have mentioned, and treat the wound so that it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on contraction of the artery with cautery having two tips, and this cauterization is better and more effective.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five:
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization for pains in the ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear caused by cold and it is treated with caustic causes and with the other cure which I have mentioned in the division, and the pain is not eased, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one which is called puncta, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then pierce it with the cautery and ignite it, and let it be held in the environment of the entire ear as it is rotated, or in the circuit of either side if the pain is in either side.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move around with the cautery from the root of the ear a little at a time so that it touches the spot with effort.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of ten points in the entire ear, and those around it, and then treat the spots so that they heal.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter Six:
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization for torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and treated with cauterization is nothing but the spices which come through phlegm, according to what we have said in the divisions of the diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the area that is affected by dryness or by a nerve spasm.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you are treating this type of torture with leeches and bloodletting and poultices, and your treatment is not working, then you must cauterize the patient in three places: first, at the root of the ear; second, a little below his temple; and third, at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery opposite to the affected area, because softening will not occur except in the part that is not healing.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cautery on the right side of the upper part of the ear, a little above the corner of the head; and in the temple another one, the length of which should be according to the length of the little finger, and apply your hand with the cautery until half of the quantity of the size of a barleycorn is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a tool of the surgeon, the shape of which is described below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But indeed more subtle is that one little bit as you see; and if it has some superficial hardness, cut a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what is described in front of you until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On cauterization for ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you are treating it with what we have said and your treatment is not working and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize him with four cauteries: over all the corners of his head; and with cautery on the middle part of his head, as we have said; and with cautery in the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And he has already been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more effective in the rear; and then let it be treated with what comes out.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterization for obliteration caused by phlegm.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Let the patient be given at the beginning large leeches and purifying pills by the servant.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the whole head of the patient and apply to his neck the poultice described in the treatise on poultices.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that several times, for that is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to the order of the medicines which we have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he heals well from that, then do nothing; but if not, then do to him three cauteries in the rear part of his head, which descend from the highest part of the head towards the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and then treat the cauteries with what comes out.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you see improvement and the patient is able to tolerate it, then do to him cauterization in the middle part; but if you see greater improvement, then cauterize him over both corners.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped according to the shape described above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On cauterization for paralyses and on softening of all the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Let the patient's head be purified with leeches and with what we have said; then shave the patient's head and cauterize him with cautery in the middle part of his head, and with cautery on all the corners of his head, and with cautery on the rear part of his neck, and with three cauteries over the spine of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body for too much of that and the patients tolerate it, and the disease is strong, then cauterize him with four cauteries on the spine of his back, and lastly with cautery until half a barleycorn has been burned, and lift up your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let this be the olive-shaped cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Let the epileptic not be cauterized unless his epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And then let the brain of him be purified at the beginning by the servant with leeches and with the other treatment which we have said in the division when the patient is large and is able to tolerate the excess of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if he is a child who does not tolerate the medicines, then administer poultices and masticables by the servant purifying, before that for several days, with beneficial foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head; and then cauterize him with one cautery in the middle part of his head according to the previous manner, and with another cautery on the back of his head, and cauterize over each corner of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize him with cauteries which we have said, having paralysis and softening of the body over the spine of the neck and over the spine of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let it be olive-shaped according to what has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a delicate cautery according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt and moist humors and phlegm, then cauterize him with the cauteries which we have said in the section on paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess phlegm going down into melancholy, and the body of the patient is moist, then give him what purifies his brain according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then make a decently made turban of linen and place it around his neck; then apply that on the middle part of his head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let him be sixty days old, and let him be held in every part.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a poultice; and it is more worthy of a young sheep's milk.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that on the fire with moderate warmth, which he endures when it is within him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply that on the middle part of his head around the circle, and let him be within until he is relaxed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that with the patient throughout the week once a day, and let him have the other regimen within him until he is healed; or if you want, cauterize him making small points according to his age: this is a special cautery which moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then apply that cold in a woolen bandage or in linen bandages.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterization for water descending into the throat.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared that water enters the throat through the holes which you have seen in the division, then begin and give the patient what purifies his brain; and guard him from all moistness.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him sip at a bath in lukewarm water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command that he rinses his head, and cauterize him with cautery in the middle part of his head; and then cauterize him with two cauteries over two temples if the beginning is water in two holes, or from one side if it begins from one hole.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Puncture with cautery all the veins and arteries which are below the barleycorn; and let the cauteries be in that length in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from him, stop it with whatever medicine is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And let the wisdom that is in the extraction of arteries and the abstention from those and the cauterization of blood flow come to you.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck under the jaw bones with two cauteries recently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the eyes are old and there is an excess of phlegmatic fluid flowing through the veins and arteries, which are evident in a protruding lump on the head, then cauterize that with the cautery we described in the chapter on preventing water from going into the eyes, and cauterize it also at the middle part of the head, and with two cauteries at the neck under the temples, and with two cauteries at the neck under the jaw bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is a need for addition, then cauterize that all around the corner of the eye above the upper eyelid with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of bad odor from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you have treated him with what we have said in the division and your treatment is not effective, then prepare and give the patient enemas for three nights; then shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery made of olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize that with a cautery made of clove on the two upper eyelids, just below where the hair starts, with two small cauteries.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the artery so you do not burn it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is how the clove cautery is made:
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization to soften the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened due to illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a lunar cautery; and this is how it is made:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you are treating the upper eyelids, cauterize them with two small cauteries all around, and let them be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the size of the eyelid.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cautery too much, but according to how much the third part of the eyelid is attached.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cauterization of the eyelid when the hairs are converted into parts inside and close the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are converted into parts inside and close the eye, there are two ways to cauterize them: either with a cautery made of fire or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize him with fire, command the patient to open his eyes so that the hairs are pulled out with them as they grow and are elongated; and if he closes his eyes, then you strengthen his eyelids with a bandage so that he does not rub his eyes while the hairs grow.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then as they grow and become elongated, then place the patient's head in your lap, and press on the eyelid of the eye with your finger, with the sign being according to the shape of a dead leaf, and let the sign be near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place a cotton pad soaked in egg white or in mullein tea on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the cautery, of which this is how it is made:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize over the figure you have marked, little by little, in small areas, until all of the surface of the eyelid is burned, which should be like a myrtle leaf, appearing completely healthy.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of the success of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of the eye elevated above the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and let him lie down for three days, and then place a bandage on him until the scab is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hairs return for any reason and the eyelid is softened, then repeat the cauterization on that eye again just as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the lower eyelid, then cauterize that until it is elevated to its natural place and elongated, and let the hairs not touch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to open his eyes so that the hairs are pulled out with them as they grow and become elongated, and then let it be made of linen in the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take sagewort and live coals, one ounce each. .I. Put them in a mortar and pestle, and mix those ingredients well, and make it into a poultice so that it is not too cold; then spread that on the linen which is made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and apply that to one eye or both; then let the patient lie down with his head in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Then hold the poultice over the medicine and press it gently so that the patient feels the biting of the medicine, for the biting is in him like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when he feels the biting, then let him drink the medicine and wipe it off with his own finger; then when the biting stops, let him rinse the eye with water, and then examine if the eyelid is lifted up as it was washed with fire or with a cut, for then it is well; and if it returns to that which the medicine was applied on the spot where the medicine did not penetrate and is blackened as your operation is healed and the eye is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place a bandage on him until the scab of the swelling is eradicated, and then treat that with ointment of hellebore or another so that it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you, after your operation, to guard against the eye being damaged by the medicine with great diligence, and if the eyelid after a few days is softened and for some reason the hairs enter the eye, then repeat your medicine on that spot of the eyelid which is softened, and precisely as you did at the beginning, and treat him until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that men' eyes are diverse according to their size and smallness, and therefore according to how your contraction is made.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And not being doubtful about the path of truth to him who is taught in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of a fissure which is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fissure with what we have said in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not work, then know that you cauterize it in this way: command the patient to lie down his head in your lap, and let someone hold his head up by the hair so that it is not rubbed or moved with his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a cotton pad soaked in egg white or in mullein tea on the eye of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then ignite the cautery, of which this is how it is made:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which should be hollow, like a reed or a pen, and from one end is made the cautery.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see that it has penetrated into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to let it out in this way, then do so with a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But the one who is hollowed out is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press the fistula if it is open and bring out from him pus and dry up that fluid.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open then open it and extract the fluid from him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place on him the cautery which should be well lit and hold your hand a little below the cautery at the opening of the nose so that your hand does not get burnt or the patient is not disturbed and then place the cautery in the wounds of the nose and corrupt that area.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cautery it goes into the bone then that is good and if not then repeat the cautery one or two times if necessary; leave it like that for three days, and then place a bandage on that area and wrap it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if twelve days have passed and it has not healed then place a corrosive acute medicine on it so that the bone is uncovered and scrape it according to what is convenient in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way of cauterizing a fistula which some first said: enter the site of the fistula and open it and then place in that fissure subtle cement of which its shape is like this: melt an ounce of lead into that, and hold your hand with cement with good retention so that the melted lead does not come to the hole of that; and cover the hole on the patient's nose with cotton or water, because lead adheres to the site of the fistula and heals it with a wonderful cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment then that is good; and if not then it is necessary to administer a nose piercing and reduce the fistula to the cavity of the nose according to what will come in its own place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cauterization of the split of the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times there are splits in the lips and mostly in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So when you heal those splits with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment is not effective then light the cautery knife in this form as it is described:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the thinness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place it carefully in those splits so that the cautery reaches the bone of the splits.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with wax so that it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterizing a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth there is an apthoe and it starts to fester and it is broken, and it is aged, and there is rust and it becomes a fistula, and you heal that and your treatment is not effective then place the cautery which is received in the fistula; and hold your hand so that the iron reaches the bone of it, and do this one or two times; and heal that with what we have said about healing so that it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus is discharged and it is healed then that is good; and if not then it is necessary to uncover the area and scrape off the rotten bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of teeth and of softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are burned and you heal those with medicines and they do not help then place the patient's head in your lap, and light the cautery of which its form will come here, in such a way that you place the tongs over the tooth and enter into it the lit cautery quickly, and hold your hand a little so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth to be reached.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand and repeat the cautery several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should fill his mouth with salty water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because the burned tooth is firm and the soft gum is tightened and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is from coldness, or in it there is pain or redness, or the medicine does not help then cauterization in that is according to two ways: either cauterize with cow's dung or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with dung is that you take the dung of cows and cook it in horse's manure, and then take a stick and wrap it over the end of the tongue, and then dip that in the hot dung and place it on the painful tooth quickly so that it is heated.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times so that the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you want, dip wool or a stick in the dung above mentioned, and place it on the painful tooth, and hold the iron over it so that the iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But cauterization with fire is that you attend to the tongs of iron or steel, and there is some thickness in it and the sharpness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then light the cautery of which its form will come, and place it on the tooth and hold your hand so that the cautery is hot; and do this several times because the pain is increased or in that day or in the other day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And let the patient fill his mouth with good dung and hold it for an hour and then spit it out; and this is the way of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize whatever you see according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the way of the tongs:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterizing hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernia is from phlegm and cold humors and they are not opened by medicine and you see their digestion slightly then light the cautery of which its form follows, having two ends bent so that smoke comes out of the cautery from the other end, and place that lit on the hernia once, and if it does not come out of it then do this another time so that it reaches the bone of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hernia is small then place the cautery according to the quantity of the hernia, and let it rest for three days and place on it a bandage soaked in dung so that what the fire has burned is softened.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with ointment and poultices and bandages so that it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the way of the tongs or the cautery there is such.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterizing laryngitis and of constriction of voice.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes over the larynx and especially when there is coldness of complexions then let the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines and then cauterize that from the root of the gullet in the place which is depurged.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful that you do not reach with the cautery to the gullet or do not burn of the membrane of it but a little.
