E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that with another cautery at the joint of the neck in his last vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And the cautery of it should be a red-hot iron rod as described previously.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with what has already been mentioned so that it may heal.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of cautery for lung diseases and coughing.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When a cough and lung disease are caused by moist humors, and the patient does not have a fever or tuberculosis, and it is an old disease, then cauterize that with two cauteries over the furcula in the places below the collarbones, and with another cautery in the middle of the chest between the two nipples; and let the cauteries be red-hot according to the previous form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you want, let your cautery be pricking with the cautery that is called 'puncta', the form of which precedes in the puncturing of ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And let there be pricks within those; and then treat that with what has already been mentioned so that it may heal.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And when the cautery has three wounds, for such cautery use one caustic according to this form:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of cautery for tics which are in the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the assistant is dislocated due to slippery humors and does not return to its place in its usual way, and it is displaced a little bit as it tries to move back, just as we have witnessed, then first reduce the dislocation, and let the patient's head be turned back towards his chest or onto one side; and then lift up the neck which is at the front of the tic where it begins inside the jaw with your left hand if the joint is dislocated there.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let the cautery have two heads; and this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the neck so that it penetrates from one side to the other; and then the figure of the cautery will come from two-headed cauteries.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is subtle according to the amount of tenting; and this is its form:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to this account, and that is why there are eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then put honey on the cautery and let the patient be quiet, and do not disturb him for some time until he is comforted.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is above and it is tight, then cauterize over the muscle with a red-hot cautery or with pointed cauteries, for the joint is confirmed and the humidity is broken up and the patient is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of cautery of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When a person's stomach is filled with humors and movements that disturb the stomach and multiply its contents, and if you continue with your healing practices without success, then let the patient be on his back, with his head reclined and his arms stretched out, and cauterize that with three cauteries: one cautery below the feet according to the amount of a finger using a red-hot cautery, and two cauteries below the ribs so that the figure of a triangular cautery comes; and lengthen these so that they are not adjusted which will cause burning.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is two-thirds of the thickness of the neck.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be according to this form, and if you want, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; and this should be a cautery according to the form of a circle according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be punctured by that which is scared by this cautery: and when you feel a point on the stomach according to the amount you want with a tent, then cauterize that with a cautery in the points; and then treat that with the healing that has already been mentioned so that it may heal.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of cautery for a sore throat.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the throat due to chafing or humidity or gross windiness so that from its normal complexions it is driven out by excessive egress, and it is healed with what we have said and does not conform, then let the patient be reclined on his back, and feel with a tent three cauteries according to this form and this quantity placed over the throat below the hypochondria where a man lies on his side.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be according to the thickness of a finger, and let the cautery be according to the length of the body straight.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not move your hand with the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of what is burned is the amount of the thickness of the neck, and if it is not tight; and if the patient stands on his feet; and if he does not stand, then let him lie down, for he has already stretched out his arms, and raise up his arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is up to you to cauterize these cauteries with a cautery blade, when you are subtle and prudent in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to overdo it in the cauterization, and let the thickness of all the neck be cauterized so that it may go into the intestines, for here the neck is subtle; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of piercing of an abscess in the throat with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an abscess or ulcer in the throat and you want to know whether this abscess is in the flesh of the throat or in its membrane, then if it is in the flesh of the throat, the patient will have a heavy breath and the pain will become acute.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the membrane of the throat, there will be great pain and many doctors have tired themselves from treating him.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore let the patient be turned towards his chest; and then feel the location of the abscess with a tent; and then take the cautery which is assembled like a needle, the form of which has been described in the other page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize it with that cautery until all the neck is burnt, so that it goes into the chest, so that phlegm may come out.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that for the healing of other abscesses so that it may heal.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this form of cautery unless that which you have learned in the art of medicine is prolonged, and in whose hand many diseases are known; however, sometimes let it be applied to this operation, but nevertheless, know this, and it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cautery of pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	Take the ancient cauteries of the roots of aristology for pleurisy according to this manner which is being made, and that you take from the roots of aristology a long dry root which is found, and let it be of the thickness of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then soak it in oil and heat it in the fire, and then cauterize with a cautery in that location which is between the continuation of the furcula and the neck; and with two small cauteries below the guidazes, one declining slightly to the part where the beard is found, and with two cauteries on what is declining between the fifth rib and the breastbone, declining slightly to the parts behind; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest; and with a cautery in that location which is between the two shoulders, and with two cauteries on the sides of the chest, below the cautery which is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And you must not burn your hand with the cautery, but it should be in the hollow of the armpit, in action.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some ancient people said that some of the men who use cauteries of iron similar to a needle, ignite it and place it in the space between the ribs, until they reach the pustule and the healthy flesh is exposed, just as we have said about the pustule of the liver.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this piercing with cautery, there is no fear, because the humor soon escapes from the location of the fistula to which there is no cure.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cauterization of the mouth.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the illness of the mouth with what we have said about treatment in division and do not apply your treatment, then cauterize it according to three methods, all of which are correct. The first is that you make three or four cauteries depending on the length of the mouth according to the figure of the cauteries of the liver, the figure of which has preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And the distance between each cautery should be the thickness of a finger or a little more, and the manner of the cautery should be the same as we have said about the cautery of the liver in every way.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not burn your hand with the cautery; and let the patient be above you.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another way to cauterize, which is that you ignite the cautery having two garments, the cause of which we have said in the chapter on dislocation of the muscle, and elevate the vein which is in the end of the mouth through which passes the jaw of the left patient.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your elevation by which you elevate the vein be according to the length of the body, so that the cauteries are made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	Then insert the two garments, ignite them, into that space through which you penetrate the vein from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and thus four cauteries are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three garments.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you cure the cautery once it has stopped burning for several days, because it is more beneficial than the other causes preceding in the treatment.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Of cauterization of hydrocephalus.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Do not cauterize in hydrocephalus except in the scrotum specifically.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat hydrocephalus with the methods of treatment we have said in division and do not apply your treatment, then cauterize it with four cauteries around the scrotum, and with one cautery over the stomach, and with another cautery over the liver, and with another cautery over the mouth, and with two cauteries between the vertebrae of the back, and with one cautery on the right side of the foot, and with another cautery over the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the amount of the depth of the cautery should be proportional to the thickness of the vein.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then let the cautery burn for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not discharge the patient after the cautery with what you have done so that two tendencies are added to him and healing is encouraged by it.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery with which the belly is cauterized should be clavicle according to what its shape is above, and that with which the back is cauterized should be olive according to what its shape precedes.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	Of cauterization of feet and thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are pustules in hydrops and are filled with yellow water, then cauterize the feet over the instep of the foot in the space between the auricular and annular fingers, and elevate your hand by the cautery and do not twist it; and then elevate your hand, and do not return it at all, because the yellow water exudes.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	It is the cautery according to this shape: And then make two cauteries over both thighs, and in each thigh let the cautery be made with the end of the cautery blade.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And let the cautery be according to the length of the thigh, one below the knee and the other above the knee joint of the thigh; and over each thigh two cauteries.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And let the wound remain open after treatment for a long time so that no water exudes from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then cure with those causes which we have said.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	Of cauterization of the body of the belly.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the body of the belly is due to rubbing and humidity so that the digestive and retentive humors are weakened in the stomach and intestines, and is treated with the methods of treatment which we have said and do not apply, and sometimes the patient suffers cautery from the excessive humor, then cauterize it with a large cautery over his stomach according to what has preceded in the cauterization of the stomach, with the cautery of the circle and four cauteries around the scrotum subtly, with a subtle clavicle cautery; and with cautery over the scrotum over aloesis greatly, or with two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if you see excessive humidities and the patient tolerates it, then cauterize it over the penis and over the intestines, and tightly bind two cauteries over the stomach near the groins, for this is a perfect treatment of youth from which there is no error.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	Of cauterization of ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When there are in nature ancient hemorrhoids or one of thick humors rubbed or of corrupt humidities, and they are cured with what we have said in division and do not apply your treatment, then cauterize it with three cauteries over the pus below the small vertebrae of the back triangularly, and with a cautery above the navel through two holes.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that his stomach is rubbed and his food is not digested, and his face is pustular, then cauterize it over the stomach with a large cautery according to what has preceded; and with one cautery over the liver, and with another cautery over his mouth with a clavicle cautery, and let the cautery remain open for some time, and then cure it when it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Of cauterization of athreye near the incision of their scrotum.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you excise athreye, then ignite the cautery that is assembled like a needle.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert it into the athreye that has been excised, and finish your hand when it reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood comes.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do one or two times, for if they are many, then cauterize each of them according to what we have recounted, and then cure those with what you have applied to them when it is healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery over the scrotum, it is better in youth.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of cauterization of fistulas that are made in nature through the parts of his body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work which we have commanded in its place, and the patient is frightened by it, let it be healed by cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore when you see a fistula in nature through, and it is ancient, and corrupt humidities, and then what is pus worthy that it is that you pierce it with a subtle probe, and then know the amount of its depth by the above-mentioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then light the cautery that is similar to a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then place that cautery into the fistula according to the amount in which you enter the tent.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat on that the cautery is inserted until those corrupted bodies are burnt once or twice or three times according to the amount of your need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And beware of the combustion of nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or the body of the intestine, then beware of all those places; and do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you think it is not penetrating.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Then heal the place where it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed and the matters are cut off from it and remain like that for a long time, then know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the matters are not removed from it, then know that it is penetrating into its bone or that the bones are corrupted, or it will come from those causes of which memory will return to its place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of cauterization of the sinuses.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the sinuses there is pain because of friction or because of great windiness, and for that reason the patient's head hurts, then you must cauterize that on the sinuses with a cautery nail from which comes the memory.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And quickly cauterize them again with a small one, so that there will be three cauteries lined up and then they will go away in succession.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter .xxxviii.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Of cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is weakness and softening of the bladder due to friction and humidity so that the patient does not retain urine, then cauterize that at the top of the pus below the bladder, where the hairs of the pubic region begin, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side, and with another on the left side.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of the hairs; and cauterize that with a cautery at the bottom of the two, or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let the cautery nail be according to what is being done.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter .xxxix.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of cauterization of the hernia.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is friction and humidity in the hernia, and for that reason impregnation is prohibited, and its tissues are corrupted, and the provocation of them is delayed, and pain comes because of their holding, then you must cauterize the place with three cauteries around the navel, just as we have said in the cauterization of the bladder; and with a cautery on the bottom of the two, or with two cauteries, and let the cautery nail be.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter .xl.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of cauterization of the dislocation of the elbow.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humors are infiltrated at the beginning of the elbow and the cause is the movement of its joint, and a sign of it is that the bone is prolonged beyond the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is obstructed in which they are boiled.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then you must cauterize the patient on the inside of the elbow with a circular cautery that is similar to a ring, because you will have marked it with a tent in the circuit of the beginning just as it is bent, and so that the beginning falls at the center of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And let the cautery be the same one as before in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if that cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three cauteries with an olive-shaped cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And let the cautery be done according to the amount of the thickness of all the cord; and then heal that which is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xli.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain comes in the beginning of the elbow and its cause is friction and humidity, and the patient is cured by that which we have said and does not confer, and it is old, then you must laxate the patient from thick humors with suppurative pills or artificial pills or similar; and then cauterize.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of the cautery in that is according to two manners: or cautery with burning medicines, or cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	They go according to two known manners, one of which is that you cauterize it on the inside of the arm with three triangular cauteries according to this form; and make them well into the depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space between each cautery be the amount of the thickness of the finger, and if the olive-shaped or large cautery.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Sometimes it must be the cautery on the center over the head of the elbow so that there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you want, cauterize with the circle of which is preceded the form in the cauterization of the dislocation of the elbow, and let it be a containing circle and burn the thickness of all the cord.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the manner of cautery in sciatica when pain is adherent to the elbow and it does not extend into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it extends into the thigh, then cauterize that on the thigh on the place to which the pain goes, and with one cautery over four fingers a little from the muscular part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is cut, then let the depth of the cautery be according to the amount of the thickness of the cord.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the pain goes so that it is extended into the place between the fingers of the feet, then cauterize that where it goes in with cautery by three points or four or more if there are signs from that.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the pain goes to the thigh behind the knee of the leg, then cauterize that here with a cut cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And beware in all cauterization that you do not go too far with the cautery so as to burn nerve or large artery, and so that it is upon the patient harm or contradiction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And so you have seen one of those whom they cauterized on the arm and finished in the cauterization, and the fire was inflated within so that the tumor obtained it by the foot, and it was perforated and corrupted all over the foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	Then strong solution of the belly occurred, and then death followed.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two places at once, cauterize each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise said in the cauterization of the elbow that cautery which is this manner: make similar to a ring of iron whose circuit is the length of a palm; and let its orifices be according to the thickness of an almond bone or less by a little.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And within that circle there is another third; and let the space between them be the amount of the hairs of the fingers; and those circles are open at two places; and let the length of those be a hair or two hairs, and do in those margins of iron decently bent into the circles; and this is its form:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then it is to be heated in the fire so that it becomes red hot and sparks come out of it, and then let it be placed on the inside of the arm, and let the patient fall on his side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And then cauterize that with three cauteries round in one day.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And let him lie like that for three days; then plaster that with a poultice and let the wound be open for drops of days; and then heal that which is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Here is the translation of the first sentence:
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	Here is the translation of the second sentence:
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	Here is the translation of the third sentence:
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	Here is the translation of the fourth sentence:

E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	Here is the translation of the tenth sentence:
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Here is the translation of the eleventh sentence:

Here is the translation of the thirteenth sentence:
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	Here is the translation of the fourteenth sentence:

Here is the translation of the fifteenth sentence:
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	Here is the translation of the sixteenth sentence:

Capitol .xliv.	Here is the translation of the forty-first sentence:
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of cauterization for gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And if there is a cure for gout caused by cold humors and the pain remains, then it should be cauterized.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And you should cauterize around the joint of the foot with a cautery tool.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	The cautery iron should be made of olive wood, and it should have this shape:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make punctures on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery iron.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pain rises into the testicles or other joints, and it refuses to go away, then cauterize every testicle with three or four cauteries using this olive wood cautery iron.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if it is necessary to use this cautery iron, then cauterize it and do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery iron beforehand, but simply touch the surface of the skin.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pain rises into the testicles and scrotum, then administer the cautery that we have discussed in its chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pain is only in the hands and it is called sciatica, then make punctures around the circle of the joints where they rotate, puncturing in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pain remains in the fingers, then make punctures around the joints of the fingers on each knuckle and at the base of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pain rises into the hips or muscles, then cauterize each of these parts all around with cautery.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	Do not discharge the patient from good treatment and reception of medicines, for if good treatment is performed and phlegm is discharged with this cautery, may God help them heal.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of cauterization for broken bones.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a break in the angles and tears in front of the intestines into the generative organ, and it starts to come out, then you should order the patient to stop eating for his day and to use cooling remedies so that the wound does not come out of his belly.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then follow the patient's instructions on how to hold his body and command him to keep his air within that is either vomited or the intestines or hernia comes out.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	Then return it with your fingers and signal the broken bone by feeling around the knee, signaling the end of which is similar to half a circle at the upper parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then light the cautery iron of which this is the shape:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	while it is still red and burning.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Then place the cautery iron on that signal with your hand holding the cautery iron upright, and put it there until you feel the bone within the joint of the elbow; and repeat with another cautery iron if you have not achieved it in the first application onto the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And be careful with the feeling of the hernia during the time of cauterization, that you do not burn it so that it does not come over the patient and cause death or some great harm.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you with the cautery do not touch the bone, your operation will not succeed.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And see that the cautery of children be subtle according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Then treat the place of cauterization for three days with an ointment while the scar of the fire is healing.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then cure it with other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And let the patient lie on his back for 40 days while the place is sealed and the wound closed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And see that he is fed according to the length of time of his cure which wounds the belly, and let the hernia not come out through exertion while healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when he wants to get up after 40 days, then administer a decently made bandage and have him for another 40 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let him be restless and full of appetite for food and drink, and of vigorous spirits, for when he uses this remedy of healing entirely it will heal.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And if you desire to cure broken bones in other parts of the belly, and especially at the beginning, then cauterize the break according to its quantity, and it is what is exhausted from the chest like the third part of it; then cure it with what we have said, and it is not closed.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And now, first of all, let the broken bone be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this shape, then feel it with your hand:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is placed a line that extends along the width on the side above the break, and another line above it; and your hand held with a cautery nail, yet the first cautery is easier and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of cauterization for torticollis.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When there is pain in any member from a blow or from striking, and the pain persists for a long time and does not respond to any treatment with medicines, then see that you cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And let the cautery be for each member according to its size and smallness, and according to its weakness and heaviness, and according to the location of torticollis and pain in it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	So if he is healed by the first cautery, then it is; and if not, then repeat the cautery on him; for usually of those pains are punctured in a member near to which member he approaches, so that you know them with the cautery where the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of cauterization for leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	The leper some times with cautery for great healing, and by magicking if the leprosy that is made by putrefaction of phlegm and of melancolia.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so when you want to cauterize it, consider if the leprosy is putrid and as that cured with what we have said in the division and not of them, nor of this, and fear about the patient that the corruption includes all his body and all its complexions, then cauterize him on the head with V cauteries: with one in the middle location of the head, and with the second lower down from him, lift the forehead at the ends of the hair; and both over the horns; and with one behind, over the nape or servitz.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally your hand with the cautery press a little into the bone, and from him are displaced the scales, so that the expiration of thick vapors is eased from him; then cauterize over the pustule according to how it is prescribes.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy is already expanded over the patient and appears manifestly, then see that you cauterize him with those cauteries which we have said in the head; and cauterize on the end of the nose, and with two cauteries on the two eyelids, and with two cauteries on the two shoulder blades, and with six cauteries over the shoulder blade, and one great over the shoulder blade near the armpit, and one on the armpit, and with two over the elbows, and one on each elbow, and with two over the hips, and one on each hip, and with two over the thighs, and one over each thigh, and with two over the knees, and one on each knee, and with two over the shins, and one on each shin, and with two over the ankles, and one over each ankle, and with two over the insteps, and one on each instep, and with two over the heels, and one on each heel, and with two over the toes, and one on each toe, and with two over the fingers, and
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	Be careful of the nerves that are on the heel, lest you burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes a cautery is applied to the bones of the penis and another to the mouth of the stomach, and another to the intestines.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more you apply cauteries, the more beneficial and effective they are; and know that the patient does not feel pain from the cautery, just as with the fingers, because his body is already numbed.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And you should make the cauteries large or small according to the parts and joints, according to what is specified by the characteristics of the tools.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then dress the wound with wheat flour mixed with honey and other healing remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization for stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is paralyzed or asleep and is not healed by medicines, oils, and poultices, then you should cauterize that paralyzed limb with cauteries according to the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter the thickness of the skin a little bit.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then dress that with ointment until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes a stupor is cauterized where the nerves that move the limb and the feet are, and the vertebrae of the back, and see the movement of the nerves that move that limb, and the stupor is eliminated.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not presume about this unless you are knowledgeable in the anatomy of the limbs and the emergence of nerves throughout the body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On cauterization for white leprosy.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When white leprosy is old and does not respond to any of the medicinal ointments, then you should cauterize it with a red-hot cautery a little bit according to the thickness of the skin so that the whiteness and color are eliminated, and the color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	Then dress that with wheat flour and lentil flour mixed with rose oil, and with leaves of the wild rosemary plant, and with pigeon blood or guinea fowl blood; let each be a separate portion and all be mixed together, and then have it bound up in a linen cloth and placed over the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On cauterization for cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When a cancer has begun and you want it to stop, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around its circumference as it is rolling around.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle of it; but I have not seen this, because I fear that it would cause an ulcer, and I have seen this happen a few times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is much better that it be cauterized around its circumference with a circular cautery, as we have said, or with many cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On cauterization for suppuration.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When suppuration is delayed in ripening, and this is due to excess, or due to the state of the patient who is old and emaciated, or due to time, and you want to hasten the ripening of suppuration; then cauterize around it with many small puncturing cauteries; and then let that hasten its ripening.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want to pierce it with a cautery, then heat the cautery of which this is the shape of it; and then place that in the middle of suppuration so that it penetrates the skin.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is in that place that is lower down, so that the arm is lifted up; and then dress that until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cauterization for corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a decaying that walks through the limb, which corrodes it as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore if you see corrosion in a place that can be cauterized with fire, then heat small nail-like cauteries, and make them large according to what is appropriate in the place where there is corrosion.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	Then cauterize that completely all over so that you eradicate all of the corrosion and do not leave any cause for it to return.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Then let that be bound up for three days, and place your fingers over the cauterized spots with soft pressure so that the scars are all eradicated and all of the corrosion.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	Then dress that with ointments that generate flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see that the flesh is not growing and there is still corrosion, then repeat the cautery over that which is rotten in the places of corruption.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrosion is sometimes treated with sharp medicine because it is intermediate in the place of cauterization.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nevertheless cauterization with fire is more beneficial.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already spoken of its cure with sharp medicine in the division; and therefore take that when there is an increased tendency from it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On cauterization for warts and similar growths.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Sometimes there are growths below the foot of the patient who is sick, which is called a wart, and it is a large cause, deep, which affects the foot; and cauterization in these is according to two manners: cauterization with fire and cauterization with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cauterization with fire is that you ignite the cautery made of iron according to the amount that it contains the wart all over, and let it be of thin margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then place that ignited cautery over the wart, and then move your hand with the cautery around the circumference of the wart so that the cautery reaches the depth of the wart.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Let that be bound up for three days until it begins to emit pus from the arm.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then dress that with wild mallows crushed with salt, and place the poultice over that for one night, because that will uproot it from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	Then dress the wound with ointment that generates flesh until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and sometimes it affects the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then have a cauldron with water that is boiling hot, and pour that over the cautery; and take a quannula made of brass or iron or of stone, and place that over the wart; and let there be a little amount of the hot water that has been poured into the quannula, and hold it with your hand, and move that all around so that you compress it with the quannula from all sides, and press the margin of the quannula into the root of the wart, and pour the hot water into the cauldron through the quannula, and let the patient bear that for an hour, and then remove that because the wart will have been uprooted.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And do this to all of them in turn throughout their bodies.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	Then dress those warts whose roots have been eradicated with these ointments that generate flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 54.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cauterization for trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When there is trembling due to friction on the nerves or due to fever from a similar cause, or due to another cause that seems like it, then have him cauterized with four cauteries or with v on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cautery; and cauterize his feet, and on the chest with cauterization of olives.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of him is calmed and hastened by the sickness that causes it.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of cauterization of white wounds on the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there are white spots and pustules that are caused by thick, corrupted material; therefore, at the beginning when they appear, they should be cauterized on top of the fistula with a fine-tipped cautery tool made of mastic tree bark, the end of which is heated; or with a long, sharp needle; or with a lenticular cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is cauterized at the beginning of its emergence according to this manner; and they are not believed to be wounds, but rather a disruption of superfluities caused by these things, and then they heal.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it is better that this should be done with an evacuation using phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter 56.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of the cauterization of a flow of blood caused by an incision of an artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Sometimes a flow of blood from an artery that is cut due to a wound, or due to the incision of an abscess or cauterization of a limb, and similar cases, are difficult to stop.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when this happens to someone, you must cover the orifice of the artery with your hand and place your finger inside to constrict it, thus stopping the flow of blood from below your finger, and preventing it from coming out again.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then place over the fire a few large olive-wood coals, as many times as needed, and blow on them so that they ignite.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	Then take one of those coals, either small or large depending on the location and severity of the wound, and apply it quickly to the vein that is bleeding profusely after you have constricted it with your finger, cauterizing it until the blood is stanched and the flow restricted.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood flows from the artery when you release your finger and loosen the cautery, then take another cautery that has been prepared in the fire, and continue doing this repeatedly until the blood is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to burn the nerve that is here, and to cause any other evil for the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to restrict the flow in those except by one of four means: either by cauterization as we have said, or by ligation if it has not been ligated; for when it is ligated the ends of it are burned and the flow restricted, or that it be bound with a ligature or with a ligature by strong constriction, or that remedies which restrict the flow be placed over it; and it is bound with a bandage with decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who provides decent restriction of it with ligature and constriction with a cloth, or by position of causes burning and similar, does not confer except for the worst.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the doctor is not present nor are remedies, then open with the tip of your finger over the orifice of that vein as we have said before, and apply strong constriction to it until the flow of blood is stopped from the main part of the wound; and over the artery the finger should not be released; and over the artery, rub with water mixed with something very cold until the blood congeals and thickens; and if there is a need for cauterization or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and piercing, of punctures and phlebotomy, of wounds and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter about all illnesses for which fire cauterization and burning remedies are convenient, and the occasions and causes of them, and the instruments necessary for them with the forms of the cauteries; and we have arranged the chapters from the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And we will proceed in this chapter in that same way, so that the reader may be eased, then on what he has demanded.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before we begin this, let us remind you that what is in this chapter is for horror and terror as it is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And therefore, let it be with great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter there are many times evacuation which is by blood, by which life is removed from the sprinkling of the vein or incision upon the abscess or opening of the wound or piercing of the incision or extraction of arrow or incision of stone or their likes.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And from all of them are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in their hands is death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that it may not happen to you in which there is treachery; for sometimes it happens because of the ways of men with many illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them is he who goes away because of his illness and because of the length of his illness, and because the illness means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those is he who gives you his word and promise, you hoping for his health; and his illness is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not consent to him who comes to you in this manner; and your caution should be greater than his cunning and your greed; and do not presume any cause on that unless there is certain science which verifies it for you, and from whom laudable success comes.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your illnesses for prediction and indication of him who is converted to health; for in him are you helped in the acquisition of fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O, sons, may God inspire your understanding and not hide from you direction and protection; for it is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.
