And I have ordered this chapter distinguished by chapters according to which it precedes in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure of the head down to the feet, so that it may be eased for you from what you demand and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water which is contained in the head of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness many times happens to infants because of childbirth, and when the mother stretches her neck.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it is caused by a hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this illness except in infants; and to all of them to whom I have seen it, death has come to them, and thus is my experience with them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen an infant whose head was filled with water, and his head was always magnified so that he could not control himself due to the size of his head, but rather that the humidity increased greatly until fire caused death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is either accumulated between the brain and the bone, or is accumulated below the bone on the skull.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation in that if the humidity is between the brain and the bone and the abscess is slight, then you should make an incision in the middle of the head with an incision in the width, and the length of the incision should be two inches so that the humidity can run out; and this is the form of spatum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the humidity is increased and the abscess is greater, then there are two incisions according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is below the bone, the sign of it is that you see the seams of the head opened to all parts and the water is pressed when you compress that with your hand to the parts within; and this is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Cut in three places in the middle of the head according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then extract all moisture and tightly bandage the incisions with fabric and feathers. On the fifth day, open the bandages and apply wine and oil to the wound; loosen the ligature and treat the wound with tenting and poultices, and bandage the head tightly with equal pressure. Feed the patient dry food with little moisture until the affected member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision which takes into account the size of the abscess and the collection of fluid. Sometimes it is more appropriate to make an incision on the back of the neck, or in front, or on the right side, or on the left; therefore pay attention to where the abscess appears and the fluid collects, and open that up as best you can.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And there is another way to treat an abscess when it is accompanied by a headache: make an incision at the site of pain, and open the abscess to its cavity. Another method for cauterization is as follows:
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of incisions in the arteries near the ears, called hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there is a problem in the ears or feet, and it is old, and the treatment with medicines does not work, then the last treatment is to open those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore when you want to cut the arteries that run through the head, and then rub the area with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then tightly bandage the neck of the patient with a cloth; and consider where the pulse is beating; and the locations of each one over the areas where the ears are depressed, and they remain hidden in some people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then press on the artery with a tent, and cut each one with a sharp instrument through the bone into the head, and open up to the width of the skull.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the instrument below the artery and cut through it into the cavities above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be two digits long, because when a vein is cut, blood rushes out in pulsating bursts, which jumps out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the measurement, then measure from the ear the amount of space of three digits, and press with a tent, and cut through the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And let what comes out of the blood be the quantity of wine of an ounce, and quickly pour in from it more or less, and all that is according to the quantity that appears of the nature of the patient and the collection of the artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And consider the wound; therefore if any cause remains on the bone, then cut it out so that an abscess does not form.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And tightly bandage the wound with feathers and strips of linen cloth, and cure it with poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of extraction of the arteries in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When to someone happens migraine or catarrh, because of hot and bitter humors and because of qualities in the temples, or violent old disease similar to those, and it is treated with methods of medical cure and that does not work, then we have discovered for such illnesses extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of operation and extraction of those is that the patient feels them in his temples; understand the artery as it appears in the temple because it is shown to you by your pulse, and it is hidden except in a few people because of the violence of the pulse.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then tightly bandage the neck of the patient with some cloth; and rub the area with a rough cloth or moisten the spot with warm water until you see the artery clearly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the instrument, which has this shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then pierce the vein with it easily until you reach the artery; and then pour into it onti and extract that to the upper parts, until you pull it out of the vein and discover that beneath it, from all directions.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is fine, then wrap it around with the end of the instrument, and cut one part according to the amount by which its ends are stretched and contracted, and no blood will flow out; for if they are not cut, blood will not flow at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And let the blood flow out of wine of an ounce, within three hours.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then tie it in two places with strong double-fold wool or with cords, and do not cut it off before the consolidation of the wound and let blood flow out.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And cut the superfluity which is between two ligatures; do this in that hour, or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize it with a cautery into the bone with a cautery knife so that its ends are cut off, and stay in place of that work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better that the patient has fever or is of hot disposition; for cauterization is of those causes which help to drive out fine humors, and therefore it is better in youth.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And therefore let the extraction of the arteries that affect the old wound; and have it bandaged with decently made powders, and let it be cured with dry medicines which make the flesh grow and with poultices until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you operate another outbreak of blood occurs from the artery, then tie that blood off, or with cauterization, or cut at the site of the wound, and tightly hold your hand over it so that the blood is restricted.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes are present to you, then place your finger over the spot so that the blood is coagulated, and moisten the spot with hot water of strong heat until the ache is relieved, and tightly bandage according to where it hurts most.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is best in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two prongs; because you have felt the two spots with a tent, and place each one, put out fire, within the bone so that they pierce the vein in two places, so that it is stretched out between its ends, because they are not consolidated at all by this cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And let the ache of both prongs be removed.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if it is better to have sharp ache with two prongs; because if they are blunt they will approach each other when rubbed, and not cut the flesh quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore when there is any thickness in them, the heat of the fire is held in them and the flesh is cut more easily.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all work, and moreover easier.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space which is between two prongs be the quantity of the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter IV.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the cure of acute and sour pains in the bowels.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When they are sour pains, and it is the veins of those which are over the head, and no medicine works in that cure, and sometimes the face of the patient becomes red and feels in his forehead as if it were stung by ants, and his bowels are exhausted, and moisture comes out from inside because his skin is hot; and the ancient cure for those is cauterization.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to shave the hairs on their forehead, and then cut three equal incisions in the forehead according to its length.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two digits: let the first incision be equally distant according to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a little more than the movement of the eyelids which are in the lacrimal gland, and the third from the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of the incision of the arteries which are on both sides, and lengthen your hand from the continuation of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space between each incision is the quantity of three digits, adjust it.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge prepared with dry rags with which to absorb the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then insert the spatula of two acute ends, of which this is the form of its incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the part of the temples into the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excavate with that all the gum which is between two incisions with the chisel which is on top of the bone, and then do the same with the middle incision into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	Then place that spatula and insert it into the first incision again, but this time use another instrument called a cutellar, which is sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place the side of that sharp one against the gum attached to the bone, and the other side against the tooth, and push it in until you reach the middle incision, and cut with it all the vessels which descend from the head to the jaw.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Let the incision continue until it reaches the gum, and then do the same in the middle incision into the other incision.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when blood has flowed in equal quantity from both sides, squeeze out the places of congealed blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then place in each incision a piece of cotton wool, and place over it powdery paste made with wine vinegar and oil, and bandages so that an ulcer will not form by cauterization.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day loosen the ligature and administer copious poultices of warm water or tea, and then treat it with basilicon ointment made with rose oil and others so that the wounds heal.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5:
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment of ulcers with cauteries and the jaws which descend from the parts inside the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When to someone come cauteries and they continue, and you see the jaw of the patient emaciated little, and the care of them is weakened, and the eyelids are ulcerated and from them hair has fallen, and in the forehead there is acute pain and consequent tension, then know through these accidents that the matters and cauteries do not come except from small vessels which proceed from inside.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is this: command the patient to shave his forehead, and then cut an incision in the middle of the forehead, a little according to its breadth (and begin with the incision of the left temple into the right temple; and let it be an incision into the bone; and lengthen your hand from the eyelids of the temples which are mauled because of chewing), so that the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Absorb all blood with a sponge or dry cloth and then fill between the two lips of the incision with old cotton wool or with poultice.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then bandage it with powdery paste made with wine vinegar and oil so that an ulcer will not form by cauterization.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you loosen it and see that the ulcer has already diminished, then know that the bone is rubbed where it begins in the native flesh of the jaw, and then cure it with an astringent regimen which makes the flesh dry, just as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of rosin and mix them, and from this make plaster and administer it to these wounds.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6:
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the treatment of that which cauterizes in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The cause of cauterization in the ears is one of four things: either mineral stone or something similar to stone, like iron and glass, or it is from plants like chickpeas and beans, or it is volatile like water and wine and their likenesses, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when stone cauterizes in the ear or other similar cause of those causes which do not form a callus in the ear, and hang the ear to the sun, and if you see the stone, then distill into it some cause of oil of violets or sesame, and then administer its extraction, and make it sneeze with snuff, and stop up the nostril from the activity of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	Then place in the circumference of the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to its parts above, for many times it is perforated with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not perforated, then administer its extraction with the instrument called an epicyclic subtile whose form is this:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is perforated with the gesti, well and good; but if not, then administer its extraction with a subtle hook of slight doubling.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore if it is not perforated by that, then make a cannula of bronze and insert the end of the cannula into the hole in the ear and close around the cannula with wax and softened oil so that nothing but the cannula comes out.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with your own hand with strong traction, for many times it is dragged along with that which we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not perforated in this manner, then take alum or hollow brass prepared with which the ears are pressed with a little quantity, and place that on the end of the jaw, and then wrap around it decently a bandage placed.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	Then insert that into the hole in the ear with ease, and then dry the ear of moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore if it is not perforated with all the causes which we have recounted, then you cut short that in front so that it does not form an ulcer by cauterization or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting it short is that at the beginning you cause to flow in the ear of the vein of the sephasic vein and extract the blood according to the manner of its nature, and then make it sneeze between your hands and turn the ear to its parts above, and finish with a small incision in the root of the ear from the gray matter of it in the place which is pressed by it.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the incision be in the shape of the moon so that it reaches the stone, and when the stone is found, push it out with appropriate instruments; then close up the incision at that time with speed, and cure it so that it heals.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause which cauterizes in the ear is one of the gums which grows and inflates, then administer its cure and extraction; but if it does not obey your command, then take a subtle hook according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with that the incision of that gum which is fallen in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place that in many pieces, and then extract those with pins or with a subtle hook, or by incision as we have said before, for the extraction of it is delayed.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which is entered into the ear when the patient sneezes at the beginning, and fills his own ear with some old cotton wool, and put on that ear in which there is the water, and if by this it is perforated, well and good; but if not, then take thin pieces of stone and lean them according to its length, and heat those in the fire a little, and let the patient insert one of those into the hole of his ear and suck on one of that part and press with another stone over the stone which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not stop until all the water has been drained out.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And once the water has been drained, you can use paper or linen to place one end in the ear and extend the other end with fire until it is burnt.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then place another piece of linen and do this as many times until all the water has been drained, and then apply the stone extractor as previously described.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But if a foreign object is stuck in the ear and it's small, use a pair of tweezers to remove it as described earlier for a stone. However, if the cause is something large and lodged deep inside the ear canal, then use forceps or similar tools. The cause of this is usually a bee or something similar that got stuck in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But if the cause is a worm that has grown inside the ear, and you have treated it as described in the section on distillation without success, then you should examine the ear in sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see any sign of the worm, then remove it with forceps or a thin, pointed instrument. But if there are no signs of a worm, take a cannula that is narrow at one end and wider at the other, which should look like this:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	Insert the narrow end into the ear according to how much pain the patient can tolerate. Then, create a strong suction with your mouth and do this several times until all the worms are removed.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if the patient does not cooperate, then close off one end of the cannula with wax as described earlier. Then, administer distillation remedies that have already been mentioned in the treatment of worms and you will find them in the section on distillation.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And use this instrument to pour your medicinal oils into the ear, which should look like this:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make the spout out of silver or lead, narrow at the bottom and wider on top with a small hole in it.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And then place the oil inside the container so that it stays in the spout as needed.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the rod and wrap it with cotton at one end, then pour oil into the cavity of the ear, or sap from herbs, or any of these medicines in the cannula —and insert the rod with the cotton end first and squeeze it with your hand to release the medicine into the cavity of the ear so that the patient can feel the medicine inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been put in the ear should already be warmed by fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the cause you are treating in the ear is not too warm because ear medicine does not tolerate heat well.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7:
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ear infections.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some children are born with a hernia in their belly button that does not heal, and this also happens to some adults, an infection in the middle of the ear drum or from a wound in the outer part of the ear; and this infection sometimes occurs in the membrane of the eardrum, and sometimes in the external parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And the one that occurs in the drum, which does not involve the eardrum, is more difficult to heal.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And when you manage to get the eardrum involved, make sure that the patient faces the sun and examine it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see any swelling, open it with a thin spatula, which should look like this:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	The end of the spatula should be narrow and one side pointed while the other is not, and it should have two edges that do not cut into the ear drum.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the infection is caused by flesh grown in the ear or in the middle of it, then remove it with a thin instrument and cut it off aggressively so that all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the infection is in the drum of the ear, take a thin rod made of lead and heat it slightly, then insert it into the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And if you feel any swelling with something that the patient feels easily due to pressure, relieve that pressure easily; and make sure not to irritate the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then place a piece of linen in the ear according to the size of the opening you have made with the Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure that the wound has healed; or take some cotton and soak it in vinegar and sprinkle it on the wound, then use this to dress the wound. And if you see that the ear drum is already formed, then remove the old dressing and replace it with new one that you have soaked in rosin oil so that the wound will heal quickly. Then treat the patient until he is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if there is blood flow, then soak a sponge or piece of linen in cold water and place it over the ear; and use the other treatment that restricts blood flow which is mentioned in the section on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8:
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of athezil that affects the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezil that affects the eyelids of the eyes sometimes has a moist appearance, and sometimes it is dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, take them off with tweezers or a pointed instrument, and cut them with the edge of the spatula, then place it over the affected area.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with blood flow, then cauterize them with a small, thin pointed instrument.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is when you cut them and pull them out several times after removing any cause of their roots; and when they are cauterized by fire, those roots are burnt and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9:
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	On the treatment of grandeyssa that affects the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many times it occurs in the eyelids of the eyes due to some cause that is similar to grandeyssa in its strength and hardness, and because of this, grandeyssa is named.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture under the eyelid and above it.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	And its appearance is that you should examine if the grandeyssa is coming from under the eyelid and is raised in all directions; and the cause of it is coldness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make an incision along the length of it and then scrape it from all sides so that it can drain, and then close it with a needle and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not equipped to make an incision and do not want to puncture the eyelid just a little, then this will not notice any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you should stitch it and treat it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it's small, it won't get worse because the eye will restore it and heal it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the grandeyssa is declining towards the inner sides of the eyelid, then cut off the outer part and pull it; another that you should not cut off the edge of it, and press all around it, and if the eyelid is stretched by incision, then this will not notice any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Then, after the incision, wash the eye with salted water; and treat the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the cure of a ulcer on the eyelid above the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A ulcer is gray in color and is generated in the membranes of the eyelid above, and mostly affects infants, harming their sight and causing tears to them. And they cannot see the brightness of the sun because of this.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of this, you will see them wiping their faces all the time, and sleeping on their faces; and if you press the area with your fingers, you will feel swelling within them. And when you wet the eyelids of these people, inflammation and a bulge become apparent in the eye; and when you wet the area, you can feel the bulge within them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And there is another way of operating on this condition when the patient rests his head in your lap, and you place a cloth over him and make him warm, and then draw a circle around him according to how much space he contains all around, and then place that over the affected area and press with your fingers all around so that the inflammation is drawn into the center of the circle. Then open up the moisture with a spatula by making an incision along the length, but not larger than the incision made in flabotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the lower part of the eyelid, be careful not to cut into the tendon all the way through so as not to reach the inflammation, because in most cases the inflammation comes through the incision along the length according to the shape of a white line.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then remove it with cloths which you have wrapped between your fingers at the edges, and move it around between your right and left hand until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to push into the eye with the spatula, lest you damage the eye while doing this.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see inflammation at the beginning of the incision, but see it within the incision, then push a little into the incision with your spatula so that the inflammation comes out; and then remove it as we have said; and then wet the area with water and wine and place bandages over it.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And if any pus is left in the cavity of the incision, then put salt and bread into the incision to soak up that moisture.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then care for it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if an ulcer develops at the site of cauterization, then cure that with mild poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of ways of treating eye disorders.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of the eyes become swollen due to inflammation caused by the natural hairs growing downward and becoming entangled, this causes eye disorders characterized by excessive tears, inflammation of the eyelids and tissues, which can lead to destruction of the eye, and is treated in four ways: either by cauterization with fire; or with a sharp instrument as described in the chapter on cautery; or by incision and suturing; or by using canes as I will describe.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	Now, place the patient's head in your lap; then lift up the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is lifted, that is good; otherwise, insert a needle into the part where you see pus below the eyelid, and push the needle upwards beyond the margin of the eyelid, close to where the hairs are growing downward, and pull the pus out towards the top of the eyelid, and convert the eyelid with your thumb.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Then open up the part within the eyelid beneath the entangled hairs with a spatula inserted into the tear duct of the upper tear duct; then remove the pus and place small pieces of cotton or cloth below the eyelid, and then bind the eyelid with a bandage, and let it remain as if it were a leaf of myrtle.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But the shape should be according to the amount of swelling of the eyelid, because this varies among people; for some it is necessary that a large amount be removed from the eyelid, according to how much the eyelid is swollen.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then open up with the spatula along the two lines which you have marked, and begin at the tear duct of the upper tear duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is close to the natural hairs as it should be, then cut off the grosstude.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	Then insert the hook in one of the two angles of the pouch, and then scrape away all that which is within; and then pull the two edges together with a suture or with thread made of fine wool, and wipe away the blood, and attach what hangs over the two eyelids by some means, if you want to do so, or else do not cure it.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	Then let the suture of the eyelids be for three days or four, and then care for it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you want, remove the bandage after the suturing, and care for it with something that dries and draws together, because the eyelid is raised due to the sealing of the bandage and the collection of fluids; but suturing is better. Therefore, I have told you these ancient remedies.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But it should be done gently on the patient, and it is a good operation, and there is no cause for fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	There is another way of treating it, and that is to make on the eyelid a figure like a leaf of myrtle, and then lift up the eyelid with three nails separated and gathered together according to this shape:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible to do this, and the nails are not available, then take a needle with thread and insert that into the center of the figure, and push the other end towards the upper tear duct; and then pull on the nails so that they gather together equally, and then with your thumb, lift up your hand with an equal lifting action, and lift up all the pouch over which you have made the mark as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then pull together the two edges of the bandage with a suture, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an ulcer develops due to your incision or your opening, then treat that ulcer with ointment and something similar, and with bandages.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And if the eyelids are ever inverted due to the entangled hairs, then use what we have said about incision; but suturing in each case is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Treating it with canes is done like this:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you lift up the eyelid and split the figure which is within according to what I have described; then with skill, make two canes or two slender sticks whose length is according to the length of the eyelid and whose width is less than the width of a spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already split at the ends of some of the parts where you have threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then gather each one with subtlety below what is surplus of the eyelid of the eye, and tie the canes at some parts with strong binding, and let it remain for several days; because the pouch will die and become blackened and fall off due to the tightness.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then cut it with scissors, and then care for the bandage until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Then when it is solidified, the eyelid will be raised and the hairs will not poke.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the way of making two canes like this:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the amount of length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of lifting up hairs that poke into the eye with a needle when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When they are by non-natural hairs, hard and rough and pungent the roots, then the operation on him is that you take a subtle needle and place it in that veil of fine linen and lion, and then that you attach the extremities of it and nuts each in a very subtle way.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the veils be the quantity of a palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you lay another subtle veil beneath him quickly, and tie the extremities of that if you wish to.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's head in your lap, and be near the sun so that your work is revealed, for it is a subtle and minute operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle at the root of the hair that needs treatment, and make it penetrate the eyelid quickly while extracting it above the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out from above and insert that into the eye, and let there be one or two or three hairs, and not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand away so that the hair is withdrawn with the eyelid with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is pulled out and the hair is not extracted, pull out the eyelid at its edges with the veil which you have composed with that, so that in being extracted, the eyelid comes out over the natural hair.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And you wash that with the vision of the eye, for then you will take out the eyelid and the veil, and let them heal each and close the eye for two or three days, until the hair sticks to its place and grows above good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if it is longer, then you attach a long hair of the natural hairs, and it is elevated with that, or you insert it so that it is drawn up by some space, and then you elevate that.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter .XIII.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure of a hunchback which comes on the eyelid above.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there is hunchback in the eye, and it is contraction of the eyelid when it is contracted on its own, or to the right or left side, by bad consolidation of plague or incision or cautery, and this hunchback, or it is natural or accidental, and it is made by consolidation of plague or incisions or cautery, or by similar to them badly treated.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The way of the operation on him is that you split that consolidation and separate its lips, and place in him in what is between a piece of linen thread, and tie those so that they heal.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not think that you use treatment of him from the causes which dry out; for if you do that, hunchback returns worse than at any time there was before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that of causes which soften as it is fenugreek, and mix with the water in which there are altae and seed of li, or ointment of diaquilon, which shall be liquefied by some of the oils, and submerge in that the piece, and cure with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you pierce with all skill that is not consolidated according to the form it was at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said is not anything but a rectification of ehalixacrati that does not return the form of the place according to what it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter .XIV.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of hunchback which is made in the eyelid below.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This hunchback which is made in the eyelid below, which is named veritably hunchback; and it is of him some natural, other accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental is made by plague or incision or cautery or by others similar.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of the operation on him is that you take a needle in which there is double thread, and put that into the flesh, and make it pass from the tear duct of left to the tear duct of right, so that the thread comes out in both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then stretch the flesh at the edges above with the needle and sew that with the needle, and insert it with ample spatula.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And so if the shape of the eyelid returns according to how it should be, it is good; and if not, take the needle and pause that in the split shape, and with that convert the eyelid, and split the two fissures on the sides of the eyelid below.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of the two fissures be of two angles of the incision, which you have made so that they meet, and let an angle be made of them when they come together, and a figure be made of them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is Greek letter: the land.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then stop the flesh that by the quantity it is the side of him acute below of him, that binds the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then attach the separated parts and sew those with the thread of wool; and then cure those with what we have said of the medicines softening and of the leeches so that it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if hunchback comes through incision or suture or cautery, then you must split with a flat incision over the hairs of the eyelid according to what is preceded.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with the leech between two lips according to what we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the speech of the cure of hunchback when it is above or below, that the operation runs on him, according to how it is prepared in the form of hunchback, and that is in form of many different things.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artisans always prepare skill in every way that is possible for him so that he makes the figure return to the natural form, or close to it, and the patient according to what suits him of the operation and the instruments in the greatest dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter .XV.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid with the conjunctiva or with the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation happens to many men so that the eyelid is adhered more above with the white of the eye, and it is prohibited from the facility of movement and its natural works, then you must insert the outer edge below the eyelid, and lift it up there, or stretch it out with the finger.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you insert the adhesion with a subtle spatula, which is not sharp at the edges, have a little blunt so that the patient is not troubled after the operation, and remove the spatula so that it does not hurt the eye by its acuteness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And let your incision split that adhesion with facility so that the eyelid returns according to its natural form, and all the adhesion is healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then put in the eye salted water with which you wash it; or distill in it wine dissolved in the water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the eye with a leech of li, and pause over the eye wool soaked in white of egg, and then on the third day use causes consolidating so that it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter .XVI.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of incision of nail and of prominence of flesh of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that nail is according to two ways, for it is nervous, and is similar to hard thin ciphac; or it is non-nervous, similar to white humidity congealed, which when the iron touches it, or is forced, takes on a horn, is cut off and the horn is not put in him.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both species do not begin unless from the major tear duct as it goes little by little covering the sight and forbid light and the movement of eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the way of working in the incision of him is that the patient pauses his head in your lap, and then open his eyes, and lift up the eyelid with your hand, and then collect the nail with horn of little duplication, and stretch it to the edges above.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	Then take a needle and pierce it with a horsehair or ox hair, or the like, or with strong twine, doubling the end of the needle little by little and thrusting it into the middle of the nail, piercing it with the needle, and binding it with twine; draw it to the upper parts, and with the hair scrape the sides of the nail which close up the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And thus you will follow it with the hair to his back.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then insert the remainder into the root of the tear duct with a delicate spatula or with small forceps, and cut the flesh of the natural tear duct so that through this incision it does not cause continuous flow of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail is extended with salt or twine, as we have said, and then it is scraped with a lion's tooth spatula, of which this is its form:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And beware of touching the cornea with the spatula and causing rupture in it, and that the pupil be perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then throw a little powdered salt or vinegar made from wine into the hole and let it remain until the next day; and then heal that with water that covers it so that it may be cured.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot put the needle into it or pierce it with the twine, then this kind of nail is cured by medicines, and is healed thus as the eye, and also made whole in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to split it, then open the hole of the patient and take a lion' s-tooth spatula, sharpened according to this form:
am subtilitat.	with subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if you see that it is rarefied and drawn in and the root is affected, then distill from your mouth into the hole vinegar made of wine or with red wine or with powdered salt, and close up the hole until the next day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the operation on it until everything is taken from it; unless that, in contrast, a wound cauterization is in the hole, for then you cut into it and heal the wound at its beginning so that it may be cured.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat your operation on it with reason until it is cured.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The membrane of the tear duct, if noticed in the hole by great injury, is suspended with twine; and insert that from that one part, and do not finish the incision so that it does not cause flow of tears.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And then distill into the tear duct red wine and vinegar made of wine until it is cured.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of incision of aulacero and of what has been born from flesh pressed into the hole.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the holes of the eye there is born red flesh, and it is superimposed so that it covers the pupil, or it approaches or draws near upon the eyelids and strongly compresses the eyelids to the parts outside and is attached to the bulbar conjunctiva.

And the operation in him is that the patient places his head on your lap; and then open the holes of him and collect all that flesh with convenient tongs for that, and you do that with a forceps or basket; and then split the flesh at the beginning so that everything is finished by the incision, and beware of the hole that you do not scorch it through your operation.

And your incision is with which you pierce those or with the spatula which we have recommended in the incision of the nail, or with small forceps with which it is gathered ash-gray according to its form: see this chapter.

Therefore when your incision is finished and all that flesh is drawn out, then fill the hole with powdered salt, or distill into it red powder and something like the medicines that are caustic, and place over the hole outside a bandage made of egg white so that it is secured from cauterization.

And if for some cause aulacero occurs and there is danger of cauterization wound, and you fear cauterization wound, then cut the hole and heal that wound with what makes that wound, and then repeat on it the operation until it is cured, and similarly do in the flesh that presses into the hole which causes this kind.

But indeed you should prevent all cure of the hole by natural or accidental way, working with iron, and not put your hand in any of these operations until you see that this member has suffered that operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of collection of ash-gray in the hole.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Ash-gray veins are red which are tested upon the hole and forbid its operation, and they draw out the hole over a period of days.

Therefore it is necessary at the beginning that you consider if the hole in which ash-gray is strong and in it there is not another illness other than ash-gray, then you collect that ash-gray.

o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two tongs gradually in one body according to this form:

But if it is not possible for you to collect it all in that hour, then you plaster it all with what makes his pain go away, and let him for several days until his pain is eased and it is secured from cauterization wound.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	Of reduction of hernia to the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you cure arisati by cauterization or with acute medicine burning according to what is preceded by its description and it is not cured, then there is no fire in him except that you split over the wound because of the maturity of it, and draw out all the humidity which is in him and the pus until its bone is uncovered.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And therefore when the bone is uncovered and you see in it corruption or blackness, then scrape it with a tool of which this is the form:
