E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is named from rough head, and let its tip be iron, and let the head be round so that it scrapes the which is frayed by piercing with file or sharpened with a pointed file (so that it is in the following form).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And place that over the corroded location of the bone, and then roll that between your fingers, and compress your hand little by little until you know that the corruption is scraped.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And let that be done several times, and then restore the location with astringent and styptic causes.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Therefore if the location is consolidated and good flesh has grown on it and the body of the wound has separated and there is no discharge or accident in it, then you know that it is cured.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	But if not, then there is no fire in it except to reduce the crack to the form of the nose, and according to this way: let you scrape according to bone with iron or with acute medicine, and when the bone is uncovered, then take tinder according to this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the end of his foot be triangularized, and let the shin of the foot be pulled out straight as well.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And then place that [the needle] on the bone, and let it be near to the tear; and lengthen your hand a little from the elbow, and then revolve your hand with the thread inside, so that it penetrates all of the bone, and that the patient feels the pain through as you draw out the breath through his mouth.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Then, restore the site with astringent medicines that dry up just like you have healed it.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	And when the meat and the site has become hardened, then the matter that was flowing from the orifices returns to the nose, therefore here is where the pus is on the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20:
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On reducing the prominence of the elbow.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the elbow protrudes in its entirety and does not occur with harm nor decrease in movement, then open up the patient, and then what follows is that you make a cautery on the neck by the scarification and sucking by good suction; and then place liniment on the elbow which is made of pitch, aloe, honey, and myrrh, and then tighten the bandage over the elbow with soft powder.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the way of making the powders is to take dry woolen rags and double each rag into four folds; and make with that.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place those one on top of another according to the quantity of which it has the elbow necessity.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then tighten over that with a hard cloth by strong compression; and repeat the suction by sucking without scarification; and then remove the suction and let the elbow be tight during the day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if in between the ligament has become soft, then let it be very tight.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then remove the bandage during the day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the elbow has been reduced, good, and if not, then repeat the bandage with the powders and compression and the suction until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21:
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	On the incision of the prominence of the venous tunica.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When a disruption occurs in the venous tunica and it is prominent and protrudes out from the eyelids like a grain of sand, and its shape resembles that of man by it, and you want to operate on it, then the operation on him is as we have mentioned: you insert the needle into the vein at the part below in the part above, and then insert the other needle in which there is a thread doubled at the part of the tear, and make that penetrate and let the first needle be according to its disposition; and then incise the site of the double vein and lift up with it the part of the tunica by the circuit of the needle and tighten it.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then remove the needle and place over the elbow wool infused in egg white and let it be until the thread falls down with the vein.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then cure the elbow with that which comforts it until the wound is healed.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes gather from all parts with a circle of cloth around the elbow by the prominent eminence greatly, and then it is perforated by the spatula sutilly so that the white humidity flows and the elbow descends and in the meantime.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And then tighten until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22:
De curacio de alconati.	On the cure of a hawk.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness which is called Alconati is not anything other than a boil which is adjusted in the elbow similar to water and is not that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	But the way of operating on it is that you make the patient sit upright and straight, and then take the head in your hands from two parts and hold him so that you see the boil coming out to the parts below, and then let it be dried up and not descend, and the light is obscured, and the patient sees the causes as he would.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not go down, know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if it is not prepared for the descending of the boil by what we have said, then make the patient sit between your hands and then take a spatula sutilly and fen over that on the covering of the eyeball a little from the continuation of the conjunctiva with the tunica cornea in the corona (in the eye socket) so that the boil is pushed out.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	And then when it is pushed out, then you distill into the elbow water tail in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have boiled fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be cured with the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 23:
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the cure of water descending from the elbow.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said about the species of water in division and which one convenes to pierce with a needle according to the health.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then make him sit between your hands over a chair and tie up his elbow tightly.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And then place near to the eyelid of his elbow your left hand, if the elbow in which there is the water is the left one; or with your right hand, if it is the right one.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And then take up the needle, if it is the left one; or with your other hand, if it is the right one.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And then place the end of the needle near to the crown by the thickness of the membrane in the white of the eye on the side of the lesser tear, and pierce the needle with force and revolve your hand with that.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And then penetrate into the white of the eye and feel that the needle has already come to the visible cause.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And let it be the distance of the path of the needle to the front by the measure of the space which is from the pupil in to the end of the blackness, and it is the crown of the eye; for you will see with that the pupil through the vision of the eye by the clarity of the tunica cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And then place the needle into the site in which there is the water, and then you draw it down a little and another, and therefore if the water descends at once, then see the patient on whose eye he breaks his vision at once, and the needle in the elbow.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then rest a little; therefore if the water has been drawn out, then you draw that other one before the needle is withdrawn.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And then when it is dried up and has not descended, then you withdraw the needle with ease, and revolve your hand a little by little, and then dissolve in the water a little of clear salt of gemma and wash the inside of the elbow; and then place outside the elbow a bandage or stop or wool infused in rose oil and egg white over that the elbow.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But us and those who are of our time to place over it combed with egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it does not yield to you the needle at the instrument of the eye by its hardness — for it is the bone of which the elbow is hard —, then let it be that you take the spatula which is called alberid of which this is the shape:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And then pierce with that the conjunction, and do not finish your hand at the thrust, and it is not if you make passage to the needle subtle site.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then insert the needle as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And when you have finished your work, let the patient be prepared for a descending sleep made in which he sleeps on his side in a dark room, and there is prohibited of all movements.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And place him in nature so that it is cooled his nature, and not turn his head to the right or left in any way.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let the ligature remain in place for the third day according to its position.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then untie it in that dark spot and expose the sore sight, and let him see some causes, and then return the ligature on the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And don't do this during the time of cure or immediately after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	You have to ensure that it's removed so that the water can easily pass through with great force and vigilance.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an abscess occurs, then untie the wound before the seventh day, and rectify that with something that reduces the abscess.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you open his eyes and place on his face a poultice that he should be treated with for several days, existing in the dark spot.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And then let him walk gradually and converse about his causes.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in some cases it is not excused for the disciple of vision to see some things, and then you should be careful about the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has come to us from some of those who are in the Artach , and some say that fire is made in the Ayrac by a perforated Magdaam through which water is sucked.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But I haven't seen it done in our land, nor have I read about it in any of the ancient books; and it's possible that this is new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the spices with which one should work on those who ignore them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of iron or steel properly, and their ends are shaped with this triangular subtlety, the acute end just like that is the shape.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter .XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure of a wound in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose there are various meats growing tightly attached to which is some cause that is assembled with the sting of a fly, or of a polyp, and this malady is called polypus because it resembles that fly represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And from it is cancerous meat, lumpy, of dusky colour; and from it is that is not leonine meat of dusky colour.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these leonine meats not fraudulent or cancerous, let the patient hold his hand over the sun, and open his nose, and prick with a needle the tip of his finger into those meats.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that to the parts of the foramen, and burn what you have understood from those with a pointed needle in the one part into which you know that all the meat is removed; if something remains in him of the cause of which the abscission is possible, then you treat it with one of the subtle instruments with ease so that nothing remains in him.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it bleeds or an abscess occurs, then you give to him something that he should drink; or if it is of the malignant abscesses, then you cut and cauterize that so that blood is shed and all the cavities are removed.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then let him drink in the nose after the incision wine or water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it there proceeds moisture into the palate, then know that it has healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate as you know, then you know that inside him is meat gone bad in the pustules of the nose to which no abscission has come.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore let you put bile in it to which there is some thickness, and in him make words with words, and place between each nut the quantity of the said or less, and turn the patient and place one end of the bile in the nose with the ray or with another cause that is possible to him.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And when he has done this, let him breathe in his odour to the channels of the nose, and it should come out over his throat, for troops of sights appear to those who do this action, and it is a slight cause to him that wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then place the two ends of the bile, one end that goes out over the nose and the other that goes in, and administer a cut of meat with the words that are in the bile, and do this so that you know that the meats already are in the words of the bile.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the bile, and put in the nose after the abstraction of blood a cold poultice, and do this for three days or more so that the gum corrode all that which remains of the meats.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, put in the nose a lead cannula for several days until it has healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you see that it needs more cure, use that.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument for cleansing the nose, from which oils and medicines are distilled into the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do this with silver or iron, which should be like a small open lamp, just like a little pot, and the meat similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed cannula like a reed, and the cannula of the instrument for cleansing the nose is flat and uncovered; to which there should be a handle at its end with which you hold it when you pour into it oil or that which you want of the sucks and of the causes sucking.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these are precious cleansing instruments: take castoreum, white balsam, ginger, long pepper, asafetida, opoponax, and strix of a hen's egg, one ounce. Wine with juice of bled and of cauld, and let the pills be made, and let a pill be tempered with water of tebeza, and let it be dropped in the nose of the patient sitting upright.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter .XXV.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of the holes in the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times it happens that a hole is made in the ends of the nose, and it is swollen and swollen for several days until something is seen in it.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this let you insert that into the beginning of his appearance, and treat all that entirely.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then place over the spot a cautery or burning medicine which is in the location.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its opening is delayed until it has become swollen, then consider whether it is suppurated, hard, of dusky colour and of little feeling, then do not touch it with iron because this is a suppurative abscess; for many times it happens that he who inserts this abscess into that from which there was.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is leonine and not of dusky colour, and its opening is possible in all that, then empty the patient and insert that without fear, and treat the spot with what comes out and bind it closely so that it has healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .XXVI.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the sewing of the nose and of the lips and of the ears when the continuity is dissolved by pus or by like.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there is a solution of continuity in one of these cartilages, there are few who confer in that operation but some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore let you, when for any cause of those, consider whether it is pus fresh with your blood, and then join the two lips of the pus with a suture, and then treat that so that it has healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of solution of continuity are already separated and each is healed, then let you cut each of its visible cords in which there appears blood.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then join the two lips with a suture and strengthen those, and over them powder blood of dragon's blood and cut up into three parts, and place over the powder a piece of emplaster diafinicon or of another one of the emploasters that consolidate, and let him lie so for two days or for three, and then release him and change the emplaster and let him lie so that the wounds are closed by themselves, and then treat with ointment so that it has healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the method of suturing is that you add the solution of continuity or needles as we have recommended in the suturing of the abdomen, or add the solution of continuity with gallbladder as you and made known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come between the two lips in parts inside.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times therefore many men in the parts inside their lips have some apoplectic ulcers hard resembling fat of worms, and some are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore you should turn the lips inside out and cut each of those hard places all around, then make an incision in the swollen part where the blood is constricted, then wash it with a pleasant wine and cure the place with something that causes constriction until it heals.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incision of the flesh tight in the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Frequently there is a growth of flesh tight to the gum which the ancients call albus, therefore if you suspend that with tweezers or something you have, and cut it at its root, letting the pus or blood run out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then place on the incised part some other astringent or caustic powder.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then cut it again secondly and cauterize it, for by cauterizing it will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of reason of teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When in the surface of the teeth of the inside parts and of the hole and between the gums are tight rough scars, hard, and some times they are black and they are made yellow or green inside, through which comes corruption to the gum, and the teeth are made hard.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore you should make the patient open his mouth and place his head in your lap, then press the teeth where those scars appear, and remove them as if they were sand so that no cause remains within, doing this the blackness and yellowing and others are cured until they are healed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	And if this is what is at the beginning of the cause, it is good; but if not, then you repeat the remedy on those every other day and on the second and third until it comes to the final state which you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have many needs of various remedies of diverse forms and of many figures according to your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore the razor with which the tooth is cut from the inside part is different from the razor with which it is cut between the teeth according to other forms; and you ought to prepare these razors as you will see immediately:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of uprooting of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	That you cure the tooth of its pain with every art and delay in total uprooting of it, for there is no cause that surpasses the growth of it when it is uprooted, for it is a sublime substance which is an obstacle to its uprooting.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But if the patient is forced to have that tooth uprooted, you must be certain which is the painful tooth, for many times the pain deceives the patient and seems to be in a healthy tooth, and you uproot it and yet the pain does not cease until the diseased tooth is uprooted, for we have seen this by operation of the gums.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore when you are certain which is the painful tooth, and know well, then cut around the circuit of the tooth with a spatulate instrument in which there is some virtue, until it is dissolved from the gum all around, then pull it with your fingers or with subtle forceps little by little until you draw it out.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And therefore grab it strongly with strong tongs or hold it well between your fingers so that you do not harm it, and draw the tooth according to rectitude in manner that you do not break it, nor give great pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore if it is not loose, then take one of those instruments and place it underneath it all around with facility and exert force on removing it in the same way as before.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is split or rotten, then take a piece of cloth and fill that split and tighten it with a wire at its extreme with a subtle ray so that it is not broken in the time of your constriction on it with tongs.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And take care to cut around the circuit of all parts of the gum and guard your strength so that you do not break it and tear a part from it, then return on the patient for the malice that he may be major that the first pain of him.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And take care that you do not do as some ignorant barbers do in their audacity on the uprooting of them, not administering what we have recommended; for often they bring great diseases upon men which are difficult to be tied, and their roots are all wrinkled, or some of those, or that you draw it out with some bones from the jaw as we have sometimes witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And therefore let the uprooting of it be washed in the mouth with warm wine or vinegar with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if then blood flows from there, as it often does, take some quantity of alder and sprinkle on the wound, and if that alder does not help, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the tongs and forceps subtle with which the tooth is drawn at the beginning should be of long length, with short and thick handle, so that they are not bent when you operate with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And they should be of such thickness of handle that when you strain on them they are not bent, they are short lengths.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they are made of iron of India descendingly made of straight lengths, and in the ends of those there are teeth of which some enter into others and strain by strong constriction, and sometimes the ends of those are the form of a duck's beak which is hooked, it is bent, and are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of uprooting of teeth and extraction of the bones from the jaw.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to uproot a tooth which is tied, then take some cause, then place on the spot a poultice with wool for one or two days until the place is softened; and then insert a hook or tongs in the ends of which are joined together like a beak of a duck called ciconia, or bent, the form of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The ends of them are made inside like a lime or file.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey your command with these forceps or tongs, then cut around the root and remove all the flesh and insert the instrument which is called atali, which is a small lever of which the form is this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And it is of short length thick, and not bent so that it is not tied.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if by this the root is loose, it is good; but if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which these are the forms: the form of the first instrument is triangular length in which there is some thickness: the form of the second instrument is circular length in which there is some thickness;
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it is triangular and more subtle end.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now you are helped with this instrument having two ramps of which this is the form, then the following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And other instruments which will be used for tooth extraction; because it is made with this instrument that resembles an onion in size, and this is its form:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	With a bent or curved triangular end, which should be somewhat thick and not sharp enough to break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other tools that are used for tooth extraction are similar to the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the wise and subtle artisans in the art find for themselves matters according to what the operation and various illnesses indicate to them; because there are illnesses that the ancients did not name nor use specific instruments for due to their various forms.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the jawbone or other bones in the mouth are broken, or if there is pain, then it should be treated on the spot with what is convenient from the instruments and forceps that we have described for tooth extraction, and use the gesture whose form is as follows:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be some thickness to it little by little, and let it be pressed or held in the mouth so that it does not escape or move until the bone is completely healed; then restore the area with appropriate medicines for this purpose.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small wound in the bone, then scrape away that wound and its darkness, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the treatment of teeth that stick out above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth stick out and do not follow their natural course, especially in women and particularly in old people, you should consider this: if the tooth does not touch another tooth and is not possible to file or draw it back, then you must cut that tooth; but if it is attached to another tooth, then you must insert this instrument into it, whose form is as follows; it is similar to a pig's snout, and it should be made of Indian iron with an acute end.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And you must make the incision through which you will insert it into that tooth for several days according to the hardness of the tooth, and so that none of the other teeth are damaged.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the prominent tooth is exposed to abrasion, then file it with an Indian iron file whose form is as follows:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it all be made of Indian iron and its edges sharp; and let there be small pointed tips on it like files with which needles are made, with which the tooth is filed little by little over several days with ease, so that no other teeth are damaged or hurt.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then smooth it at the end, and scrape it with a razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth whose one side is broken and hurts the tongue, then you must file that until its harshness is smoothed and flattened, so that the tongue is not hurt nor speech impeded.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of restoring damaged teeth with gold or silver foil.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When a concussion and removal occur to teeth due to impact or falling, and the patient is unable to spit it out, and you have treated it with astringent medicines but your treatment has not worked, then so that they do not fall out, they must be strengthened with gold foil rather than silver, for silver turns green and hurts after a few days, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the foil should be so thin and thick according to the amount that can fit between the teeth; and the way to make the filling is to take the foil and place twice as much between two healthy teeth, then let it grow with two twists of the foil between two damaged teeth, or if one or more, until the tissue reaches the healthy tooth from the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then repeat the filling on the side where you started, and strengthen your work with ease and wisdom so that it is not damaged.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your binding be such that it holds the foil so that it does not escape through the roots of the teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the excess foil with tweezers or tongs, and place those in every part with gestures, and fold them and conceal them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth so that they do not hurt the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then let it be so tight like Roman armor.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or torn, strengthen that or those with another foil in the same way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the filling of two healthy and two damaged teeth, thus with their edges tied together:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one or two teeth are pushed back into their sockets and grow again as we have described, and become damaged again.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it does not do this except by a skilled and wise artisan.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is apt to use some cause of cow bones, and it is made in the form of a tooth, and placed in the place where the tooth fails, and strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves with that for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the membrane which appears on the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This membrane which appears below the tongue sometimes happens naturally or accidentally due to a wound that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it is to open the patient's mouth, and let his tongue hang down; then lift up his tongue and insert that nerve membrane according to its breadth so that the tongue is loosened from its binding.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knotting in it, and this occurs due to the hardening of a wound, then you must pour on an ointment and cut that through its breadth so that you have cut the membrane and the knot is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful that there is not a crack in the flesh of the lip and you cut through to the artery and blood flows out.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then wash the wound with vinegar or warm water, or water mixed with vinegar; then let the tongue hang down, so that it is not hardened again in any other way.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if blood flows out, then apply powdered vitriol to the spot; but if the blood stops, then cauterize the spot with a hot cautery that suits this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	Then let this be cured by the other causes so that it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula below the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes an aposteme occurs below the tongue, resembling a small onion that prevents the tongue from its natural movement; and when it is swollen, it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on it is to open the patient's mouth wide in front of you and consider the aposteme.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it with a dark or black color, hard, to which the patient does not react, then do not touch it for it is rotten.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is white and moist, then put on an ointment and insert the needle into it, and cut through all its parts; and if blood flows out when you operate, then let a poultice be applied to it afterwards with powdered vitriol so that the blood is stopped.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work so that you may have treated it with praise beforehand, and let it be washed with warm vinegar and salt; and cure it with the other cure for this purpose until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an aposteme of two ears and of that which occurs in the gum, and of other apostemes.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When there is a growth in the throat that resembles a lump, it is made up of glands that are clustered together and protrude outward, and are called tonsils. If you treat them with what we have said in the previous section and they do not heal, then consider whether the abscess is hard, dark-colored, and has little feeling; if so, do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is red in color and the root is thick, then do not touch it with iron due to the flow of blood; instead, let that part mature, and either you should cut it out or it will burst on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is white in color, soft, and the root is slender, then that is what should be cut out.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on him is to consider, before your operation, whether the abscess has already cauterized completely or has diminished in any way; and then have the patient lie down facing the sun, with his head towards you, and open his mouth, and the servant press down on his tongue with a noble instrument of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or bronze, and be slender like a needle.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	So when you press with this instrument onto the tongue and the abscess is revealed to you, then grab it with your forceps and pull it outward as far as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another method is that you pull on one of the membranes, then pierce it with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is similar to forceps, but the ends of it are bent so that the holes at each end face inwards towards each other, very pointed and sharp; this should be made of iron and well-tempered.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then pierce it with a spatula of which this is the form of it: And it should be sharp on one side but blunt on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have pierced one gland, pierce the other according to this method of piercing, and then close up the patient's throat with a cloth soaked in water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a flow of blood, treat it with water that has been cooked with the rind of pomegranate or myrtle leaves and similar things that restrict the flow of blood; then cure it until it heals.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes there are other abscesses in the throat besides those two tonsils; pierce these according to what I have said about the piercing of two glands equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	I once treated a woman for an abscess that had formed in her throat; this abscess was dark in color, had little feeling, and had closed up her throat; the woman was breathing with difficulty, prohibited from eating or drinking water, and had come close to death if she had lived one more day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had grown so much that it had pushed out two bumps for a distance of two fingers.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	So I cut it open with a pair of forceps and pulled it out; and it came out from him in great quantity; then I pierced the other side where I understood the other tract was, and I bound up his mouth, compressed his tongue, and placed the instrument in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut away a great part of it; only a little blood flowed from him.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	So her throat was completely closed up; she began to drink water at once and then ate food; therefore I did not cease piercing that abscess many times for a long time, and there arose an abscess in the place of that one, which I pierced when it had become prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	So I bled and cauterized her throat, therefore she began to vomit; and then I walked around in bewilderment and did not know what God had done to me.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On piercing of the uvula when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When catarrh descends into the uvula and it is abscessed and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if in the lower part it is thick and round, then it is called a boil.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But if it is cured with what we have said in the division and does not respond to your treatment, and you see that the abscess cauterized is already thin and is round; and if it is along the length of it and is bloody, dark-colored or black, and has no feeling, then beware of piercing it, for there is danger in that.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to the way I have said of its whiteness and length, make the patient lie down and press his tongue with an instrument of which we have described the form; then place the forceps in the new one, pull it downward and pierce it with either of the two instruments of which we spoke about piercing two glands.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And beware of piercing it except where it is attached to the natural part by a little addition; for if you pierce it more, you will break its speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the piercing, use what we have recommended in the piercing of two glands, and cure it until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the piercing of his throat, beware of using anything on him that causes fear; and the manner of cauterizing him is not with hot water, but you should lay the patient's head in your lap, then press his tongue with the instrument we have said, and then take the water we spoke about in the chapter on cauterization, and apply it with a live coal, and pour that not thick or thin, and with that fill the concavity of the instrument of which we said this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be concaved in which the medicine will rest just like the cup of a spoon; then place the instrument with the medicine on the uvula, and let the patient lie on his side so that drool or spit from the mouth of him due to the medicine, so that nothing goes down into his throat and thaws it.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then hold your hand over the medicine, and express it upon the uvula every half hour until you see it become blackened and subdued by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a cotton swab and wrap it around the end of the rod; then dip the rod in the medicine and insert the rod with the cotton into a tube so that the cotton adheres to the tube, and do this as many times until you achieve what you want from cauterizing the uvula; then let it be until it dries up and falls off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the medicine needs to be repeated, repeat it; then after cauterizing cleanse around the uvula with a wet rod that has been dipped in vinegar, and clean what is in the circle of it from the medicine with something that is in the circle of it, and let it be washed with water rubbed, and let it be treated outside with an ointment, and let the gums be treated inside until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is more safe than piercing and bleeding and less dangerous.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured by something that is thinner than cauterizing and piercing, for it is cured by sub-smoking in this way: take calamus, hyssop, orris root, rue, Arabic thistles, camomile, bruised and similar to those of the herbs, and mix all these ingredients into one wave, then dip them in wine; let the wave be made with decent wine, and let there be in the middle of the wave a tube, over which is placed an instrument made of iron according to this way; let it be made of silver or of iron.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the extremity is inserted into the patient's mouth until the steam reaches the uvula above the glottis, until the uvula becomes very foggy.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat the process several times until it is dry, and beware that you do not perform this treatment at the beginning of the swelling of an ulcer, for it would be too tight on the ulcer, and you should not do this, but rather reveal the ulcer to him cauterize it.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument available, then take a cane and attach a woolen ball to its end, so that the patient's mouth is comfortable, for the heat of the fire prohibits the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and of that which adheres in the throat, and on other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many times foreign objects become attached to the glottis or a thorn from the foot or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	So you must extract what is visible from among them by pushing the tongue with an instrument in front of it, so that you can see what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is hidden in the throat and cannot be seen, you must cause the patient to vomit before the food has digested in the stomach; for often the cause which afflicts the glottis is dislodged by vomiting; or let the patient swallow a piece of napkin or lettuce leaf or a bit of dry bread; or take a piece of dried sponge and rub it with vinegar, and then let the patient swallow it, for when it reaches the place where the thorns are located, they will be dislodged.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Or take an eel and rub it with vinegar, and have the patient swallow it while it is still moving, or take a pork and when you put it in, move it around to dislodge it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not dislodged by the causes which we have mentioned, then use an instrument of lead in this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be larger than a little finger, and at its end there should be a concavity which you insert into the patient's throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And hold the patient'’s head up, and beware of touching his throat bone, lest it hurt him or dislodge the thorn with your hand, or that the doctor with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But if the patient inserts it himself, because of his knowledge of the location of the cause, and pinches downward, then pull your hand with the instrument upward, as much as he is prepared to bear until it is dislodged.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of blood which is attached to the glottis.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the blood is medicated as we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and do not confer, then consider in the glottis of the patient at the top, for you must press his tongue with an instrument which we have recommended to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	So if you see the blood, extract it with a small needle or a thin and sharp one gently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you are not able to extract it with that, then take a hollow cane and insert it into the glottis of the patient, and place in the concavity of the cane an iron heated, and do this as many times (until the blood is dead and comes out of the glottis) and abstain from giving water to the patient all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a cloth full of water and wring it out in his mouth, and wash the mouth with it; and let no other cause and maw enter there an hour at another time with your hand, for as soon as the blood feels the water, it will come out.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not dislodged with what we have recommended, then suffocate the patient with cumin or asafoetida by means of the instrument which we have recommended in the suffocation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, as I will tell you.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of operating in the suffocation of it, which is that you take an ash bowl in which are burning coals and the bowl is covered with a cloth, and in the middle of the cloth is a hole, and place the end of the instrument in that hole; then blow upon the fire from below to produce smoke; and let the patient place his mouth on the end of the cane, and close his mouth so that the suffocation does not escape until you know that the suffocation has reached the blood, for the blood will then fall.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall, then repeat the suffocation many times, and let the patient abstain from drinking, and eat salty causes and alums, and do not drink water, and thus necessarily the blood must be dislodged by this regimen.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which blood is extracted from the glottis when it is seen; and it is like tweezers except that there is no curve in it:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the glottis, and its end is like a beaver's beak, which is narrow, in which is squeezed with lime, so that when some cause is pressed, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the word in regard to ulcers and their sections.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Ulcers are many kinds of diseases, of various types, according to their memory, each one in this book.
