E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they differ in their penetration and sections by two ways, of which the one is by the kind of ulcers in themselves; and by that which comes from humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is according to the places in which they occur in the body, for an ulcer that accidentally occurs on the head is different from that which occurs on the buttocks; and an ulcer in a fleshy place is different from that which occurs at a joint; and each one of them is cured by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are also some ulcers which are not punctured but rather a maturation of the pus in them or completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other ulcers which are incised when they are cruciate and not matured according to their completion, or which are near the joints, for an ulcer when it is near a joint, its matter is prolonged within that circuit, and the ligaments or nerves of that joint are greatly corrupted by it, so there is contraction of that member; or it is near a principal member, and if you delay its penetration until it is matured, the member becomes sore; or it is near the buttocks, then penetrate it that it may not fester; or when it is made in the terminal part, it should not be punctured when there is no completion, but it must be near the buttocks so that its matter does not spread to the parts of the buttocks, and a fistula is made, or that it is made in the terminal part which is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But when you know the time of the penetration of the ulcer and also when it is matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is matured when the pain subsides and the fever ceases, and also when there is a decrease in heat and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the ulcer, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you should know when there is penetration in that pus at the bottom of the ulcer and pus comes from the cure of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And penetration must be made along the length of the flesh or the body, if the ulcers are in the parts of the hands or feet and on the joints, on the cords of the nerves, on the tendons; and, finally, in all places where there is no reflection; for in those where it is reflected, use penetration according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the pustule is in a fleshy part, then it is better to make the incision in such a way that digestion is confirmed according to the proper course; because if you pierce it in front of this, the body of the pus of it and of the matter is prolonged, and much of the lips of it are hardened and the depth of it.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some pustules are pierced according to the width of the flesh or body, or according to that from which the member needs.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And when you administer a small incision, in large pustules make a large and wide incision, or many dry incisions according to the variety of the size of the pustules.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are of the pustules in which the cord is hollow and cut, when it is made so that the bread and the wound is in a term that is already, as well as that which happens in trops of dubelec and of buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are cut with a three-sided section; and of those in which it is cut as the shape of a leaf of myrtle, as well as the pustules of the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of them are those in which a round section and a moon-like section are administered, and similar to them.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that which is not head as their pustules are superficial, you pierce that with a superficial incision, or flat only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the pustule is large and has collected much healthy matter, you pierce that and do not hesitate to extract all the pus at that time; having extracted a part of it, then close the pustule again on the next day, and then extract a larger part, and do this repeatedly according to the degree that it is discharged.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of cold temperament, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an old person in decline, because the animal spirit is often resolved by the discharge of matter, and quickly dies, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore keep this chapter with great caution, and when you pierce those pustules, cleanse the wounds and consider that if the wound of the pustule is small, or it is a flat section, then you administer the one or the other in the usual way; and if the pustule is large, and the fissures of the incision are many, then place wool in each crack so that they come together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the pustule a part of the cord is cut or you have hollowed it out around the circuit, then fill it with old wool or thread made from linen cloth, as when you treat wounds or roots, without moisture; and close that on the third day; and then process that and cure it with what you would usually do for wounds so that it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if bleeding occurs in the hour of your operation, then you administer water rubbed with vinegar and wine mixed in which you soak a linen cloth, and place that over the site of the bleeding several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then you administer medicine and treatment, and powders which I have recommended in other places of this book and of division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter season, and the site of the pustule is a place of many nerves, then you soak powders in wine and hot oil, and place those on the sites.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the sites are fleshy, then you place powders soaked in water and oil or wine and oil, and do this every third day, as we have said; and then open the pustule and cleanse it and administer in its treatment whatever is appropriate for it so that it heals.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary to know about the cure of pustules universally, but according to the way of distinction I have already said of each pustule in which manner is the way of its cure by particular chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of pustules which come in the cord of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the cord of the head there are small pustules, and they are of the species of nodes which contain membranes that are made to them; and the species of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of them are pimples, and of those there are which contain moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those there are which contain moisture similar to dust, and resembling them; and of those there are which are scaly, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all of them, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as when you extract those it does not contradict the artery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you express those with an instrument the form of which see below, knowing that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if what is contained is moisture, then you split that with an incision according to length by superficial incision according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And you begin the incision from line B to line G. So when the moisture is discharged, then you scrape that by which it contains that moisture, and you do not let any cause of all remain there, because repeated incisions return if anything remains there.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then you soak the wound in Egyptian ointment, if available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill that with it and leave it overnight, because by that you erode all of what remains of that film.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then you repeat on that wound with Egyptian ointment again and again if necessary, until you are confident that there remains no cause of that film; then cure the wound with ointment so that it heals.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if pustule contains a fatty node, then you split that according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with an incision having the shape of a cross, and cut between two lips of the incision and scrape that completely apart from every part, and use your strength in extracting the membrane which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if the artery opposes you, then do what I have told you primarily.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the pustule that is scaly and in its cure as we have said; and an incision on scaly pustule is pus, because it is of little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes some of these pustules are in the head in some people who do not have moisture; and the cause is that they strike upon a pustule on the head of an old woman and stop up the pustule as if with a stone, harsh, white, which could not be pierced, and if anyone hit it, it bled.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other accidental pustules on the head is not this chapter, but like the pustules that come to children's heads and cause the roots of their ears, but the section of these are superficial incisions.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make the incision of those from the lowest part of them so that the body of the matter is driven out to the lowest parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then cure those with whatever is appropriate for its cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these pustules occur in the neck and armpits and armpits and other parts of the body; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those which occur in the neck, and some are engendered between them, and every scrofula of these is within its own membrane, and so as in the nodes and pustules of the head, as we have recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these scrofula are varied, some are stony in nature, others contain moisture, and others are malignant and resistant to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, when you see one in good condition for cutting, whose appearance is similar to the color of copper, and is smooth all around, and not attached to the nerve of the neck, or to the veins or arteries, and is not deep, you should incise it superficially from above downward along the line from G to B. Then excise it completely all around, and stretch it open with forceps, or with hooked instruments if necessary, as we have said before about abscesses on the head. Extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is important to be cautious not to cut into a vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And use a spatulum that is not too sharp, so as not to hurt your hand when you make the incision, or to disturb the patient; and cut only what is necessary to be cut, for if you cut into a vein or artery and are forced to stop the operation, then apply the plaster of quicklime, or other powders which stop the flow of blood, and close up the wound. Then let that which causes the pain of the abscess remain inside, and when the severity of the abscess is lessened and it starts to suppurate,
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is clotted.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation until you have finished it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then ask with your finger if there is any cause for the other small scrofula; therefore cut into them and clean them out.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if there is a large vein at the root of the scrofula, then you must not cut into that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	But before, fold a piece of cloth firmly and place it over the scrofula so that it falls down by itself without doing any harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old cotton which you have already soaked in Egyptian ointment, and treat it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you excise the scrofula completely, then you must bring together the two lips of the wound and stitch them immediately so that no superfluity remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is superfluity because of the size of the scrofula, then you must understand how to cut into its root, and excise it and administer a stitch and that which is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for those scrofula that contain moisture, pierce it with a superficial incision where you see the location of its maturation, and open an incision so that the pus drains out from deep in the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer an incision, apply calcium with ointment and similar to those, so that it corrodes what is caused by the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you see the wound already cleansed, then treat it with generative ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .XLI.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the section of the pilon of the wound of an accident in the jaw.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients describe this section in the pilon, and I have not seen any man in our land who has done that.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their speech.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have squintness, the extraction of the pilon should be avoided, so that there is no benefit by which all the veins and the greater nerves of the patient are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But for those who have cold abscesses in the mouth or jaw or both ears, when the disease is not in the skull, they must use the section of the pilon to avoid destruction which is caused by piercing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want this, we cut the pilon beneath three circles of the circles of the pilon, or four with small incisions in terms of width at that which is between two circles due to quantity; and the incision should be in the brain, not in the cartilage, and this location is convenient for incision because it is deprived of flesh and its blood vessels are thin.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is fearful, then he should stretch the jaw with forceps and cut through the soft palate so that it reaches the pharynx; but avoid the blood vessels if you see any cause for them.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the palate according to what we have recommended; and it is signified by the incision of the pharynx by the flame which is from that which has exited by that which is broken and by the piercing of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound remain open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour is reduced in which piercing is feared, bring together the two lips of the soft palate of the wound and sew that only to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that cause flesh to grow so that it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis said that the sum of his speech which we have recommended, exposition is not but that vessels which some of these abscesses have oppressed the jaw of the patient and the patient has died, and his throat was choked, and some go to cut the epiglottis so that the patient breathes through the wound in the soft palate because of any respiration, and he is saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And therefore he commanded to leave the wound open until the malevolence of the disease is consumed; and its malevolence lasts for three days; and then he commands the wound to be closed and treated so that it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen from my masters is that a servant pressed a pillow and made an incision in her jaw and pierced one part of the trachea of the lung, and she was called to its treatment, and found the blood which had exited from the wound dripping.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore he confessed that she had not cut a vein or artery, and the wind exited from the wound, and he treated it so that fire was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And he did not listen to the servant unless she spoke in the voice, and then after some days she returned to the treatment of her dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Now he says that in the section of the pilon there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter .XLV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of section on an abscess which occurs in the jaw from outside, and it is called a hernia of the jaw.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This hernia of the jaw is a great abscess according to the color of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it occurs in two ways; for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural one is not easy to cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental occurs in two ways; one is similar to grassy knots, and the other way is similar to an abscess which is caused by a knotted artery, and that one is feared.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And do not make a presumption about it unless with a hot iron unless in the spot from which it exits.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe it and examine it with the finger, and if you open it like a grassy knot and it is not suspended by any of the veins, then cut it as the knots, and excise that from where the skin and bursiclam; and unless, scrape all its substance, and then treat the location with what that which covers it of the cure so that it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter .XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of section of the kinds of knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of knots, there are many kinds of spices and I have already said all of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And you note that I count the difference between a knot and an exitus with doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Thus I say that the exit is a hotness and fever and violent pains within which is sedated the boiling of the superfluity; and it is completed putrefaction which then ceases the fever, pain, and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But if there is no heat nor fever nor pain, then it is proper for the lion to eat from his own sack.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a head and it is made thus with a vacuum, whether larger or smaller, and they are according to two species, either they are fat and contain moisture, and the colors of the moisture are mottled, according to what I said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the cure of node, that you probe and inquire into it at the beginning with an instrument which is called a probe, according to what will come to its form in the chapter which is near this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the manner of inquiry of pustules and of all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and insert it into the most moist place which you find in the pustule, and you move your fingers with it little by little while you know that the instrument has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then finish your hand according to the measure of the size of the pustule, and then withdraw the probe and consider what has been expelled in its trail.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the moisture is running out, of whatever color it may be, then you shall incise it superficially according to what I have said in the other pustules.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the trail of the probe you do not get moisture, then know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry over it with an incision having the form of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	Thus as you have been taught, and suspend it with pins, and excise the membrane from all parts with ease, and preserve the skin or sack if you can over that, and extract that pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken during the operation, then it is not possible to extract that pus, and many times there remains some of it in there, and then you shall withdraw that little by little so that no part of it remains behind.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if any of it remains behind, a little or a lot, the node will return according to the greater part.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that any small part remains behind, then complete the wound with some acute corrosive powders and strengthen it, and place over it which is where the pustule was cauterized, and cure that according to another cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a great node, then you shall stitch the two lips of it together and cure that with what incarnates.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if a pulsatil vein comes to it contrarily, or not-pulsatil, then you shall cut and fill the place of gash which is vetriol, and let that rest for two days or three until the boil of blood ceases, and then return to incising what was broken of the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter .XLVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	Of the forms of the instruments necessary in incision and piercing.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Those are the forms of the probes, and they are of three species, and some are great, and some are smaller, and some are little.
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The form of the great probe is this:
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The form of the lesser probe is this:
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The form of the little probe is this:
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	Let them be made of iron, of fullude, of ends which are pointed decently, so that the instrument pierces through the pustules.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the forms of the experients, and they are named albered, and one of those is called berid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And they are of three species, for some are great, lesser and little.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The form of the great experiment, its form is:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The form of the lesser experiment, its form is:
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	The form of the little experiment, its form is:
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	It is fitting that they be for pustules and exituses and fistulas and tumors for it is among those that are of the bones and of other causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they are made round, large, and sharp, with which the membranes are sewn together, and they are made of lemon copper, or of iron, or of silver, and the best are when they are made of lemon copper.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And they are made the experients of black lead, which are accounted to open up the fistulas in the cavity of which their reflections are reflected by their elevation with those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And they are of three species, for some are long, and some are lesser, and some are short, according to the quantity of the width of the fistula and of its narrowness.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	The form of the great experiment of lead is:
Forma del experient migier de plom:	The form of the lesser experiment of lead is:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	The form of the little experiment of lead is:
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The forms of the pins are of many species, for some are simple, which have only one curvature, and they are of three species: great, little, and lesser.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And their bodies are hooked, and they are of three species.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And some of them have two curvatures, and they are of three species.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And some of them have three curvatures, and they are of three species.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all those are necessary in their place.
Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:	The form of the simple great hook is:
Forma de unci simple migier:	The form of the simple lesser hook is:
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	The form of the simple little hook is:
Forma de unci orp gran:	The form of the body great hook is:
Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	The form of the body lesser hook is:
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	The form of the body little hook is:
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	The form of the great hook having two curvatures is:
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	The form of the lesser hook having two curvatures is:
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	The form of the little hook having two curvatures is:
Forma de unci gran havent tres curvaturas:	The form of the great hook having three curvatures is:
Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	The form of the lesser hook having three curvatures is:
Forma de unci pauc havent tres curvaturas:	The form of the little hook having three curvatures is:
E aquestas so las formas dels scalpels am les quals son seccatz e scorjatz les nodes e le apostemas, e so de tres specias, quar de aquels es gran, migier, e pauc.	And these are the forms of the scalpels with which they are dried and cut into the nodes and pustules, and they are of three species, for some is great, lesser, and little.
Forma de scapel gran:	The form of the great scalpel is:
Forma del scapel migier:	The form of the lesser scalpel is:
Forma de scapel pauc:	The form of the little scalpel is:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those with which the incision is made are sharp and the other extremities are not-sharp, and they are not stopped in such a manner, but is done gently upon the incision of vein or nerve, and by that the patient is healed and finds tranquility through the cooling which cools the excoriation of the pustule.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the forms of poultices, and they are of three species: great, lesser, and little, thus with wool.
La forma de magda gran:	The form of the great poultice is:
Forma de magda migier:	The form of the lesser poultice is:
Forma de magda pauc:	The form of the little poultice is:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	Let them be made of wool and they shall be similar to felt with which is made alcohol.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it is in the extremity pointed with spathon and in that they pierce the teeth and gums, when you wish, thus as well.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of spathons which are made to be placed between the teeth and ought not to pierce pustules, and they do not hurt the patients, and they are of three species: great, lesser, and little.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are the forms of those:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of wounds through which blood flow is cut off are of three kinds: great, moderate and small.
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of citron wood, round with some length and they are slender.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And whoever makes these kinds of cupping glasses, they must be big, moderate and small, in order that through them blood flow is cut off quickly when necessary, and at other times if medicine is not available.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	Yet you must not use these to cut off blood flow in all parts of the body, but only in fleshy areas, like on the insides of the ankles and thighs, and on the inside of the upper arms, nipples, abdomen and armpits, and similar fleshy hollows.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes these instruments are made small, resembling slices of grapes, according to this form; through which blood is cut off when a flebotomy is done, or an incision in a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes they are made round according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	About the care of men's breasts which are like women's.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes men's breasts become enlarged due to sleepiness and they start to feel soft, and their breasts become swollen and resemble women's breasts, and they become proud.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you observe this, when you cut into them use a lunar incision according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G, and remove all the swelling completely, and fill the wound with a medicated ointment, and sew together the two lips of the wound and cure it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast sags towards the sides and becomes soft due to its size like a woman's, then it should be cut into two parts along its length with two incisions resembling lunar figures, each containing the other according to the end of one line containing the other, so that the major line contains the minor line according to this form from B to G. And remove the cord which is between the two lips of the wound and the fat, and administer what we have said about the suturing and powders that are necessary in the cure until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of this which one must be cut into due to restlessness and blood flow, then fill the wound with a cotton bandage dipped in corrosive ointment and leave it so that it corrode what is rotten from the swelling and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	About puncturing abscesses which come under the nipples.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses which come under the nipples are of the species of scrofula, hard, and they contain a sac full of fluid.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some of them contain humidity; and those which contain humidity should be cut into with a lunar incision according to this figure: from the line of G to the line of B. And when all that is in the abscess has been discharged, then fill it on the next day with a poultice made of old cheese.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And the wound should be washed and cured with an appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess of the species of lumps and scrofula is, then you should split it as we have said in the section on scrofula with a fork.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the wound extends so that it causes purulent discharge, then administer cauterization on it as we have said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	About incisions of abscesses that occur through an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured and the cord which is on it is consolidated, then many times there occurs an abscess: and through what ways inflammation and abscess occur through an artery or vein: for when an abscess occurs through an artery, it extends far into the depths of the body; and when you poke the abscess with your fingers, you feel a stridor in it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And what occurs through a vein is round to the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And an incision on this abscess is dangerous, and especially in those that are under the armpits, in the groin, in the neck, and in many parts of the body; and it is very serious, therefore its cure with a cautery should be avoided, and what occurs at the extremities or on the head should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But over what occurs through them due to inflammation of the hole of the artery, split it in the cord with a long incision; and open the incision with forceps and release the artery and remove it from the tunics until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And put an awl over it and make it penetrate into the other side, and tighten the artery with a double thread in two places, — which causes you to pull it out by its ends through two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And punch the place which is between two ligaments with a spatula so that all the blood in it flows out and the abscess is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And administer cure to where pus is generated within so that the ligaments fall, and cure it with appropriate ointments until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to an incision of a vein, then you must hold with your hand what is possible for the abscess on the cord, and insert the awl under the place which you held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and tie the apostema with a double thread so that you pull it out from the other side, and ligate the apostema with a strong thread according to what we have said about the ligament of two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you are afraid to pull out the thread, then insert the needle under all the apostema according to the incision of the needle first, and tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in its middle part where it has risen so that when it is dried you cut off the superfluity of the cord and remove what is bound to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And put powder over it which you have dipped in wine and oil, and administer the cure that is made with poultices and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50 about the abscess which occurs due to torsion of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as abscesses occur in arteries and veins, and similarly abscesses occur in nerves when they occur due to excessive work or occur due to similar reasons.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it occurs mostly in the places of the limbs or the neck, or any place where the joints are bent.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious abscess, and it resembles the color of the rest of the body, and in its major parts are dispositions of pain and when it is pressed with force, the patient feels a kind of stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess which extends into the depths of the body, and therefore it is under the cord and it is bent in every direction and does not go forwards or backwards.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore those which are at the joints should not be cauterized with a hot iron, because they cause great contraction when heated.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But what occurs in the head or forehead, split the cord with a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is small, then cut off that pus with forceps and open it at its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If it is large, then suspend it with a hook, and scrape it, and stop the bleeding; and stitch the wound, and let it heal from within.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51:
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Chapter 51: Of a section of an ulcer which happens in the jaw that happens in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Some men are found to have bumps on their bellies and other parts of their bodies, which are called warts due to their similarity to mushrooms. The root of these warts is subtle, but the top is thick; sometimes their lips are affected, and they can be small or grow very large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	I have seen one such person, and in his belly were two growths resembling mushrooms, and there was no difference between them - they were both white and had a fine root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of these warts were inverted and split, and moisture flowed from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I cut those, and found inside one of them, in a foot, 15 inches deep. And the other, six inches.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation on their incision is that you should consider if the patient is humid and the color of the growth is white and humid with a subtle root; then you should cut it open with a wide spatula, and let it burn in the fire until it cauterizes - for often the section of it expels a lot of blood. And if it bleeds, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient is fearful and anxious, be careful not to cut with iron; instead, take a new lead seal, and tightly press it against the growth, in the manner we have described. Then leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then, tighten the lead wire firmly around it; thus, you should keep tightening the lead wire until it is very firm, until it falls off by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the growth has a thick root, then in its incision there is a cause for fear and terror, especially when it is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you cut only half of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then, treat it so that the wound heals.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to cut a growth that is of dusky color, with little feeling, and which has a soft texture, for that is an abscess.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I remembered the case of a man who came to me.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52:
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Chapter 52: On the cure of a hernia at the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	A hernia at the navel is caused by many things: or by fissures in the diaphragm which is above the belly, and its membranes or intestines depending on where they are; or from blood flowing out of a vein or artery as mentioned earlier; or from a constricted bowel in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is because of a fissure in the diaphragm and an elevation of its membrane, then the color of the hernia is similar to the color of the body; and there is little pain, and it appears in different places.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to the hernia of an intestine, then its situation is as we have described, with more intense diversity, and when you press it with your fingers, it hides, and then returns; and it becomes strong in itself, and grows a lot because of the entrance of food and violent work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is because of moisture, then it is soft and does not hide when you press it with your hand, nor is it bound together, nor is it dry.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is because of blood, then with these signs the hernia declines to blackness.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is because of dry flesh, then it is a heavy hernia, large and hard, and it is formed according to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is because of a bowel, then its touch is soft.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you should consider if the hernia at the navel is because of blood from an artery or a vein, or due to a bowel; then know that you must be prohibited from curing it, for in that there is fear and terror as we taught you in the chapter where we spoke about hernias from an artery and a vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the hernia at the navel is because of an intestine or its membrane, then command the patient to hold his breath and stand straight; then press with your finger around the whole navel, and command him to stand opposite you with his chest against your chest, and surround it with a wide spatula around the place which you pressed with your finger; then extend the hernia to the sides above it with a large hook, and tie it in the circuit with strong thread or with lead wire in the decent way.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Then cut open the middle of the abscess that extends over the ligament and insert the said needle into that area, and if you have not tied it or guarded it by the ligament, then you extract the intestines and push them back into the parts within the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have tied the cloth, then take it by its end; and cut off its excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is opposite your artery or vein, then surround that spot and return to your operation; and take two needles and place in those two strong threads and insert two needles into the circuit which you have made around the abscess in the form of a cross, making them penetrate; and then tighten the abscess into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the spot open so that the stretched flesh can fall back down by itself; or cut off what is thinned out and let it heal, and then cure that with something that covers the wounds so that it heals.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the protuberance of the navel is a little flesh in there or because of moisture, then you should hollow out the abscess as we have said and draw out the blood or moisture which you find in there, and then cure that with something that covers it and consolidates the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53:
De curacio de cranc.	Of the curing of a hernia.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, about the kind of hernia and in what way its cure is with medicines, and that it is cut off in there by iron so that it is not ulcerated; and we have said that a hernia is engendered in the mother and the precaution for its cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes a hernia is in a place where its removal is possible, just as of a hernia which is in the breasts or in the thigh and similarly located in other parts of the body to extract all of that, and especially when it is starting out small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is ancient and large, do not approach it, for I have never seen one of those heal nor have I heard of one coming to that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on it when it is located as we have said, is that you precede and leave the patient and purge them of black bile sometimes, and then you open that up if a clear swelling is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient with a preparation in which it is located by operation, and then pierce into the wound with nails which cover that; and then hollow out from all parts with a good cutting saw to make sure that no cause of its roots remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow out, and do not close that up quickly, and squeeze out the places and wipe off the thick blood with your hand or with an instrument by which it is possible for you of the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it causes an obstruction of thick blood from a vein or artery, then cauterize that spot so that the flow of blood is stopped, and then cure that with the other cure so that it heals.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54:
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure for hydropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended, in the division, about the kinds of hydropsy from water, and the signs of each kind, about its cure with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured by iron is nothing but the kind of althitas alone, and it is not approached by iron with the kind of tympany or with the kind of hyposarca, for that is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this kind of hydropsy tympany with medicines and it does not bring about your medicine, then consider, for if the patient has already achieved debility, or is with another illness, another hydropsy, just as if it is in them coughing or with a chest and similarly to those, then beware that you do not treat them with iron, for fear is over that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient bloated with strength, and in them there is no other illness but hydropsy alone, and they are not an infant or old, then the way of the operation on it is that you raise the patient between your hands, and then you press their belly with your hand, filling up the water to the area below the navel, and then take a sharp spatula according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	Let it be of two sharp parts long, with a pointed extremity like a spatula; but let there be in it some short brevity little by little, so that in the operation with that you do not pass into the intestine, and let you lead that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of hydropsy is from parts of the intestines, for then beware that you lengthen from the navel by the quantity of three fingers to the areas below, in the right side of it over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydropsy is from illness of the liver, then your section should be left of the navel by three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if its generation is from the spleen, then your section should be in the right.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And beware that your section is over the side on which the patient wants to lie so that the excess does not run to that spot.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce with the instrument all the way through, and insert into that section, and lift your hand with the spatula between the navel and the stomach, and you draw out that; and if it is the quantity of a fingernail or a little more.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the navel so that the spatula reaches to the desired place, and it is a location of water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and insert an instrument of which this is the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is like a tube of subtle silver; it is made of silver or brass or lion’s leather, and at the bottom end of it there is a small hole, and in its sides are two holes: one from one side and one from the other side; and its extremity is split according to the manner of a feather, just like this:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the top end of it is a ring, for when the instrument reaches to the water, then that immediately draws up over the instrument, and then evacuates the water in the momentary quantity, for if you evacuate from that more than does not cover in the moment, it causes the patient to die by resolution of their animal spirit, or happens to them five-fold which is near death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate from that according to the quantity of the strength of it and according to what mean to you the dispositions of the patient’s pulse and of its goodness.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then extracted the instrument and tied up the water which causes is that as soon as it is drawn up by the navel, and recommended to you that you pierce that according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then return the instrument on the next day if they can tolerate that, and extract a little water, and do that for several days with fear, and beware of mistake so that it does not run out of water except for a little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient and let out of the water a great quantity, then cure that with burial in dry sand, and move it to a bath, and to the sun until long time; and cure that with medicines drying so that it heals.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach, and the liver and the spleen and also the extraction of water, according to what I have recounted in that which is preceded.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55:
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the cure for children who are born with places of urine not perforated.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some children are born from the womb of their mother, and the head of the umbilical cord is not pierced (or it is pulled out or is not in its proper place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	So when the umbilical cord is cut, pierce it immediately with a sharp knife according to this form.
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	Then put in the wound a small lead nail and tie it, and keep it for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, he is squeezed and urinates; and then return it.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not put the lead, it is possible that the urine which goes on the spot, will not harm this clot.
