And then cut the end of the band, and do not cut into the scrotum at all, nor extend the hole, nor cause anything else so that you have knowledge in the cure for intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then cure it with the cure for wounds, and as you insert the threads, cleanse that and restore the wound so that it is consolidated; because the scrotum is contracted and the eminence of the rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cautery is better in this place because it is closer to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of softening of the scrotum of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the scrotum of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh that is between there is softened, and it is weakened by the guard of it.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Then it is necessary for the one who is asked in the cure of it to let the patient lie on his back, and heat all the scrotum which is softened over the natural scrotum; and then sew two lips with a stitch.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you want, cut in the beginning the superfluity of the softened scrotum with three or four cuts and with a firm stitch.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then insert between the stitches; and then cure by the cure for the other wounds so that it is healed and the threads fall.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69.
De castracio.	Of castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration in our law is excommunicated, but by cause it has been read to me that I remember it in this book; and it is not necessary to remember it except for two ways, of which the first is so that it is in the science of the doctor when it is questioned about it, who knows the cure of it when it happens; and the other way is that we many times have need of castration of other beasts because of our young ones for them, as of horses, and of oxen, and of pigs, and of those similar to the beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And so I say that castration is done in two ways: or by tearing, or by cutting at an incision.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is done by tearing, the way of the operation is that we let the beast swim in water so that its genitals are softened and they hang.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take those with your hand so that they are resolute and do not appear beneath the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by incision and cut, take hold of the scrotum of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then ligate the suspensory ligament, and insert on each hole with one cut so that two holes are processed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then insert those pus which you will have scooped out.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not let any cause happen on them of the scrotum, except for the subtle scrotum which is over the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this way of castration is better which is done by tearing because tearing leaves no cause to the testicles so that the beast desires copulation.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then cure the wound so that it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the cure for hermaphrodites.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphrodites in men are according to two ways: the one is when or appears in that which has the space between the scrotum of the testicles, in that one which is between two testicles figure a clitoris of woman in which there are hairs.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes from that urine in the scrotum of the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols. E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three species: of two of men and one species of women.

Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	When you see the mother giving birth in this way, consider and then insert your finger inside so that the moisture is evacuated.
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	And if the fetus is suspended above its face and neck, then insert that of the umbilical cord, so that it is not retained and delayed.
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	Then cover the fetus in its parts as you put that which covers it, and command the woman to squeeze herself a few times, and she will force it out with an easier birth if God so wills.
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	The exit of twins or multiple fetuses.
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	Know that twins are often born many times, and sometimes three or four, but this is strange and rare; but their causes come from nature, and not alive.
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And know that there are those, although they are multiplied, one is a twin, and they are separated by the head, distinguishing them between the ligament in the umbilical cord of each of them. And sometimes they are forced out as if it were one fetus with an easy natural birth, and sometimes their exit is non-natural as we have described.
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	And if they are difficult to give birth and reach what we have said about the non-natural shapes, then you must treat them as we have recounted.
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	And if the midwife does what she does with ease and subtlety, and with delay, and is ingenious according to all shapes as it is prepared for her by bringing health.
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	Recollection of that which is formed in the womb from embryos and abortions.
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	Some women have one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and sometimes even ten fetuses, and I have indeed seen a woman who aborted six fetuses all formed, the cause of which was discovered by the wise physicians through measurement.
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	And all of that cover what it is in the science of the midwife how strong she goes to that small thing resembling that, and then pause if at that.
Capitol .lxxvi.	Chapter .LXXVI.
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	On the extraction of the fetus when it is dead.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you treat the dead fetus with what we have said in the division of medicine and is not forced out, and you are forced to use incision with your hand, then consider if the woman is of healthy nature and has none of the accidents by which she is feared to lose.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then the woman should be laid on her back, and his head inclined downward and his thighs raised.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the minister held that of two parts or be bound in the bed so that his body does not extend due to the extraction of the fetus.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	Then you moisten the mouth of the mother of it with oils moistened and with mucilage of alder and fenugreek and of linseed.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	And the midwife moistens her hand with those oils and mucilage, and then inserts her hand with ease in the mother, and then surrounds her hand at the place where the nails are in the fetus.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And convenient places in that: then you consider if the fetus is prepared to descend over his head, and then you put the nails in his holes, or in his neck, or in his mouth, or in his palate, or under his beard, or in the furcula of him, or in the close places of his sides, or under his armpits.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	But if the descent is over his feet, then in the ankle, or in the middle of his back.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And have the nail with your right hand, and pause the bend of it in that place which is between the fingers of the left hand, and insert the hand with ease and put the nail in some of those places which we have said, until he comes to the desired cause.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	And then pause and put in the opposition of it another nail, or the third if necessary, so that it is equal attraction, and not extension according to its rectitude only.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	But be bent in every part, so that the exit of it is drawn out as it is done for the extraction of a tooth.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And in that between them that the extension is softened; and if any part of it is retained, then the midwife anoints her fingers with oil and inserts that remedy and turns it around that which is retained.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Therefore if the part of the fetus is forced out, then the nails are shifted to another place where there is need; and do that until all the fetus is forced out.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if the hand is forced out in front of the other, and it is not possible to return that by the bend of it, then have a cloth wrapped around it; and then extract it so that all of it is forced out, and insert that or in the joint of the hand or in the elbow.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	And do the same to the other hand and feet.
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	But if the head of the fetus is large, or there is constriction on it in its exit, or water in his head is tight, then insert between his fingers spongy sponge and split the head and extract the water, or uncover that with an instrument which is called “file”, the shape of which will come with the shapes of other instruments in the chapter which is next to this.
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	And similarly do if the fetus is of a large head by nature: and then insert that with alum, or take it with forceps as we have said; and then extract the bones with forceps.
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	And if the head is forced out and constricted by the furcula, then it is split so that the moisture which is in the feet is discharged.
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	But if it is not complicated nor obstructed in exit, then you insert the head as much as possible to you.
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	And if the bottom of the belly is swollen or dripping in it, then perforate that so that the moisture in it runs out.
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	But if the fetus is above its feet, then the attraction of it is easier and the direction of it to the mouth of the mother is easier.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	But if it is constricted by the belly and feet, then you extract that with a cloth which you have wrapped around your hand, and split the belly and feet so that what is in them runs out.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	But if the other members stand and turn the head, then the midwife inserts her left hand; but if the mouth of the mother is open, then insert the hand into the prenon of air, and surround it with that the head, and draw that with its fingers into the mouth of the mother, and then insert into him one nail, or two nails, and draw him with those.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	And if the mouth of the mother is constricted by an ulcer that comes to u, then let it not be pressed upon him; before, however, administer effusion of humid, fatty causes.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And apply plasters; and follow the patient in waters that soften and moisten.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the fetus is on his side, then if possible, it is twisted: and let what we have said in the living fetus be administered.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	And if that is not possible, then let it be inserted into vessels, and extracted.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And whoever does not leave out any cause inside the armpit.
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And when you have completed your operation, then administer what we have said about the treatment in boils that come from the greater humors.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if bleeding occurs, then let it flow into astringent waters and administer the other treatment.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have seen a woman whose belly was pregnant with a dead fetus, and on that fire another living one was carried, and then another fire with the dead one.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happened that after a long time an abscess formed in his arm; and it swelled up that a fire opened, and it began to emit pus.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called to cure him, and I treated him for a long time, but the plague did not heal.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then I placed on him some strong-吸引 bandages, and a bone came out of him, and after a few days another one came out; and I was very wondered how in the belly there were bones.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I thought they were the bones of the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	Then I opened the wound and extracted many bones from him; the woman remained in the same condition, and she walked around like that for a long time, with a little limp.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And I did not think anything strange about it, but that in this there is science and assistance to what the doctor skill with his hand for curing administers.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	Of the forms of the instruments which are necessary to extract the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Form of an incision through which the mother is opened:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of a ligature in which the intestines are tied, to that tying there are two virtues at both extremes of two threads.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	But let this virtue be more subtle than the ligature, and let it be made of cotton or linen cloth.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And the breadth of each strip is two fingers and the edges of both are one finger, and the length of each is a palm and a half; and in the middle part of the two strips there are two attachments of that linen cloth, the lengths of which are half a palm each, and the widths of each are two fingers, or a little more.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two attachments are interwoven in the mouth of the mother so that it is opened by them when you twist the two prescribed threads.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Other form similar to that more subtle and lighter:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	It is made of linen cloth or cotton according to the likeness of a forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	But at the end of it there are two attachments just like fingers, and the length of those attachments is about a palm, and the breadth of each is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you want to open the mother with them, then let the woman be on her back with her feet hanging down, opening that which is between her thighs.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	And open your hand with the instrument just as you do with tongs, according to the amount that you want of the opening of the mother's mouth in which the midwife makes it as you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of incision which the antiques said:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	Form of an incision by which the fetus is impelled:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	Form of an incision by which the large head is cut
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it is like forceps in which there are teeth at the end just like fingers, and some times it is made long like forceps just like fingers, and its teeth are like those of a key with which it is cut and split.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	Form of a small incision:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	Form of an unction having a spine:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	Form of an unction having two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	Form of forceps whose teeth close with which the head of the fetus is split:
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Form of a spatula having two ends by which the head is cut:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Form of two spatulas broad:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are exercised, and when they are more easy for the artist and more due to the men because of their quantity.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And it does not matter that you do not have those instruments, for there is no excuse for the need of them.
De extraccio de la segondina.	Of extraction of the second child.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the second child is retained because of the childbirth, then let you command the midwife to retain her milk, and then make her vomit with an emetic, and press your hand over her mouth and over her nose, and if she expels it by that means, well.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then take a wool cloth and pierce it in the blanket, and place over that herbs which heat the mouth of the mother, like salt and rue and anise and camomile and Arabic scilla and cassia ligneous and sandalwood.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All those herbs or some of them are to be immersed in water on the cloth, and place that over the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And then place a hollow reed in the mouth of the mother, and hold that there while the evaporation comes to the cavity of the mother.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And then make her vomit as we have said, and the second child will be expelled with velocity.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if this cure is applied and the child has not been expelled, then command the midwife to immerse her left hand in sesame oil or in an infusion of marjoram, and then insert it into the vagina and press with that the second child, and when she has found the second child, pull it out little by little according to the rectum so that the mother does not suffer from too violent an extraction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	First let it be moved to the right and left sides with ease.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And then the amount of attraction is adjusted, for she will obey and be drawn out from adhesion.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mouth of the mother is closed, we have already recommended the cure by an emetic and by the application of the cloth with herbs.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not expelled with all the causes we have recommended, then be assured that what comes out of her mouth lies at the crotch of the woman, and then christen her with unguent and tetramedication; for she will then be broken up within a few days and dissolved and expelled.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it is raised bad odor to the head and stomach, and that upsets the midwife; then let potions and convenient remedies be administered to that.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But some of the Ancients have been tried with sublimation of netherwort and of dry figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Form of an instrument by which the woman is sublimated because of retention of menstrua and of the second child:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It is made of wood or of brass.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And the subtle end be placed in the vagina and the broad end over the fire, and the sublimation be placed over the coals of the fire.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And hold that there while it is consumed by that sublimation and repeat another.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	Of cure of the anus of the child not perforated.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Children with narrow and swollen anuses, whose orifices are not perforated, and they have been pressed subtle and swollen.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Then let the midwife pierce it with her finger; but if not, pierce it with an awl and guard that it does not touch the clitoris.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	And then place wool soaked in wine and oil over it; and let that wound heal while covered.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear that it will become infected, then insert a cannula for several days and remove it when the infant wants to defecate.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And then it happens that the anus becomes blocked by the hardening of a ulcer or abscess; therefore when that hardening is cut into, it should be treated as we have said regarding the treatment and the lead.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	Regarding the treatment of fistula's that originate from there:
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistula's that originate near the beginning, discharge pus which is thin and watery and originate near the anus or in the space between the buttocks.
E es una fistula o motas.	And there is one or several fistula's.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when that hardening becomes old and discharges thin white or yellowish pus, then some of these fistula's penetrate.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And these are known by what exits from them through the exit and by the flatulence: and sometimes the patient passes gas through it, and usually it is pus that exits from there.

And how you know a fistula has penetrated into the anus and not penetrated is that you put your finger inside the anus, and you insert a thin piece of ram or iron into the fistula when it is not painful.

De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	On the sewing of hemorrhoids in which blood flows in the incision of those.

De curacio de fistulas.	Of the cure of fistulas.

And then the patient should be laid on their back, and their legs elevated, with a pillow placed underneath them, and a servant holding their legs, and another their chest, with their hands. And then the end of the cautery should be anointed with oil, or white wine, or a poultice of fenugreek, or similar; and then it should be inserted into the anus with ease, and the minister should squeeze the bag, expressing its contents with force until everything in the bowel is evacuated; and then the bowel should be extracted, and the patient should raise their legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine causes him to vomit, let him vomit as much as he can; and if he sleeps with it for the whole night, it is better for his healing.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you cleanse him in stomach illnesses of vomiting and the discharge of his bowels, then you should repeat the cautery until he is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or painful abscesses in the anus, then let the bowel be very thin and soft, with bowels from which children are born.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Healing of Wounds:
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already said in the division of the healing of wounds what was fitting for the book, and I say thus the healing of those with hand and medicine according to need.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that wounds are various according to what caused the wound and according to the location on which the wound occurred.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which many wounds are made are thus with stone, or incision of sword or knife, or impact of lance, or staff, or arrow, or similar to these from many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the wounds that are in the locations of the body are thus with wound that falls upon the head, or neck, or foot, or belly, or throat, and similar to those in the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I will discuss the healing of some wounds so that you may apply that reasoning and rule to other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple wounds of the head, for the memory of the composite wounds will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when a simple wound to the head occurs and there is no fracture, then consider: if it was from impact of stone or similar, and the vein has just been severed and there is a large wound and you fear an abscess will occur, then cut and tie the cephalic vein at once, and do not delay this; and draw out blood according to the amount of the injury's strength unless some cause prohibits phlebotomy, especially if the blood flowing from the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let the phlebotomy be on the opposite side of the wounded part; and keep the patient from replete and wine and heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if some cause prohibits from the diminishment, then let it be lessened from the food and not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place upon the wound, if it happens to him an abscess, a poultice steeped in warm oil or wine in which is mixed stiptic powder.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is secure from abscess, then place upon the wound, if it is fresh with its own blood and the air has not changed that powder which I will soon describe.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that one, then place upon it some ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or is from incision of sword and similar, and its lips are not closed by stitches, then close those with stitches according to how I will describe about their stitches.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound is uncovered of bone and pen, and there is no retention of it but a small suspension, then insert that one and properly heal the wound with medicines and restore the meat by command to the patient that he abstain from foods in which are coarseness: heads and formen skin and similar to them, until it is healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find in the bone putrefaction and it does not adhere to the bone, then insert all that is rotten and throw it out, and properly heal that one.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood can flow and it is not severed by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find that one unsevered, then you insert into it with spatulum, or ligature that one; and if necessity demands that we not do as we have said, then cauterize until the blood is severed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is leeching; therefore you powder over those this powder, for it will harden before the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of unshorn ram, dragon's blood, and not-extinguished ash; be all pounded and sifted, and let the wound be filled with it, and be constricted by good compression until it adheres to that, and be coagulated by its own blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then bind that one above with lint and let it be bound, and do not loose it while it is like this unless an abscess occurs, for the medicine will not heal until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes use only cautery when you do not have unshorn ram and dragon's blood at hand.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And do this operation of binding in large wounds when it seems that it should be placed upon those and are tight, and are fresh with their own blood, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summer time, then there is no intent to the position of this powder, but then heal those with what we have said, therefore you place upon those some ointments digested, or that you place upon those plasters made from flour of wheat with water and honey until they are soft; and then heal them with the other healing within they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if it happens that the wound is fracture of bone, and it is small, then you extract that with forceps.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will tell the healing of fractures of the head in what is piercer.
De las plaguas del col.	Of wounds of the neck:
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in medicine, and it is among the wounds of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerve of the neck is cut or artery, then if it is nerve, there is not in it artifice except that it be avoided healing of it with anything that makes vehement stiffness, therefore as cinchona and zeki that is vetiver oil and similar to them because they harm nerves and against that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place upon the wound any cause of all heat, for the substance of nerves is heat and its continuation is in the brain, which is the source of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if that which is healed by medicines cooling, therefore as it is washed with warm water, some vinegar infused in oil or not, and thucine when it is washed with warm water and the other stones minaret according to this manner, and ointments humid.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then administer stitches, or narrow its lips, and then heal that one with lint until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound has depth or occurs to it the low pus broken, then pierce that one in its location but not deep-punched.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if in the wound an artery has already been cut and blood flow is achieved, then either ligature or cauterization of it should be performed, depending on what your need requires.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the ribs of the throat or all of them have been cut and the veins of the neck have been preserved, then you should stitch the edges of the wound over the throat with a needle and not touch it; instead, you should pull that area gently back into its natural shape and tie it tightly with a decent bandage; and you should treat that area with a poultice until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has caused a fracture in the bone, then you should probe it and extract any bone fragments that you can; and what you cannot remove, let it be lanced so that the wound may be cleaned out, separated from the bone, and the pus drained away.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is fresh, then dust it with the powder that has been recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula has formed in the wound, then treat it with what will be mentioned later in its own chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of wounds to the neck or similar, when they are made with a spear or halberd or lance or similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a spear or halberd wound and you see the depth of it, then consider whether there is any wind coming from the patient; then know that the wound is fatal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the wound is fresh with its blood, then you should put on a powder at the first hour and not compress it so that the blood is not held back in its depth but returns to the heart and the patient is relieved; rather, apply an attracting poultice and loosen it twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the poultice is not available to you, then put into the wound a piece of old cloth so that it draws out what is in there; and have the patient sleep on his back with his legs raised so that what is inside can flow out.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed and the patient does not experience spasms or a bad tremor of the heart or a tightness in the chest, and you see other good dispositions, then know that the wound is healed; and then treat it with hot water and the other remedies until it is completely healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if its healing is delayed and the wound has been open for a long time, then know that a fistula has formed; treat it therefore according to its own chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is from a spear or halberd, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or leg, then treat it with what precedes the sewing closed, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if it has caused a fracture in the bone and only fragments remain inside, then you should turn the wound over to extract those fragments, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then let them be lanced so that their extraction is eased.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidental wounds in the other limbs, the treatment is what we have already said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of wounds to the abdomen:
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disposition that occurs in the abdomen is either large or small or middling.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the large ones, sometimes there are intestines or nerves in them that must be sewn up and their sutures made more forceful and more delicate.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is made difficult in another way: and you will find that reducing them is more difficult if you do not close off the intrusion of them into their location immediately, for when they are opened up, they are swollen so that it is difficult to put them back inside.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is middling, for in that one the reduction of the intestines is not difficult, and so it is with the two other kinds mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that the sewing closed of the abdomen is according to four methods; however, two sutures are common that apply also to sutures of the other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two others are specific to abdomen wounds, but they are more proper in sewing closed the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will recount to you each one with its explanation.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and some cause of the intestines comes out through it, and its reduction is made difficult in one of two ways: either because of the smallness of the disruption as we have said, or because the intestines are given inflammation by the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when that is so, then you should warm it by immersing a sponge or cloth moistened in warm water alone, or you could mix in squill, and cypress, and spikenard, and myrrh with the water and apply it to the intestines until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it does this in the wine in which there is stypticity, and it is better for resolving inflammation than just water.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflammation is resolved, then you should moisten the intestines with water in which there are mixed alder and mallow, for by this means the intrusion of it is eased for little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the intestines are not drawn back by this treatment, then you should cut the disruption a little with an instrument by which the ulcers have been cut.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is best when it is not cut and there is no need to dry it out immediately nor any shortage of food.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, know its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The one part of it is curved and acute, and the other part not acute, and its tip is not blunt but sharp; before, it is obtuse a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is enlarged and there are intestines coming out of it, then you should have its reduction according to the natural shape of it in its proper location, if that is possible, for that is best.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is wide and it is in the lower part of the abdomen, then you should have the patient lie on his back with his legs raised higher than his head; and if it is in the upper part, then let him lie on his back with his head and feet higher than his middle parts.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And likewise if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the abdomen, then pay attention and consider always that the part in which there is the wound be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And therefore you should do this with large wounds and middling wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And for small wounds, do what is prepared for you; and indeed the ministering of it should be between your fingers, which hold the wound with its own hand and adjust its edges, and indeed uncover from it to that which will sew it shut, so that any cause for sewing is removed.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common way of sewing: you take a needle and thread according to the length of the wound's size; then let go of the end of the disruption with your thumb, and draw in the thread one, so that you do not put the thread through both ends of the wound, by the fingers, within which hold the wound with its own hand; and you have joined together the two ends of the codon by the two ends of the ciphac, and so you have made four stitches.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And now take a strong thread and double it around the needle, and tie some knots at both ends, and then bring the two lips of the wound together with a decent tie; and leave the thickness of the finger, and insert another needle there, and tie that also with thread in the same way as you did with the first needle; and keep doing this if it is necessary with needles until you have completed the whole length of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be neither too large nor too small, for thin needles easily penetrate the flesh; and thick ones are difficult to insert in the wound, and therefore let them be smaller in thickness but larger in length.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And let the needle not be placed at both ends of the wound nearby, so that the flesh is not cut too much and the wound opens before it has healed.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And they must not be prolonged with a stitch so that the wound is not prohibited from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And now insert the ends of the needles so that they do not bother the patient when he sleeps; and place over the stitch powdered herbs spread out on both sides, which will hold the ends of the needles in place; and leave them there until you know that the wound has healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this method of stitching with needles is most convenient for small wounds, as it only requires one or two needles to be stitched around them.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second stitch is done as follows: you must stitch the four ends, of the wound and two ends of the head in one go, with a needle which has thread wrapped around it, both thin and thick.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when you have penetrated all four ends with the needle, return the needle to the point from which you started, so that the thread is pulled back towards the wound, so that the stitch is like a stitch of cloth, and the cloths are tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And leave between each stitch the width of a little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this is the stitch for men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this stitch I healed a wound that a man had received on his belly, and it was a stab wound of more than one palm in length, and the rupture was of half a palm on the right side of the belly, and the disruption was in the middle of the limb; and then I returned him after the intestine had been outside for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was healed within 15 days or so, and he recovered, and then he left after a few months, and is doing well in his health.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And other doctors had judged that he would not heal; but by miracle he was healed, for I did not cure him with ointment, as it was a place where ointment could not be applied or any medicine put on, but I placed over the wound a cotton pad twice a day and washed it often with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will tell you of two kinds of stitches proper according to the account of the Word.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And you must start by stitching the wound closed from the outside in.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And therefore as the needle penetrates the wound and into that part from outside to inside, leave the end of the head in the part from which you started; and then let the other end of the head penetrate from the inside out at the other end of the limb.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have done that penetration, then let the other end of the head penetrate another time in that meteyssa extremity of the limb from the outside to the inside; and leave the end of the head that is on this side, and let the needle penetrate at the other end of the limb from the inside out.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And let that penetration by which you are making the head penetrate in the extremity of the limb in which it is, penetrate all the way through.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then start from this side and stitch that with the end that is of the head on the other side, and withdraw the needle from the wound which it has penetrated, and then return it to that wound and stitch the extremity of the limb that is on the other side with that extremity of the limb; and withdraw that from the wound which it has penetrated.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and then again, and do this once more so that you sew up all that which is outside according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this method of stitching is that you sew with a stitch of skin, so that you stitch the head one time from the end of the wound, and leave it in there until you have completed it on the other side.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second proper stitch which I teach is called Gualia's stitch, and it is of a limed kind that is recommended for one who is ill, so you sew it according to similarity in which all parts are joined together conveniently by nature; and the end of one is applied to the end of another, and this is done according to how you see fit.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Let the needle be placed in the end of the limb from which you start towards the outside, and let it penetrate to the inside in the sole, and leave two ends of the head; and then turn the needle around and let it penetrate from the outside to the inside at two ends of the limb.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn those around, and let some of them penetrate from the inside to the outside at two ends of the limb on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of stitching is better than common stitching, and it is the stitch by which previous memory is recalled.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is Gualia's limed kind.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And they say also that stomach stitching is straightened with two needles, so you insert in these a thread, and start from where you are towards the other side according to sewing of those whose hearts are joined together equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when a rupture is in the middle of the belly, then the stitching of it is more difficult than of other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the game of medicine of wound is judgment of other wounds.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	The cause of which is when you know the wound to be recent with blood before air alters it, and reduce the intestine and stitch it up and dress it decently, then pause over that incarnative powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if air has already altered the wound, then pause over that some ointments which are to you within so they make hard stone and draw in the threads, and be stitched up head and limb; and then cure it thus as is the cure of other wounds until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines, then pause over that at once, for when it begins to discharge pus, wash it well and change that twice a day, as you teach him, until it is healed, for you must not indulge in other medicine in different conditions when wounds are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the wound communicates with the principal limbs, then submerge lion wool in oil of tempered quality, or in rosin oil, and pause that over the parts which are between the angles and under the sockets.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if you feel pain or putrefaction in your intestines, when it is many times thus, let it be cauterized with black styptic vinegar, and especially so if the rottenness is from the intestine and has made an exit penetrating into the cavity of it.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that the one that is in the large intestine is more difficult to heal than the one in the small intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine called "gland" does not receive healing from any plague that enters it, and this is due to the great multitude of veins that are in it, and because of its magnitude, and because of the subtlety of its body, and because of its proximity to the nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if that which proceeds from the plague is the membrane, and you find it recently affected, reduce it according to your expertise, by which you reduce the intestines equally.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed into space and is already black or green, then you should apply gall to the place where it has turned black, so that blood comes out in a flow, for there are veins and arteries in the membrane.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then cut into that which is the other side of the membrane and attach two ends of the gall to the area below where the plague came out, so that on you is lessened the attraction of it due to the cutting of the membrane and emission of the root of the plague.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Remembrance of plagues when they occur in the intestine.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a disruption occurs in the intestine and it is small, then it is possible that it can be restored in some people, for I saw one who had been plagued in his belly by lancing and the plague was of the right side of the stomach, and the plague was ancient and made a fistula, and he was made to drink and belch.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then I followed the healing of him, and it was believed that he would not be healed, but I continued to sutilize that within which healed and the place is consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I saw the place already consolidated, so I went upon the patient that he got over the evil in his belly; and no one got sick from that evil accident and he resumed eating and drinking, and also entered into bath and was exercised in his wits.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced ones already said that when a plague occurs in the intestine and it is small, then it should be bound according to this manner: and it is that you take gum from great pods; and then adjust the two lips of the plague and place one of those gums which have an open mouth over the two lips of the plague; therefore when you put that on and press its mouth, cut off the pod of it, for it adheres and is not dissolved.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And then place another gum near the first one, and do not cease to do this with gums one after another according to the quantity of the whole plague.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then reduce it and bind the plague; and let those pods remain attached in the intestine until the intestine is healed; and do not harm the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.
