And it is possible that the intestine be bound with a subtle thread which is made from the intestine of an animal annexed to it, for it is more in needle; and it is that you take the end of these intestinal threads, and it is well stripped, and then bind the end of it with a thread of it, wrapped, and then insert that thread in needles and sew up with it the disruption.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this manner of sewing with gum is not but according to way of confidence and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the plague is great and broad, especially if it is in one of the small intestines, for then there is not but subtilization, and not healing of it altogether.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of healing of ulcer and fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that all plague and apostema when it becomes old and turns into an ulcer, and is not consolidated and has a root all the time and is not cut off, then in any member it is, universally it is named fistula, and we call it azucem.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And fistula according to truth is knotted flesh, hard, white with which there is no pain and at which it is hollowed out as it is hollowed out from a tooth; and because of this it is named some nodules, that is pain.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in some people moist, which has a root; and strongly the moisture is cut off in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is moved, and it is little, and it is thick, and it is subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already said in the division when I spoke of plagues that all ulcer which is not healed nor naked flesh but one of nine causes: one of which is by lack of blood in the body; or by malice of it; or because between it and the lips there is hard flesh prohibiting birth of flesh; or because it is of moved leges; or because that ulcer within itself is putrid and the matter which is in it is of bad quality; or because the medicine is unsuitable in the healing of it; or when corruption happens in the region, and it is pestilential; or due to property of the region, likewise when it happens in Saragossa, in which there is difficult digestion of diseases, and that healing of apostema is delayed by nature; or because in it there is bone, or moved bones.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	And I have already shown all those causes, and the signs of them, and their healing with medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And so that I make you know the healing of fistula which is made by way of operation with hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistula occurs in all parts of the body; for some of them reach the great veins and arteries, or the nerves, or the brain, or the intestine, or the bladder, or one of the ribs, or to any of the vertebrae of the back, or to any of the joints composed by composition as of the hand and the foot; and those are which give proximity to the principal member and their likes.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And so that one of those fistulas which are according to this manner is of diseases of difficult healing, and does not receive curing, and occupation with it is work and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if there is any of the fistulas whose depth does not reach those places which I said, and you hope for and trust in its healing, and you want to come into knowledge of it, then take a probe of iron or steel, and if the fistula goes according to rightness, and you examine that with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is tortuous, then investigate that with a probe of subtle lead, for lead by the lightness of its body is drawn away and curved according to the tortuousness.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has terrible movements, it is not possible for you to signify about it with probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then christen the hole by its holes, for the moisture by which you christen that comes from the other holes and flows from them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire carefully, according to what manner it is possible for you to know if here there are bones or nerves, and it is the hollow of the fistula distant or near, or it is a fistula to which its holes are moved and this over all by the sum of your strength, by your inquiry with hand on the place, and its likes according to the signs and causes accidental to the apostema.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have stood upon all those causes with true state, then go to the healing according to confidence: and it is that you consider then if it is an apparent fistula near or in a place saline, distant from joint, or of nerve, or of artery, or of vein, or one of the places which I said to you and told.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then dry the fistula as mentioned earlier in the narrative, remove anything in that opening and from decayed flesh, and cure what is born of the orifice of the flesh, the skin, and similar, until it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of great depth and according to right reasoning, then you must insert that into the orifice as far as you can, then cleanse it of all its decayed flesh; and apply hot metals wrapped in sharp medicines, and insert those into the cavity of the fistula which you have grasped with forceps.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do that a few times until the sharp medicine corrodes all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	Then restore it with ointments which produce healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by that, then cauterize it as we have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of fistula is bone and you are certain of that, then examine it and dry it according to what we have said, unless you forbid any cause of vein or nerve or main member as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is decay and darkness in it, then cut away that decay until all of it is removed; then cure that with what will cause flesh to grow over it until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and there are still bruises as before, then know that you have not achieved the complete eradication of the decay; then uncover it again and perform the reason for it and the cleansing of it with great care a second time, and restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if it is healed, that is good; but if not, then know that the decay is in the great depth of the body which you have not achieved, and so with that you should only let it be.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the decayed bone is small or you are able to pull it out, then pull it out with thin forceps which are suitable for that.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then perform the extraction of all of them, and of none of them let any cause remain with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if you are hindered by any cause of moisture, and there is no fear or mistake in their insertion, then insert those limbs or flesh if they are here, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones from that moment, then place over the wound something which will fester the wound, and leave it so that nothing is around those bones of flesh and limbs, and guard the wound so that it is not consolidated, and the section which you have cut in your operation is constrained.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Habbants, if you fear, place over it a poultice drenched in oil, or a poultice drenched in Egyptian ointment, or one of the green ointments; for when those flesh poultices puss, and the bones are separated from the incision, and that attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone like the bone of leg or thigh or similar to those, and what is decayed is only its surface, then cut away that with a razor only behind so that the darkness and decay are removed, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if what is decayed in it is a large portion, and the decay has already reached the medulla of the bone, then it is a necessary cause to close that and to cut all around where the decay has come, then cure that so that it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I count on you to lean over a man's thigh so that you pause that as example and helper over your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man of about 30 years had pain in his thigh, and from the parts within the jaw it spread to the substance within the body where the substance was pervaded to the jaw, and it was matter of pustule with great pustule, and there was no extrinsic cause to him.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the time was prolonged with that due to the error of the doctors until the pustule became open, and many matters came out of it, and its cure was properly paused until the leg became fistulous, and there were in it many orifices which all poured pus and the moistures of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then he was cured by many doctors for about two years, and there was not found any skill in them but in the art where I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the matters flowing from it from those orifices to great extent; and indeed that man's body was all emaciated and his colour was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted the tent into one of those orifices and it reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then I probed all the orifices and found out that they came from all parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I cut and entered into one of those orifices until I discovered a part of the bone, and found it decayed, and it was already earthy and decayed and blackened; and a part of the leg had been decayed where it had penetrated within the membrane.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I tied that which was revealed to me and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I saw that it was not in the bone but that decay which I had cut and tied off, and I had already cut away at it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then I paused the restoration of the wound with consolidative medicine for a long time, yet it was not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I iterated and discovered again on the bone secondarily over the first discovery, and found continued decay in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I tied that which appeared to me of that decay, and then I saw it was necessary to perform the cure of it and its restoration, yet it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I discovered on it another time and did not cease to insert the bone little by little particularly and to probe the restoration of it, yet it was not restored until I had cut around a palm of it, and that extracted with its medulla, and then I restored it with medicines, and it was lightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it was not necessary to iterate the operation on him and the section on him except for the disposition of his fainting and the weakness of his toleration of death, because he became faint at all hours from the superfluity of evacuation, a bad syncope.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And so he is healed with whole healing, and there is nothing in the place of hard bone; and his disposition is good within his body, and his strength returned to him, and he conversed in his dispositions, and did not make him contrary in walking nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the eminent bone is in place in the body already removed, then you must dry it according to this manner: and take a string and tighten that at the extremity of that eminent bone, and command someone who extends it from there; then pause that string of wool rather thick of the first string; and then lie that on the flesh that is below the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you draw the flesh to the parts below, and you discover the flesh over the place where you want to cut so that the saw does not cut the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And pause over the bone properly, for when you do that there is not prohibited the saw which does not cut the decayed flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And let the sawing be over the decayed place little by little, for if it is in the cavity of the bone and does not appear in its appearance to feeling, and force it to be sawn again another time.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	If the bone is rotten and not prominent, before it is one piece joined with the other, and the corruption is in a small place or in part of it, then you discover the flesh of all parts; and then pause the fust, and then saw that of the first part where the corruption is, so that it is continuous with the sawing of the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the sawing be according to the location of the corruption, a little, according to what we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut into that corrupted joint and saw the bone where it continues to the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not rational but absurd.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or the foot, it is very difficult; however, one should inquire into the corruption and see how it appears to you, and open it according to each disposition that is possible for you, and with any absurdity be rectified by you when it does not contradict a vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the cutting instruments and saws for cutting these bones are very different according to the situation of the bones, their preparation, thickness, subtlety, magnitude, smallness, hardness, and rarity; therefore, one should prepare every kind of instrument convenient for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation signifies to you about the kind of instrument for which you are in need; when with you is great study and length and knowledge of the ways of this art, and testimony of ways of illnesses, because then you already have by your physicians that which is convenient to the instruments of all illnesses.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I have shown to you at the end of this chapter the number of instruments with which you will proceed with simples, with which you will proceed to your prohibition, which you will experience on the others.
Forma de serra:	Shape of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	And the shape of another saw is for operation of the head, so that the point is with two and with three teeth and with four.
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of a razor:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this razor be according to the shape of the head of a starfish, and its points according to the shape of the points of an almond.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it does not behoove but that with this are rubbed the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or is a large mouth wide open.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a larger razor than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of smaller razors:
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of side razors:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Shape of another saw decently made: let it be made an arc from the most superior part and the acuity of it of steel, and the member of it of boy's dagger decently made.
Forma de lu:	Its shape is:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor in which it has a concavity:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Shape of another subtle razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor with a curved extremity:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small razor like a tent:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of an incisor with which bones are cut:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another smaller incisor:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incisor; this one is like a saw, and its extremity is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the rationale of bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a saw which is convenient for the rationale of that which is pierced by bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and of acute extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of steel of India, and similarly, all the causes that we have said of saws and of incisers and of saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of extreme cutting edges and of the locking of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be pushed or for an intrinsic cause or for an extrinsic cause, or when you have medicated that corruption with treatment of those medicines and the treatment does not confer, or see the corruption go beyond the member which you do not perceive any cause, then one should insert that member into that in which the corruption is, so that the patient escapes through death or evilness, which is a greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that to which it happens is that the member is made black as if fire had burned it, or it swells close to the blackness as the burning goes into that member which seizes all the body; and then cut off that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the cause of the corruption is impact of some poisonous causes like scorpion venom or from a sea-scorpion or from a viper or from similar ones.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or impact is in the extremity of the finger, then you cut off the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it goes into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it happens to the hand, then you cut off that from the joint of the elbow, and do not give space to the corruption so that it goes into the elbow joint of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you do not want to, then cut off the arm in the junction of the shoulder.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes on and turns around the shoulder, then in that is the death of the patient; and to add another cause besides this for treatment is a quantity of vertue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, if corruption happens on the foot, then you cut off that into one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it seizes in the sole of the foot, then you cut off all the foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it goes into the toe, then you cut off the toe at the junction of the toe.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption is already come upon the toe, then in it there is not remedy but dismissal, and let the patient go to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way of cutting off the member or of sawing it is that you press the ligament in the part most below where you want to cut off, and press another ligament on top of the place; and extend the minister one ligament to the parts below, and extend the other minister over it; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments, then let it be cut off or sawed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And one should be stopped with a ligature of the vessels on all sides so that it does not touch the place, and that it comes to the patient injured constricted and suppurating and cauterized.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flows from the wound, then you should cauterize the site, or place some powder on it that restricts the flow of blood; and then return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then bind the affected limb with a bandage in a suitable way, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I remember to you that one man had a blackness on his foot, this incident that I and you recounted, which happened to him by burning that was like fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption first occurred in his toe, extending throughout the foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared some remedies for himself as the treatment went to the limb with the strength of it, and he was overcome by pain and burning, and he applied that foot up to the joint, and it healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that man had that corruptive condition in his finger on his hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and so I punctured that surplus with what I put on his hand of the medicines, and then purified his body; and the surplus was not absorbed but began to go to another finger as it started in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to cut his hand, and I did not want to do that hoping for the absorption of that surplus, but fearing death from the cutting of the hand, for the power of the illness was towards destruction.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he despaired from me, he returned to his land and reached me that this man prepared and cut off his entire hand, and he healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this account except that it may be an aid about what happens from this illness, and that it is a sign by which it is known and according to which it operates.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	About the treatment of hemorrhoids and the quality of the enema with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy parts and the space of the abscess is prolonged as it collects pus, and then it is broken and punctured, and the pus is discharged from it, and it remains empty like a vessel, and the codicle that is on top of it dries up with a thin membrane, and there has not been reached to a deeper corruption, nor has it impressed on bone or nerve or ligament, it is called sinus, and is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space is prolonged as corruption impregnates in some part, then it is called a fistula and not sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And its treatment is that you cut off the entire codicle as it is rolled up, and especially when it is thin and done with a cloth, and cauterize so that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you expect the codicle to adhere and that corruption has not reached its consequences, and in the codicle there is space, then you treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is considered as a sinus, and if it is large, and the breath that comes from it is fetid, then enema that with an Egyptian medicine which is of oil and sour wine and thinnest honey received in parts, and are put into a vessel, and are cut over the fire until the medicine becomes hot and reaches the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and enema that sinus with that, and plug the opening of it, and let the medicine stay in there for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then pull that out with caution; and do that for so many days until the sinus is purified and the shame is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is enema with ash water when you do not have that medicine; and take ashes from a vine, and put on it water; and then pour that and enema that sinus with it until you are convinced that the sinus has stopped.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient has no tolerance for the Egyptian medicine or ash water, then enema that with water and honey mixed with thin thinnest honey, and enema that sinus with wine and honey mixed, because of the property of honey is that it purifies and washes, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and especially when in the wine there is surplus of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do that several times and you are convinced that the sinus has healed, then enema that with what makes the flesh in it grow.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And take some thin dye and dissolve that with roasted oil and astringent wine, or enema that with some medicines and other dyes that I have written in the treatment of dyes.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow that the cannula of the enema is not received, then you enlarge it with a small iron little by little, and put in there calcium wrapped in Egyptian ointment or in basilikon ointment until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the opening is large, then you gather its lips with a suture and take off from it the quantity in which between the enemas there is an addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening of it from which the breath runs is elevated to its parts above, then dry that in the hollow place from which the breath runs in so that the flesh engendered in there is dried, for when the breath is constricted in the depth of the sinus the flesh is engendered in there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus within the bone pus base according to how you want, then it is forced that you prepare the limb with a preparation by which the breath runs softly according to what appears to you and that there is not retained in there any cause of the breath.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines which are put on the sinus conveniently according to what you want extending those over thin linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the linen is of such great quantity as it makes the communication of the whole sinus; and then insert that with forceps in the right side of the opening of the sinus a little more ample than the opening of the sinus, and then extend over another linen of the dyes lions according to the quantity of the cut, and put those over it for position distant from the opening of the sinus so that the discharge of the breath is not closed on it and not press the linen greatly except after some days once a day.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the opening of the sinus, which heals in a whole hour because it dries that which is closed in there of the breath.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if that which runs from it is motion or a little, or is digested or not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And with that consider the place of that sinus if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if there is an abscess in it.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in that manner and you see the matter which is shed over the opening of the sinus already adheres or the adhesion is increased, then loosen it on the third day, and when you loosen the bandage change the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if a subtle pus flows from the sinus, then do not despair of its adhesion because it heals, for some people in which there is late generation of flesh in their wounds and others in which is done the contrary of that.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the breath is not digested after several days from the sinus do not know that it does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and is prolonged cause, then adjust it in desiccation of the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their strength are dry like a thin dye when the surplus of addition of zegi is adjusted in it.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last part of the body that is cured is where you should apply a thin ointment dissolved in rose oil, and on top of it apply old wine equal to its substance, and then comfort him with that and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And in that action, when there is no strength, use a thin ointment, honey when it is cut and made thick, and use it; or take myrrh and aloe and incense, and mix them all together and pulverize them over the fire, and then line it on a cloth and place it over the navel; and line the honey that you have cut and made thick with it, and pulverize it over the cloth.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes you should give him a long and thin aristology of celestial lily (which is the celestial lily) and farina of err and centaurea, and use those simples or adjust them, crush them and sift them over the honey that I have mentioned; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the navel is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, then you will know that the corruption is in his bowels, and he does an inquiry into the bones or other hard members or to the tissues; then you should treat it with a fistular cure as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of treatment of paronychia and nail abrasion and digit addition and section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panaritis is an abscess that develops under the nail of the finger of the hand or foot, and it rarely affects other fingers, and when it is prolonged and its treatment is neglected, there is an abscess of pus, or it becomes corrupt and erode the matrix of the nail, and it strongly affects the entire nail, and the corruption strongly penetrates into the bone within which it has a fetid odor, and the end of the finger becomes rotten, and its color turns brown.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And if you have that which we mentioned in the division and do not find relief from your treatment, then know that you must cut away all the excess that has accumulated under the nail, and then cauterize the wound with hot iron, for cautery is beneficial in such cases.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is intact and the nail is healthy, and the edges of the nail are pushing against each other and starting to pierce it, then you should apply a thin thread under the nail's edge that is piercing the flesh, and lift it up and insert that flesh with ease, and place on top of it something caustic that has been dissolved within until everything is cauterized; and then treat it with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already penetrated into the bone, then you must cut out that bone and extract it, for it will not be healed as long as the corrupt bone remains within it.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the rottenness and corruption have gone into the finger, then you should cut it off at one of its joints according to where it is affected most, and then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if there is a blow or abrasion to the nail, and because of that there is severe pain, then you should at the beginning let the patient's blood flow, and then cut off the nail with a sharp spatulum with a transverse incision above it, and be careful not to let the incision penetrate into the flesh below the nail, for you will cause great pain to the patient, and also cause an excess of flesh to grow in that place; and then treat that place until the pain subsides.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But a finger that is born to some men is very fleshy, and in it there are few bones, or its nail is very thin.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of a joint, or their origin is from some joints of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born at some joints of the finger is not painful, and that which is born at the joints is usually very painful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are born fleshy, their section is easier, and you should cut it off at its root with a broad spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But of that which is born at the root of a joint, its treatment is difficult; and therefore be careful about its incision.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in that which is born at the joints of the finger, you should cut off at the beginning the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then saw with one of those convenient saws for it, and then treat it until it is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But consolidation which happens to the fingers many times, or because of the nature of the person who is born that way, or because of consolidation of a wound, or because of burning with fire, or because of similar things; therefore you should dry up that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between them cloths dipped in rose oil so that they are not consolidated too quickly, and separate those fingers or place a thin lead plate between them until they are consolidated as desired.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation happens in some fingers with the palm, then you should dry up that consolidation according to its preparation and convenience to the figure of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of cuts from injuries, these are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are caused by varicose veins, and they are thick wrapped veins full of melancholic humors that come in the members of the body, and their greatest occurrence is in the feet, and especially in the feet of travellers, laborers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore you should administer a purgation of the body from black bile several times with strong expulsion, and then let the patient bleed from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But their treatment by iron is according to two methods: one is that it is cut and the black blood is drawn out, and the other method is that the vein is elevated and all of it is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	Its section is according to this method: at the beginning soak the foot in warm water until the gross blood is dissolved, which is feculent from the foot, and then tighten the foot of the patient at the part above the pus-filled sore of the leg with a bandage, and then dry up the vein in one, or two, or three places with a broad incision, and then elevate the black blood with the palm of the hand from the part below the foot until you have extracted as much as you wish, and as much as the strength of the patient can bear.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind that up, and order him to abstain from black bile-generating foods.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by bloodletting whenever the veins are full, and notice the patient's condition.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But their elevation is according to this method: you warm the foot of the patient, if it is swollen with petechiae, and then place him in a bath and soak his foot in warm water until it becomes relaxed and the veins are dilated; or he must exercise himself strongly, if there is no bath available, until the member is warmed.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then dry up the vein in the right side of the leg by incision in the thigh or in the back of it above the ankle, or in the base of the foot.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the vein with nails and scratch the vein in every part where it appears to the sense, and it is required that you notice if that turns dark.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And therefore when you open and scratch the vein, you will see that it is white underneath.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you place under that a thread so that it is elevated and bled from the vein, and stop that with lion's tooth.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section, approximately three digits in size, and then strip away the skin of the area above the vein where it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate that section and incision it in the back, and then extract that section and elevate it where it is exited by the second section, and then extract it from above the section.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do that as you extract it from the highest section or highest of all sections, where it is exited; and then incision it there.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you don't see it to extract and elevate, then insert a strong curved needle with a thread through that section, and ligature it and extract it, or insert under there the needle and turn your hand around everywhere where it is stuck.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful that it is not cut; for if it is broken, it will be difficult to elevate that part and it has come over the patient through that wound.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you have completely extracted it, then place on the site of the plague wool soaked in wine and rose oil, and cure that part as it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is contracted with torsion and there is no straightness as we have said, then you must split that part of the torsion and suspension of it, and elevate it with pincers as much as you can.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful that you don't incision the vein and plague it, for it will be difficult to elevate it; use your judgement in that matter.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of incision with which the vein is dried:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of pincers:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not acute with pincers nor has an acute extremity so that it doesn't plague the vein; and it is of great flexibility like a lion, for if it was subtle, it would incision the vein by its subtlety; it has superficial thickness in it as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On extraction of the vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in southern lands like Al-Ategi in the land of Arabs and in the southern and arid lands of little tenderness and in which there is no grass nor openings.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And very rarely it is generated in other parts of the body other than the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its gestation is of putrefaction that comes from below the vein like poison within the body of serpents and worms and snails and worms generating between the vein and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the advent of it is of this vein that happens in the leg a vehement inflammation; and then the site is blistered; and then the vein exits the site of that blister which resembles the root of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the end appears, then you should wrap around it a piece of lead weighing as much as a drachma, and tie that and leave the lead hanging from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as you see some cause to the parts deflating, wrap that in lead and hold it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the part is prolonged, then you incision a part of it and wrap the remainder; and don't incision that which is exited as it is exited, for if you incision it, it will contract and enter into the flesh and cause an abscess and pus in the site and a bad ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	So that it is drawn out smoothly and is extracted little by little as it is exited from the end of it and does not wind back in the body for any cause.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein it exits in some men who are in its length of five palms and ten, and I have seen one that exits twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised in the hour of its medicine, then insert the needle into its hollow and pierce it with a long hole through the body so that it evacuates everything that is in the matter, and administer putrefaction of the site for several days with medicines; and then cure that for the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has branchy motions, and mostly when it appears at the junction of the leg or in the leg, and to it come motionless orifices, and it exits from each orifice a ram.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And then cure that as we have said in division and with what is above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	On the generation of worms under the skin and it is called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is named in some land because of the cow's disease since it sometimes affects oxen and there is a worm which is born between the vein and the flesh, and goes throughout the body pushing and penetrating, and is shown by its movement from part to part as it ruptures the vein and exits out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is through putrefaction of some humors like worms and serpents and earthworms and tapeworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for its malice, for when it goes in the body and is elevated to the head, and it has reached the brain, then it pierces in it and destroys the brain, and from there it sometimes moves around.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure it and extract it, then it is not done unless through its movement and appearance, and then you must draw what is above it and what is below it with ligation and strong constriction, and then incision it and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is buried in the flesh and you don't touch it, then you place cautery with fire on the site where it dwells, and the greatest cause that is feared is corruption of it as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see it pervening to the head near the brain, then draw on the forehead with a strong constriction, and then incision it and extract that; and let the patient use purification of his body with evacuant medicines, and guard against food generating putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the generation of disease in children.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is named in our land as children, and it is a pain that comes to some parts, and then it is transferred from part to part.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen that according to what you will tell me.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	He was called to a woman patient in a village, and he discovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and when it was rubbed for an hour, that inflammation rose like silver when it moved from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then it went to the pain of that site and became stuck in the muscle, and then it stayed there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it went to the other body as it pervened to the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then he showed me that it was revolving through all his body as I saw; and there was great marvel at its change of speed from part to part.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen that before in my own eyes according to that manner, but I have seen motions that transfer the pain from part to part.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see that in arms as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think that it was that because the woman was old, of frail body and veins uncovered, and in her appeared that movement changed.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear according to this retro-cure in those who are delicate and with bodies of veins pressed together.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want to treat the patient and he feels that pain, then it is not for you to appear in front of him as we have said, then you strengthen him on that and gently press him there where that windiness is blocked, and cauterize the spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it with your own eyes, then cure him by evacuating the body and expelling windiness, and treat those ulcers with stinking pills, and pills of serapium, and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	On the extraction of arrows:
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse according to their species and according to the parts of the body they affect: for their diversity is that some have large points, and small, and concave, and blunt, and solid; and among them there are those with three angles, and those with tongues, and those which are stars.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And those which affect the limbs and the feet depend on two types: for the limbs are either major causes, such as the brain, heart, liver, lung, intestines, bladder, and their likes; and thus when pain strikes one of these limbs and you experience symptoms of death, which I will recount later, then you must avoid extracting that arrow from those in whom the signs of death are most prominent, and when you do not observe these signs of death, and the arrow is not deeply lodged in the limb, then extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of the soul are when an arrow strikes it, and pierces the bone, and exits through the hole which is above the brain, for then there occurs violent vomiting, and scotomata, and vertigo, and burning in the eyes, and inflammation and burning of the tongue, and spasms and confusion of the mind and vomiting of bile, and the voice becomes very hoarse and destroyed, and there is a discharge of white moisture from the wound site, and his eyes look like water.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And so if you observe these signs, then refrain from treating the wound and extracting the arrow unless it has exited.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of the arrow when it strikes the heart are that it is near the left nipple, and feels as though it were lodged in a hard substance, and is not a soft cause; and the movement of the arrow is very similar to the movement of the pulse, and black blood flows from the wound, and there is chilliness of the extremities, and sweat, and fainting; and so know that death descends quickly.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung are sputum of bloody foam from the wound, and the vessels near the neck are swollen, and the color of the patient changes, and he exhales a great spirit with breath, and asks for fresh air to breathe.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes the diaphragm which is in the chest, then the pain is near the small ribs, and there is made a great wound with violent pain and with sighing, and not all of the limbs of the muscles are paralyzed.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow strikes the stomach, then quickly see in the wound some undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.
