And if the arrow strikes the abdomen and is lodged in it, see some rent in the wound, or the membrane, or intestine which is torn, and there is no hope for a cure of him through extracting the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow strikes the bladder and urine exits from it, and some cause processes outward from there to the parts outside, and there is great pain upon the patient, then know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	But the other limbs such as the face, neck, jaw, shoulders, back, ribs, breastbone, thigh, and their likes of the limbs are saved according to the most prominent dispositions when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount to you what I have seen of the nature of these arrows so that you may know about your treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that in a man who had an arrow stuck in the tear duct of his eye, when I extracted it from him through the other side of his nostril, and removed the grays of his eyebrow, he was healed and no harm befell him.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew which had struck him in the grays of his eye, below the eyelid, and the arrow was already concealed and he did not manage to get it except for a small tip with which it adhered to his staff, and it was a great arrow of the sharp arrows of the Turks, with a lion ferrule on which there were no eyebrows.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew was healed, and no harm befell his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian which had struck him in the jaw, and it was an Arabic arrow, and it was that to which there were eyebrows; and then I inserted it between two fingers, and it was already submerged in his jaw; and then I made it smaller with that, and then extracted it, and the Christian was healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man which had struck him in the belly, and I thought he would die from it; and so when thirty days had passed and there was not changed upon him any cause of his dispositions, I inserted into the arrow and moved it about, and he was healed and no harm befell him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw a man in whom an arrow had struck the back of his thigh and the wound had healed over him, and after close to seven years, the arrow exited through the root of his thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had struck her belly and the wound had healed over her, and she was not changed in her dispositions, and the woman did not suffer harm in any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow had struck his face and the wound had healed over him, and the arrow was broken but he did not feel any pain, and similar signs occurred with these.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow of the prince of the king's son who had struck him in the bridge of his nose and it had exited through the right side, and the entire arrow was concealed.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat him when the arrow had entered three days prior.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I found the wound of the arrow tight, and then I probed it with a subtle probe, and he did not feel that; but he felt a sting below his right eyebrow, and then I sensed that the sting was from the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied the spot with ointment in which there is an atractive and digestive virtue, confident that the spot would appear to me as the location of the arrow, so that it exits over it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And there did not occur in the spot any significant accident that the arrow had struck that spot; and I continued with the ointment over him for several days, and no accident occurred; and the wound healed up in between, and he recovered from the extraction of him after a space of several days until one day he felt the arrow within his nose and showed it to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I applied to the wound sharp and corrosive medicine for several days until pus opened, and with a probe I probed that, and found the tip of the arrow which adhered to the staff.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I applied in the perception of the wound with that sharp medicine until it appeared to me visibly the tip of the arrow, and passed over time with that for the space of four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And when the wound has become very inflamed, and it is possible for me to insert forceps into it, and I have cleaned it out, and there is no obstruction preventing its extraction, then I do not cease to manipulate it with clever techniques until, on a particular day, I extract it with specially made forceps, as will be described in the final section of this chapter; and I then repair that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors believe that the cartilage of the nose cannot be restored, but I have restored it and consolidated the wound; and the patient was completely healed and suffered no ill effects.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I will now describe the quality of the extraction of certain arrows so that you may understand the rule and significance of what I have not described, for the parts of this art and the definitions of those terms are not covered in this book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the skilled surgeon compares a few things about motion, and what is present to what is absent; and he discovers new operations and new instruments through the descent of foreign causes into the art when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And so I say that arrows are not extracted from the members in which they are lodged, except according to two methods: either by attraction of the place where they enter, or by the opposite of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is lodged in a fleshy place and is drawn out and extracted is an arrow.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not obey the extraction in the hour in which it is cut, then you must leave it for a few days until the flesh around it has healed and the attraction and exit of the arrow have been alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is lodged in bone and does not obey your extraction, then leave it for a few days and repeat the attraction and motion of it every day until it is extracted.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not obey your extraction for several days, then you must pierce the circumference of the arrow in that bone with a very fine instrument until the space around the arrow is enlarged and you can then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is lodged in the bone of the head and has already reached one of the ventricles of the brain, and the patient exhibits some of those symptoms which I have mentioned, then abstain from extracting the arrow and leave it for several days until its nature is equilibrated; for if the arrow penetrates to the brain, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is lodged only in the core of the bone and does not penetrate into the brain, and the patient remains for several days without experiencing any of those symptoms, then you must manipulate both the attraction of the arrow and the attraction of the patient himself.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is lodged in the bone and does not obey your extraction, then you must apply instruments to the circumference of the arrow as we have recommended, and then heal the area around it.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is lodged deeply in the body and is hidden from sight, then you must probe it with a probe, and if you feel it, then draw it out with some instruments suitable for attracting it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it because of the constriction of the wound and because of the length of the weapon, and there is no bone or nerve or vein in the way, then pierce the wound until it is enlarged and the arrow can be extracted.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if there are nails holding it in place, then you must loosen the flesh in which it is lodged completely all around with whatever skill you can; and manipulate it until you can free the flesh from the fracture of the nails and their twisting until it obeys.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in whatever place it is, then use with twisting of your hand and forceps on all sides until it obeys; and manipulate with great subtlety so that the arrow is not broken and so that its extraction is not made difficult for you.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot extract it in one day, then leave it for a few days until the parts around it have healed, and then repeat the process when it has been alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if you experience contrary bleeding, then administer what we have said about healing in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard your skill from cutting into a vein or nerve, or tendon, and manipulate it in every way possible to extract the arrow; and do this with ease and tranquility, and slowness and firmness, just as I have recommended to you and as you have recommended to yourself.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore you should contract the arrow so that the patient is in accordance with the figure according to which the position of the arrow is in him, for it is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if this is not possible for you, then you must administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But the arrows which are extracted by the opposite of the other part, or which have already entered into some part from outside, or cause hollowness in the extremity of the arrow due to sensitivity of the part above the joint nearest it, then you cut it; and the section should be according to the amount by which the forceps grasp it; and then draw it out, for it is made easier to extract.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, then you twist with contrary motion until the arrow is impressed into the bone, and widen the hole by yourself, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave it for a few days and then repeat the process until it is extracted.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is in that, then you push it out with him.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft is broken and you want to administer impact, then you insert it into the arrow so that its concave part enters the concavity of the arrow and then push it out with him.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, then you push it out with a strong instrument inserted into it, for the arrow is alleviated by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then you must hollow out all the flesh in which the venom is, if it is possible for you to do so, and then heal that with whatever is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow hits in the foot, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the side, and is near enough for you to touch it with your probe, and it is possible for you to cut it, then cut it and guard against cutting into a vein or nerve; and extract that, and then sew up the wound if it bleeds, and heal that until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which arrows are drawn out:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their ends should be like the beak of an owl that they grip the arrow so that it does not let go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And they should be made in different shapes, large and small, according to the amount of the size of the arrow and its weakness, and according to the width of the wound and its constriction.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of hollow impact made with this concave end like an owl's beak so that the instrument of the arrow is alleviated in it and a push of that which is hidden:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of impact of a hidden end:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	like this with a twist so that the instrument of it is alleviated in the concave arrow and is pushed by that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of puncturing the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins of fleubotomy, from which blood usually flows. of which there are in the head .xvi., there are two pulsating veins which are near the ears, some say; two herbs that appear on both temples; and two veins that are in two lacrimal of two hulls that are called aspicientz; and the vein prepared in the middle part of the forehead, and the vein that is at the end of the nose; and two guidegi that are on the neck; and two veins that are above the lip; and two veins that are below the lip; and — these are the veins that are called algelic —; and there are two veins that are below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are bled in the arms are .v.; four of those are cephalic, and is due to the wild side; and the people call  “the vein of the head”, and is deaf, and is a middle vein, and is composed of one branch of the basilica, and of another ram of the cephalica; and they name that one the people  “vein of all the body”, and basilica is the vein which is paused on the domestic side, and is named  “citillar”, and they call that one the common people  “vein of the belly”; and funis of the arm, and is paused over the focil, and is that one in which it is bled, and is that one that appears above the poutz by manifest appearance; and salvatella, and is the vein that is between the said auricular and the smallest said, and are in him two ramps.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and the leg are three veins; one of those is that which is below the curvature of the jaw of the wild side; and the second is sophena, and its place is below the leg of the domestic side; and the sciatic vein, and its place is below the leg of the wild side; and in the leg are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The juice of the veins that are near the ears is to ancient cataracts and emigrant and ulcerations of the head bad ancient.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding those is according to what you account to you: it is that is shaved the head of the patient, and is rubbed the head of the patient in the occipital in the place of both veins with a drape ample with good friction; tighten the patient his neck with a bandage between which appear the two and their places are near the ears in two places deposed of the head; and seek that one with your finger, and if you feel the pulse of those with your finger, here is sign with attempt.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Take you the lance cutellar, and it is that which is incident, and take you that one below the vein in the codena between which the bleeding came to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And take up your hand with the vein and the codena to the parts above and insert the vein with incident incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision the quantity of two fingers adjusted or around that; and make to exit the blood as much as you want.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And tighten with powder and layssa that one between which is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And he has preceded in the beginning of the book the incision of those and their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But of the two veins arteries that are in the temples the juice of the phlebotomy is to ancient emigration and wickedness and obstinate ophthalmia and body of acute superfluities poured out in the hulls.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding those is according to what you account to you: constrict the patient his neck motion between which appear the two veins to the feeling by manifest appearance and let be demonstrated the pulse of them below your finger; and then you sign with attempt.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And take you up the codena above the vein to the parts above with your finger indic, and insert the bleeding incident below, and elevate the vein above; and insert that one as well as you have done in the two other veins; and make to exit the blood according to the quantity of your necessity.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And take off the constriction of the patient, and pause your finger on the vein for one hour, and then pause on that one cloth and powder and tighten that one above with strong constriction, and layssa that one between which is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And he has preceded the recollection of them, and of those the incision, and the attraction in the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And then the juice of phlebotomy of the vein of the forehead is proper the phlebotomy of the cephalic to the ancient maladies of the face and to emigration and heat and ulcerations suppurative.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of phlebotomy of him is according to what you account to you; it is that the patient tightens his neck with a bandage between which appears the vein; and take you the instrument which is named fossori, of which this is the form:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Pause the point eminent which is at the head of the fossori on that vein and peck it in him with a needle or with another cause in the manner of lu, and let exit the blood according to the quantity that you want; and then take off the perforation of the patient and tighten that one between which is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And some times it is opened with phlebotomy lat, however not believe that the phlebotomy is of acute extremity as well as the other phlebotomies, before it is of lateral extremity, and phlebotomize that one according to the transverse, because the bone is near and strong he would break in him the phlebotomy when it is subtle.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the juice of the two veins that are in the lacrimal of two hulls for scabies of the hulls for heat and weeping in the hulls, and to the maladies of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of phlebotomy is that the patient tightens his neck with a bandage, and take you those, and you be standing over the head of him.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And let the phlebotomy be done according to the transverse to length a little with phlebotomies few, because in the place there is no meat; and if the phlebotomy is subtle, strong its extremity is broken.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And take you exit of the blood as much as it is necessary to you, and pause on those cloth, and tighten those one night, and then take off those.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But the phlebotomy of the vein of the nose is conferred to acute fever and to violent heat, and to the maladies of the face and emigration and heat that happens in the face, and especially when it is ancient.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of phlebotomy of him is that the patient tightens his neck and take you his nose with your left hand, and take you the phlebotomy subtle long and insert that one in the middle place of the head of the nose according to rectitude, because the vein does not appear to the feeling here, and because the blood begins to flow at once.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Believe that you finish your hand with the phlebotomy little by little and make to exit of the blood according to your necessity; and then tie that one for a night, because that one is restored more easily.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the juice of phlebotomy of the two guideg is to constriction of ale and to commencement of leprosy and to many maladies and inpetige and bad suppurative ulcers as well as herpotromeno.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of phlebotomy of those is that the patient constricts each one in his neck with ligament; and set the artifexs over the head of the patient, and let the patient be seated on a chair.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And take you phlebotomize the vein to length with phlebotomy ample little by little; and then exit of blood according to tempered quantity or according to that which sees of necessity that is in that; and then do likewise on the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	Then release the ligament and tighten the two veins with a ligature to prevent the patient from being suffocated, and allow them to breathe until the wound is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the benefit of phlebotomy in the veins, it will treat small sores and pustules in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and bad ulcers and fissures, and bad ulcers that are in the nose and around his head.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of phlebotomy of those is that you make the patient lie down before you, and tighten his neck with a bandage, and lift up his lips and watch out for two veins, from which the one is on the right side of the lip and the second is on the left; and their demonstration is by the blackness of each of both of them, and this more so because in the circuit of these there are small black veins; and then cut each through cutting.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if doubt exists under you, and you do not know which is of those, then you understand to incision of the largest of those, and of the most manifest of them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the illusion of the two veins that are in the lips above.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But habit usually inclines more to incising the two veins that are in the lip below.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But of two veins that are below the tongue, the benefit is properly phlebotomy of the cephalica to suffocations that are in the throat, to diseases of the uvula, and to diseases of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of phlebotomizing those is that you follow the patient between your fingers in front of the sun, and raise his tongue, and watch below the tongue, from one side of him vein and the other side vein, and the color of each is declining to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then phlebotomize each; and beware that you do not finish your hand in phlebotomizing those, for below those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the veins that are phlebotomized in the head are those in which blood usually flows in all men, and the phlebotomy of them is done according to two manners, or they put in leech mirtilat or olive oil declining in subtlety; or they cut with a fleubotomy blade, and it appeals if without smell, and this is its form:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this without-smell is that you convoke to a section and of those are specific parts and subtle according to the amplitude of the veins and according to the tightness of them.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of leech mirtilat:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Be the side of him thus with vehemence, and it is fitting to open the concave veins full proceeding apparent thick, and to those that contain thick blood tortured.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of olive oil phlebotomy:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this phlebotomy is of lesser width and of more subtle extremity, and it is fitting to phlebotomy of subtle veins that contain subtle blood citrusy.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the benefit of phlebotomy of the basilic vein which is one of three veins: for when you extract blood from diseases that are below the throat and neck, and that affect the feet and belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is fitting to the phlebotomist, when phlebotomizing that, that he guards well and is above-fear in that, for below him there is an artery, and if he errs and hits in the puncturing of the phlebotomy, cut into that artery and let flow blood, so that he not phlebotomize that with pungent phlebotomies, unless it be cutting with without-smell.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic does not appear by apparent manifestation, then you must leave that and change to the other, or seek some branch of it; or phlebotomy in the end of the arm, for that is manifest; and cut into it with without-smell phlebotomy just as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want the phlebotomy of it meteyssa, then you must hit before the tightness of the arm that touch the place between which you know the location of the pulse, and then press upon him with your palm; and lift the arm and cut into the vein with concave section with without-smell phlebotomy just as we have said; and beware that you do not hit the place by some space from the location of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you feel, as you tighten the ligament, swelling in the place that you have pressed with your palm, then that swelling is swelling of the artery, and therefore avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow in the phlebotomy as with brightness of an infant, and the blood is subtle red, then know that it is of artery blood; and then you pinch and pause your finger over that for long space; and then push your finger, and if the blood is cut off, how many times it is cut off, then you tighten the arm and leave that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And watch over the patient of the youth of him, and be above-fear of him and not abuse him for some days until he is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not cut off, and you see that you do not have medicine at hand, then you cut into the artery, if it appears to you; for the extremity of him is contracted, and the blood is cut off; or take a knife of fistic, and open that, and take one half and tighten that over the place of the vein with tightness descending with ligament and with powder within another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood is cut off, well it is; and if not, then heal that with that from which it came to the memory of the place of the powders cut off flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the cutting off of his blood is difficult in many dispositions by the small place of the wound and the possibility of the tightness of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But of the dark vein the phlebotomy is benefit that extracts blood from the superior part of the head and from the inferior part of the body; for it is composed of branch of the basilic and of the cephalica, just as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And beware for the phlebotomist that he be above-fear in the phlebotomy of him, for below it is a nerve; and then if he hits in the puncturing of the phlebotomy and strikes the nerve, stupor will occur to him, and difficult healing of him, and often not healed at all, and this nerve many times appears to feeling; and if it is hidden in some men and is subtle and not manifested, then you must pause the phlebotomy with that by which you phlebotomize with section of without-smell, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut into the vein in its length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of phlebotomy of the cephalica vein is that it attracts blood from the head and treats diseases of the ears.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And beware in this properly, if you want that you phlebotomize with leech mirtilat or olive oil; for it is the safest of all veins, for there is not below it artery nor nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But however it is fitting that you phlebotomy guard that by the phlebotomy do not puncture the head of the lizard so only, and seek the place more distant, and not hit him, if he is not struck by the first impact that be upon him by phlebotomy some times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But however it is placed in some men, when it is not phlebotomized in the first impact, but do not note in return to that apostema.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of phlebotomy of that and its accidents are many, in which you must think in their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of them is that one must know that phlebotomy is not administered except for the preservation of health and for the hope of life and the prevention of diseases, and that phlebotomy be performed on one of the veins that are in the head, namely: cephalica, fusca, and basilica; and that phlebotomy be performed at the beginning of spring, after breakfast in spring and autumn, and in winter near the time of eating, when there are signs of fullness.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And phlebotomy should be performed on the third day or the first after three hours have passed from that day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But phlebotomy that is administered, more than anything it should be done when it is convenient and necessary, at night or during the day, at any time and at all times.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And a child should not be phlebotomized until he is twelve years old, and a pregnant woman should not be phlebotomized except from the fourth month to the seventh, and the elderly should not be phlebotomized when they have already passed sixty years of age.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wants to be phlebotomized for any reason, one should cleanse their bowels before the phlebotomy with a lion's cloak, if there is retained fecal matter in them, so that the veins do not push out the excesses in the phlebotomy of the bowels, which are purified, and that they do not harm the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And phlebotomy should not be performed on patients with sacred nausea and vomiting, nor on those who have been cured of a disease or of drunkenness, unless there is no hope for their recovery, nor on the sick of dropsy, but phlebotomy should be avoided when colic pain and vomiting occur, and also when there is pain in the bowels, and when there is an increase in urine, or fever, or when there is a lot of coughing or work, or because of excessive eating or waking at night, or for any reason that weakens the body or the animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And before that, one should carefully consider the withdrawal of humors from him if his blood is thick, by means of foods and drinks, and by medicines if it is possible for him.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter a bath if any cause does not prohibit it, or exercise in some way so that the blood is thinned out.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And let him receive phlebotomy on his feet at around the third hour of the day, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor. E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And let the phlebotomist follow on a cushion that is placed above the cushion of the one who is to be phlebotomized.

E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And the bandage should be moderate, because if it is too tight or too loose, it prohibits the flow of blood; or if it is too tight, it prohibits the blood from flowing out.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment. E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And let the phlebotomist smear his needle with a little of that old oil properly; and then let him place the end of his needle on that vein, under the spot from which he wants to perform the phlebotomy, so that the vein goes away a little, and the compression is stopped because from those veins which are constricted like a string, blood will escape when the phlebotomy is performed; and from those which are swollen with windiness, when the phlebotomy is placed on it, it is contracted by the phlebotomist.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, let the phlebotomist be firm and solicitous in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then let him pause the phlebotomy, but if the vein is broken in one go, then well; and if not, you repeat that again under that spot a little, or over it with compression, if the spot is not pustular.

E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And this is better for that spot than other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And likewise administer oil in all phlebotomies where the phlebotomist prohibits the flow of blood, and they do it with tyriaca and alfordoc when it is paused on that spot from one of those, because the blood is thinned out and is agitated when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut. E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And let him do this especially for the letting of blood from that vein with a compliment of him or of another vein.

And therefore let your hand be over it, and if you then tighten softness under it, then that protuberance is wicked and bad; and therefore take care to pause over that spot some cause of what we have said, because blood flows from the artery strongly.

Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu. E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best method of phlebotomy for a vein is a cross-section, not a puncture.

E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal. E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient immerses his hand in warm water until the vein swells and appears evidently.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut. E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the appetite be ample and let your phlebotomy of it on the joint of the hand be a little.

E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is more safe than of all other veins, for beneath it there is no pulsatile vein nor nerve.

E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the phlebotomies be mild.

And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient enters a bath, and quickly and tightly ties his head on the side of the broad neck above the ankle above four fingers in one long, subtle bandage, for it does not appear except by this.

And it is in most men hidden; and if you pierce that and it does not appear at all to the senses, then phlebotomize a branch of it, and that is what appears on the back of the foot opposite the ring and little fingers.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of the nerves, and let the blood flow in the quantity you want.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and of the qualities of using them.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Vents are from horns or ram's horn or glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done according to two methods: one of them is with a scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is ventilation without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation that is without scarification is according to two methods, for either it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the vents that are administered with scarification and extraction of blood are fourteen parts of the body, of which one in which vents are paused is alnocrati, and it is the back part of the head; and the middle part of two parts of the neck together; and vents from the chin below the jawbone and below the mouth; and vents from two spatulas; and vents from alloster, and that is on the end of the tail; and vents from two little fingers, and they are of two arms; and vents from two shanks; and vents from two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation does not extract blood but from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and for this it does not have virtue through them, just as cauterization is through phlebotomy; nor is it believed that ventilation should be done with fire or without fire in any disease caused by repletion within when the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity prompts ventilation for disease or for continued, we administer that at the beginning of the month and at its end, and in the middle of it and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for this is that in men the blood is multiplied within due to indigestion from extraction by ventilation and seeks тяжесть weight and fullness in their heads; and it is from those who seek repletion and heat in their faces and heads, and from those whose faces are puffed up, and darkness and weakness in their eyes; and it is from those who spit blood when they cough; and it is from those whose sleep is disturbed, and from those who see blood in their sleep, heat and ancientness and other causes to them resembling.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when any of those causes occur, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, then we command ventilation to be done after two or three hours have passed during the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventilation of the nape is that when it happens to cause heaviness in the head and to that which is sunk into the eyes; but beware that this is not a complete evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this vent is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not advisable to use it when there is a complex fracture or when there is a hernia, for it does great harm to that.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason it is not advisable for the elderly and in the heads of those whose diseases are cold.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But when that is continued over him it causes oblivion; and for this reason you should command the ventilator to pause his hand with the cupping glass on the upper parts, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventilation of alkehel is in the place of phlebotomy of the dark vein and the basilic; and for this it causes asthma, and constriction of the throat and hoarseness, and coughing, and repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	But it should be applied to the alkehel cupping glass a little, for if it is paused below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And ventilation of alhagdahan causes accidental pains in the head and to ophthalmia, and emisary, and pre-fever, and toothaches; and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the basilic.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And beware that you command the ventilator not to press his hand with scarification so that he does not pierce the artery and cause an outburst of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias. E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is one cupping glass with which it is cupped above the hips and causes hemorrhoids of the anus and ulcers further below.

But cupping glasses of the legs are lessened due to manifest weakness, for they draw blood from all the body, and cause old pains in the knees and the mother, and the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and cause hemorrhoids and ademil; and they stand in the place of phlebotomy of two sophens, and alahorcoben, and of two shanks.

E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the cupping glasses alahorcoben their benefit is added to the benefit of the cupping glasses of two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the cupping glasses is that you pause the cupping glass at the beginning and suck through a warm tube, and do not prolong the position of the cupping glasses, but pause them briefly, and let the humors come to the site by intuition equally.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat that and continue until he sees the site already red and swollen and that the heat of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and then consider the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For a man who has thin skin, beware that you scarify him once and not more, so that the location is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the wind instrument player to amplify the scarification and take a few breaths, and temper the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the vein is enlarged, then you should scarify in two places, for in the first place is opened the way of subtlety into the blood and moisture of it.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second to the scrutiny acquired from the extraction of the thick blood.

E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And lastly, when we want to extract blood little by little or a small amount, one scarification is enough for us.

And if we want to extract a lot of blood, then we scarify with many scarifications; and if we know that the blood is thick, then we should scarify deeply.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which there is only the depth of the skin.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz. But if the person has wide pores of tender flesh, then oil should be prohibited; instead, the places on which the cups are to be placed should be washed with water or warm salt water, or with walnut water, or with water from boiling herbs, and similar things.

And for the person whose superfluities are thick, wash their cups with old wine, or with water of wormwood, which is marjoram, or of boiled aniseed, or of camomile, and similar things to those.

And so that the cupping treatment is kept before bathing; have them take a bath shortly after the treatment for one or two hours, and let them sleep after the cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What shall be done when it is necessary to evacuate wind from a patient before cupping?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Consider the following: if the person to be bled and cupped is choleric with hot blood and inflammation, then take cold remedies, such as parsley leaves, and endives in sour wine, and leeks, and sesame, and julep, and similar things.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And feed them also with poultry, and meats of young birds, and seasoned dishes with vinegar, and similar things to those.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for the person whose complexion is foul, have them drink honey water with alum, or honey water of sesame seeds, and sumac, and very fragrant wine between white and red; and let him be commanded to drink little and eat little, and give him poultry and cabbage and pigeons and small birds and colombier.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And so that on the day of cupping and phlebotomy, let his drink be greater than his food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz. Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the cups that are after scarification should be placed over the liver, and over the melse and podagra, and over the umbilical, in the places of the joints, and the pixid of the elbow, for these members do not suffer scarification upon themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those except for bloodletting from the member, just as they pause the cup over the mammary gland in milk flux of blood from the blood of the breasts; and they use that to dissolve thick viscousness of the member, just as they pause over the belly and the umbilical; for that thins out the member and pierces it and releases the pain when it resolves the cupping.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And already it is paused over the testes when they occur in their swelling or pain, for by virtue of strong attraction their scrotum swells and eliminates the pain from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is paused over the liver and the spleen in those who have a hernia.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cups are administered empty with suction only; and some times they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some times they are administered full of tepid water in the diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the cup should be filled and have a large opening; it is water alone or water in which herbs are steeped according to what is convenient.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cup administered with fire: let the size of the orifice be two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the flame be the length of a palm; and be in the width of it, in the place that is in the circuit, the size of it, the hole be small according to the quantity that goes into it an needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of ram horn or citron wood, of thick margins, of lion, of ox hoofs and terses so that it does not sting the member when it is in its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let there be a transverse groove at the mouth of it, made of horn or of iron, where the candle with the fire is paused.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this cup be much larger than that which we have recommended; and the small one less according to the diseases and the condition of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cups of children and emaciated people are smaller than those of young and stout people.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this cup with fire upon the member is that it extends the heat with a decent fire of wood in front of a small candle of wax, and pause that upon the mouth of the transverse groove at the middle place of the cup, so that the fire be lit around the lower part so that the patient's body is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then let it be paused over the member of the patient, and the finger be over the hole that we have said, during which when we hold the cups and do not see the finger and let the steam go over that hole, the cup is immediately dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And prop it heats the fire according to its way, and repeat that if it does not work out.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in cupping that is administered in the disease of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse groove nor hole, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is paused over the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is how it is: And this cup when it is larger, all the better, so that it can receive great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting is not administered in small members but in the members in which it is not possible to place cups due to the smallness of those, such as the finger and the gum and similar things to them; or in a member stripped of flesh, such as the toe and similar things to them.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that you have found leeches in the dark waters of clean blood.
