E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	Then let them be left for the day and night in dark water until they become hungry, and no cause remains in the belly of those; and then the body should be evacuated at the beginning with phlebotomy and with enemas; and then the parts of the patient are to be rubbed until they turn red; and then they are to be placed on him.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and deflated.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck the place with a ventouse, it is better for healing.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with wine vinegar and then with warm water; and it should be rubbed and expressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body of the blood is prolonged by the action of the leeches and it is sweating, then you dip a cloth in cool water and place it on top so that the sweating is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is profuse, then powdered vitriol, or eggs and similar things from the class of astringents are sprinkled on it until the blood is staunched; or cooked fava beans are placed on the spot and left until the beans adhere to the spot, and the blood is staunched.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, the repetition of leeches, when possible to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from being suspended, then the place is to be rubbed with fresh blood or a needle is left in the places where it draws blood; and then they are to be placed, for those when feeling any blood at all drawn.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop, sprinkle a little aloe vera, or salt, or ash on them, and they will stop right away.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the prologue of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many times necessary in the art of medicine; it is a restoration of fracture and of accidental dislocation in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, know that boast of this chapter the foolish doctors and the vulgar and those who have not for some time regarded the books of the Ancients nor read any letter of them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason the method of the scientists in our land is private; and I have not been obliged to do anything at all about it; and I have not used that which teaches, except through length of reading the books of the Ancients and studying on the understanding of those, so that I might extract the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have added to it experiment and study in the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have described in this chapter all that contains my science and about which my experience has passed; because I have abreviated it to you others and freed you from occupation of elongation; and I have abbreviated it in the end of abbreviation; and demonstrated it in the end of demonstration; and formed it in many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as is done for addition of demonstration, so I have done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from being fractures of the bones, from which whose premise is necessary, before we begin to remind of the members fractured and diverse if any.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, we take in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of speech; and the chapters at understanding which in the beginning is forced the artificers and to station on the truth of those; so you are and those who are prompt that know or learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when accidents happen to anyone fracture or dislocation or twist or hernia, then you must first be careful with phlebotomy or washing it, or any poultice, if no cause prohibits, so as debility of strength, or is the one to which happened effant, or old in decrepitude, or is time of violent heat, or of violent rub.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then it should be content in food of herbs fresh and of meats of birds and of crabs; and prohibited thick meats and to fill up with foods and all food that fills the veins with blood, so that you ensure safety from apostema cauterization, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first regimen with which he used to be accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore when the broken bone begins to be restored, then let the patient be fed with nourishing foods of mot and thick and heavy foods in which is stickiness, so as foods made of wheat cooked with water, and rice, and peas, and fish, and bellies of cows, and eggs, and fresh meat, and wine gross and similar to those, and with this regimen coagulation of fracture is done more quickly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the broken bones when they are in the elderly and in the weak, it is not possible that they be continued and be consolidated according to their nature by the drying of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time by the drying of those members, and they are continued and consolidated which are of them in the end of softness, so as the bones of little children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature adjusts and connects on the broken bone of all part any cause similar to glue in which is thickness that adheres and strengthens together, so as fire at the beginning, so that no cause prohibits that from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you stop the foods of the patient, foods in which are heaviness and stickiness and thickness, so as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Much diversity of fracture according to diversity of member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of members, for fracture of the bone of the leg is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the toe; and similarly all other members are diverse among them.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I will come to remind of every species of fracture, expounded in its distinct chapter from another.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Much diversity of fracture in itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fracture of the bone are diverse in their meteyssas; for there is made fracture arched another that happen in it stars; and some times fracture is made according to the length of the bone: and they are fractures of the satagia and asthels and additional proceeding and non-proceeding, so as it is made in the pen when it is prepared to write, and fracture am plaga and disruption in the head, and fracture fissure little.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And every species has pain or torment proper in its restoration according to what will come reminder of it distinct in its places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Much sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for that is known fracture of the bone: its tortuosity and of that eminence and appearance of it to feeling, and so of it when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is not in the place tortuosity apparent nor is it made due to your touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not suffer great pain, then it is not here fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there be tortuosity or small fissure, then do not you sting it with your hand and compress it with agitation and the patient does not suffer great pain, then hold over it of the medicines of which you remind him about it moment which suits the place; and then be tight by subtle restriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you should know that the place where it is arched and not split into two or anything else that does not happen in it is called a satagie, as is the entire part of his body, then you must begin to rectify it with cautery.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it happens to be cauterized, then let it be for a few days until the abscesses cease; and then heal it afterwards in whatever way you can, according to its nature and severity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And you should know that the restoration and piercing of it is easier than the bone in which this satagie occurs.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to how it will heal.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the satagia is in the bone, then it is necessary to extend that broken member into two parts, whether it be the arm or leg; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And your position should be the one in which you place that member's joint according to its natural shape, while the parts are extended from the broken member; then you must pierce and return those attachments with skill and in any way possible for them.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And beware according to your strength that you do not cause pain or injury to the patient through your operation; and with skill, according to your ability, apply the one bone to its companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And you should touch it with your hand in that hour profitably, and if you see any other cause, rectify it and heal it according to the quantity of your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, as many foolish doctors often cause an abscess cauterized by their operation, or caused contraction in the member, as we have seen it happen through their operations many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then you should attach it, apply equity and decent operation and stricture of that member, and rest and tranquility; warn the patient about this and make him understand that he does not hurt himself in the hour of his vigils and sleep, and watch his revolution and agitation, and attend to his excretion, and attend to all his movements with all your skill; and see if the position of the member is a position by which the pain is secured, for its cause is when it feels in the disposition of the member's position pain or injury; then you must change it into another disposition from which he does not feel pain; and beware of this that the position of it is straight and healed, so that no tortuosity happens to the member when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the stricture of the broken member is that you consider it; because you should know that broken members are differentiated in their smallness and in their greatness and in the shape of them.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those which are small like the arm and finger and elbow and similar to them, then let their envelope be very thin cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those which are large like the thigh or leg, then let their envelope be hard and folded, because the folded band connects the large member and strengthens it all around with equal stricture, so that no stain enters it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then you should begin, and your evacuation of equity, pause the convenient bandage over that fracture with three or four envelopes according to how the member deserves it; and strengthen your hand a little with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go to it at the highest part of that fracture location, and strengthen more so that you do not focus your stricture with which you have strengthened the fracture location.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then lengthen it a little with the envelope at the fracture location, and loosen the stricture a little bit by bit as you take from the location a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap that other part over the broken location, and then go to the bandages at the lowest part of the fracture; and your operation in the stricture of the envelope and in loosening it shall be according to what we have said above about the first envelope.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the envelopes of wadding or cloth with which it is healed the tortuosity of the fracture, if there is tortuosity in it; and if not, then do not pause for any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause over it another bandage, and then heal the decently-made stars over these envelopes immediately, if there is no inflammation or abscess cauterized at that location, and then pause over it whatever heals the abscess and stops the inflammation; and let it be for a few days; and then strengthen over it the stars.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the stars should be of the thickness of a cane that is straight and well-formed, or they can be of wood, or of strips of palm tree, and their width should be according to this shape and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the star that is paused over that fracture should be thicker and a little bit more folded than the other stars, and the length of the star according to how long the member is in greatness and smallness; and then strengthen over it another bandage according to your first stricture; and then pierce over it with decent needle according to what we have said about stricture, and let the stricture be according to the location of the fracture, and as long as it is drawn away from the fracture, the stricture is diminished.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be medium in thickness and sottlety, and they should be of fine linen; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen through the operation of some foolish doctors who fasten their threads with cords, and it is a great error when the stricture is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And thin threads are not convenient, because you will not achieve by stricture with them what you want, and there must be room for a finger between the stars.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is hurt by the ends of the stars then strengthen it with wadding or cloth below so that it does not hurt him.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes the fracture is with swelling and occurs disruption in the tendon, and I have come to rectification in it in the head according to its singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that not every broken member is tightened with stars on the first day; the cause of this is because the member, when it is large, you should not pause over it stars unless after a few days or seven or more, according to your security about the occurrence of an abscess cauterized.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the plasterers by which the Ancients restored, they were paused over fracture and dislocation and twisting.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Way of plaster as a remedy for the restoration of fracture, convenient to many complexities and especially to women and children, because it is that which does not come heat or friction: and take from flour powder, and it is the core of the flour that comes out with the movement of the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And it is used as it is, but you sift it with white egg and pause the composition of it not thick nor sottile; and then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of a restorative poultice for broken bones and dislocation and twisting: take assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula, and myrrh, which is ground from wild pomegranate seeds, of all these ingredients take one drachma each; of mirra and aloe take five drachmas each; of aloes take twenty drachmas; mix them together and add to it either water or egg white if the patient's body is cold; and then use this poultice, for it has a good composition and quickly restores broken bones, and makes many men well.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of a poultice that makes well broken bones and twisting: take myrrh and met with white poplar, both weighing ten drachmas; mirra and aloe, five drachmas each; acacia, six drachmas; and armenian bole, twenty drachmas.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All of these ingredients are to be ground in a mortar and pestle, sifted, and made into a poultice with either water or egg white and then applied.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of poultice for joints and bones separated from their sockets, and for cuts and fractures: take soft wool and soak it in warm vinegar and oil and then apply it to the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Add to this poultice verjuice for restoration, and add yellow wax to close and draw out pain effectively.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of poultice that restores broken bones: take leaves of the wild fig and leaves of wild poppies; pound them all together and make a poultice from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of poultice that promotes restoration, and resolves the swelling from fractures: take ground leaves of mallows, chamomile flowers and violet flowers, flour of ermine, of all these ingredients one part each; have them all pounded and made into a poultice with vinegar if the member is not wounded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is wounded, then treat that spot with water of coriander soaked in wine or with water and his own urine.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another stronger method of poultice that effectively resolves swelling: take ground leaves of mallows and its seeds, balsam, mallow, majorana, violet flowers, chamomile flowers, all in equal parts; have them all pounded and made into a poultice with water of sage or warm water or wine, all depending on the quality of the member and the color of its pulse.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hypocras does not dry in its own juice unless it is applied to the wounded member for its restoration, nor should a plaster of wax and oil be placed over it, but rather a cerot made from wax and oil; nor should it be allowed to become too thick or too thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But Gualia says that plasters should be placed over the broken member for its restoration and the causes of drying due to hotness are also small like myrrh, onions and their likes according to those causes we have recounted.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of poultice that treats injury and pain: take ground mustard seeds, sesames, human hair or bird feathers, mallow and salt in equal parts; have them all pounded and sifted and made into a poultice.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the amount according to the extension of the ligature and its proximity, you consider if there is not pain nor swelling nor that the bone is broken nor has come out of its socket, then you do not have to remove it for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is violent pain or swelling or inflammation in the spot, then you cut it off or remove that in the hour and stop the poultice from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take linen and sponge the sea lion in warm water, and with that wash the spot until the swelling and pain are ceased; then let the member rest for an hour; then apply to it soft wool soaked in warm vinegar and oil or rose oil, and let it lie over it all night so that the swelling of the hernia is secured, and the pain of it calmed.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that subtle binding and small poultice, and do not tighten by your first constriction but subtly with it until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the hernia and the redness and the pain and the swelling and all its accidents are already calmed, and you have ceased from poultice and binding, then you repeat that in the same way as you have done at first equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there does not occur to the member any of those causes we have said, then do not remove it but rather three or four or five or seven days; and some times all that is left for twenty days according to how you appear by the dislocation of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and comes close to the coagulation of the flesh over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the binding a little more than your first binding and in the thickening of the swelling of the member according to how it is preceded in its memory.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the spot of the fracture dry and withered but not closed, then know that nourishment is prohibited from coming to it; and so soak that in warm water entirely for three days; and loosen the binding a little, and by this operation the member receives nourishment and is healed gently.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But that which the foolish restorers of the broken member do is another way when it is not restored at first, as it is closed and twisted, is error according to their operation and great fear, and if it were straightened then the ancients in their joints would have been opened by them.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do that, because it is more reasonable that it does not do that.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according to: Of fractures when they occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are various, and their figures diverse, and their causes distinct; for some fractures are made by the impact of a spear, and the impact stands all the bones inside the skull, the skull being beneath the bones as it were in a staff, and because of that this species of fracture is named impaction; or the spear pierces through some part of the bone and pierces the flesh around it without breaking into the brainpan, and because of this this species of fracture is called levation absolute.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the width of these two fractures may be great or small, and they are caused by compression or impact; and the cause of them is impact with a staff or stone, and to their likes.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture may be penetrating which approaches the membrane beneath the bone or is in the face of the bone, and the width of these two fractures may be great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of fracture is that it is broken in the bone, in the sottlety of hair small, and because of this this species of fracture is named capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And fracture is that which is made either by impact or by stone and to their likes, which makes some lamina of the bone enter into the spaces between the teeth, and is made in the concave place as it happens to the teeth when they receive impact and is broken into the spaces between the teeth.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And most often this happens in the bodies of flat bones as in the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And so all these species of fractures are set, as nails separated.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come to remember all that in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And you know all these species of fracture by detection on those and by inquiry into them with probes and examination of the corrupted flesh that is over them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And capillary fracture is known by that which is uncovered over the bone, and wiped clean, and lined over it with the probe, for the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the cure of fracture consider at first the accidents of the body, and then if you see by the accidents that signify by manifest indication on fear, as it happens in cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and abdominal pain, and redness of them, and their likes to their major dispositions, although you do not heal.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see that accidents are not happening, then you can begin the cure.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the patient has come to you in the beginning as it is in the days of winter, then you should study the bone before the 14th day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then you should cover the bone before the seventh day, so that what is below the bone becomes rotten by the skin, and so that the accidents that we have counted happen.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the skin, and is in small pieces and crushed, then you should insert the crushed and ground-up part, according to what I will tell you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you should cut off the head of the infected patient and uncover it over the bone according to custom and manner for you to make possible according to the shape of the plague, and so that it is lighter on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you see that there is a detection of the bone, flow of blood or pustule cauterized, then you should stop it with what is appropriate, and you should cover the area with cloth soaked in wine and rose oil, and make the plague rest until the pustule is soothed, and be sure to stop the flow of blood; then you may begin on the circuit of the bone and in its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this should be according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the one manner is that you insert the bone with a very narrow incision knife, and this is its shape: And you should also administer another incision knife this one a little bit wider than the other; and this is its shape:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And you should also administer the incision knife that is wider than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And you should have many incision knives of different widths; some are wider than others, and some are shorter than others and are in the shape of acute angles, and are made of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in striking the incision knife so that it does not strike the head and cause damage to it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then you should drill into its circuit before you administer the incision knives with drills, which are called non-deep drills.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not named like this but because these drills do not stop the end of the bone from that which is appropriate to it, so that when the drill is round-tipped or edged on its end below the sharp head resembling an edge or a small circle, it prohibits being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take great numbers of these drills, each of which is convenient for the thickness of every bone, so that it is present in all parts of the skull whose end is acute, and the quantity in length and brevity is according to the quantity of thickness of this part.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the shape of three kinds of drills: The quality of drilling in the circuit of the broken bone is that you stop the drill on the bone and turn it with your fingers so that you know that the bone has been penetrated; then change the drill to another place, and pause what is between every crack the quantity of the thickness of the ray or environment.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And you should insert with incision knives what is between each crack of the bone, and make that as subtle as possible at the end of lightness, just as we have said, so that you radiate the bone, or by your hand, or by any other instrument which you will have prepared for this, just as tweezers and fine forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you should keep with great care so that the incision knife does not touch any part of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And when you have drilled around the bone and it is separated from the brain if it continues with it, then you should extract that, then cut and gnaw at it in its roughness with another instrument similar to an incision knife but however, it should be thicker and more subtle than the other incision knives.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small bones and splinters fall out, then you should pick those up with ease with whatever is convenient for you from the instruments; then you cure the plague with poultices and bandages which we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is lighter and more distant from fear, which Gualia says and praises greatly; and this is its speech: It is necessary for you at the beginning to begin uncovering the part of the bone at the site where the fracture is most violent and most manifest, so that when you have uncovered that part and stopped it below with the end of this incision knife, which is long and gentle, and whose shape is as follows [image description]:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular part is round and does not insert any cause, and the acute part is from it in two sides forward in length, just as a lever; so that the lenticular part is fitted to the brain with its sharp edge incident on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And you should percute on the incision knife of one side with a small mallet so that you insert all the bone with ease just as it is turned, and you be sure that the skin does not happen to him in any way which you fear in any manner, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then if it gives any cause annexed to the bone of the skin in some parts of bone, insert that from it with the end of the lenticular incision knife, and deliver that from it with ease because it is delivered from it without harm and fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the skin, and what is severed or is left of the bone is its edge, and fall out in it roughness and splinters, then you should cut that roughness and gnaw at those splinters with subtle razors which you have prepared their number, of different quantities so that it is convenient for you to administer them in every place the most appropriate of them and the most direct of them according to what you are led by your operation on that broken bone and its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And you should administer in your reason with which you cut the bone at the beginning by the widest of those razors, and then use it also by the most subtle of them, and do not cease to do this according to continuity until you come to administering the thickest and most subtle of all of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in each of the other small capillary fractures and subtle fracture, you should administer cure according to what you are led by rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause that is not damped on all of which have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And I stand on what we wrote, we have shown in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the skin is stretched when you radiate the bone, then you should take cloth according to the quantity of the plague, and soak it in rose oil, and pause that over the orifice of the plague; then take another cloth folded or doubled, and soak it in wine and rose oil and pause that over the first cloth and do this as gently as possible so that you do not harm the brain; then administer on that a bandage wide, and do not tighten it except by the quantity that the plague has, only.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And let this treatment continue for one or two days until you are sure that the ulcer is cauterized; and then remove it and administer medicines to reduce the swelling, such as flaxseed poultices and linseed meal, and powder of onions and pepper, and similar remedies.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make these medicines into a powder that can be sprinkled over the wound, as they are dried; and generally, administer to him all medicine of the nature that cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be careful according to your ability that the wound in its healing is clean; and do not allow any dirt or other thing on it; nor let virulence accumulate on it; for when it is applied to the membrane of the brain, it corrupts and damages it, and malicious evil occurs upon the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the skull, when its bone is cleaned and mainly when the treatment of it is suppressed, and there is blackness on its surface; therefore consider that if these accidents occur to the patient as we have said, know that they are harmful without a doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if blackness does not occur except from the medicine that is applied on top of it, and it is due to that medicine which causes that darkness, then take honey in a portion and rose oil in portions .iii.. And with those lines, a cloth, and then apply it to the skull; and then heal that with the spices of healing that are appropriate so that he is cured.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter .iii.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken except in two parts only, some of which are more prominent than others; because in it there are two bones, for the part below is cartilage, and it is not broken, and nothing happens to it except crookedness, tortuosity, and sinusitis.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then you must insert your little finger into his nose, and close that fracture within with your index finger, and with your thumb outside, so that the nose returns according to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And it must be done by you for ease; and beware of causing pain to the patient due to that operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the most prominent part of the nose, and the finger cannot reach it, then let it be made equal by the end of the bone in which it is small in thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you must do as follows:
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And be careful to restore it on the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then after the seventh or tenth day, according to the rest of the ulcer.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then insert into the end of the nose a plug of linen cloth if it is one fracture, or two plugs if there are two fractures; and let the thickness of the plug be as much as the amount that fills the crack in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorers say that the plugs should be dipped in honey, and changed every day; but I have not seen it; they say let the plug be dipped in honey comfit with powdered mulberry; and then let it remain so that the bone is firmed and the cartilage becomes hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes let a plug be inserted into the nose instead of a caliper, made of goose feather wrapped in linen cloth; and it is that when the fracture of the nose is more violent and that the patient is not prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want, do it, and if you want, make calipers.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another ulcer occurs, plaster the nose with cerot or cotton saturated in white vinegar and rose oil, or with diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if an ulcer does not occur, then let you plaster that outside with sesamum flour and pepper powdered with honey; and then apply a plug of linen cloth on it, and do not bind the nose with anything for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are comminuted, then split them and extract those with instruments that are appropriate for them; and then sew the cut, and heal it with what flesh-grows and hardens, and with plasters as is convenient.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if a ulcer occurs inside the nose, then let you heal that with plugs and administer lead tubes so that it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter .iv.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and its fracture does not have an ulcer, look to see if the fracture is only outside, and is not broken into two and bent inwards at the ends; then its comprehension is difficult.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, let you insert your left index finger into the mouth of the patient; and similarly, if the fracture is on the left jaw, then insert your right index finger; and move it with ease at the ends outside, by your other hand from the part outside of the bone; thus equalize that.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two parts, then let you administer extension of both parts according to rightness so that its equality is possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if teeth occur with disruption, then strengthen those of which you expect that they will be broken by thread of gold or silver, or of silk; and then plaster the broken jaw with cerot, and then place upon it a double cloth, or a large plug decently made, or a weight of only one piece at the length of the jaw; and then tie that on top as you are equipped with its equipment, and as is appropriate for its application, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to keep rest and tranquility, and provide him with food that is soft and not sharp.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that it is already altered in some way, then let you cut and loosen it on the third day; and then rectify what has been altered on it, and plaster it with pepper powder, with honey, or with sesamum flour, after you have removed its cerot, and place upon it wool cloth.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then after that, when this plaster and adjustment on it is made, and the position of the bone is not altered, let it be left, that is not removed until it is healed and the fracture is strengthened; for often this fracture is healed in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another ulcer occurs, then administer what we have said several times in the treatment of it so that it is healed, and let the ulcer be licked by that.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture has an ulcer, then consider whether it is a broken piece of bone or a splinter, then you must subtilize those splinters with what is appropriate for that in the removal of them.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the hole of the ulcer is narrow, then you must widen it by phlebotomy according to the amount of your necessity.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then after you have extracted those splinters, and if they do not continue to ooze, then let you sew the hole of the ulcer if it is wide; and if not, place upon that one of the plasters which is appropriate for that, so that it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter .v.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the collar bone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the furcula of the breastbone is broken in front of the muscle, and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is either broken, separated, or separated in two parts other than the joints; and it is easier to restore it; or it happens that there are injuries to the joints, and it is difficult to restore it; or that the fracture is a plague.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation on that, when the fracture is the plague, is that you have two ministers present, so that one has the assistant and follows the broken furcula, and the other extends the neck towards that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then fix the fracture with the threads within so that it is made according to its shape and there is neither prominence nor concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if it needs more extension, then you have to put under the patient's chin a sponge or woolen ball, and the size of it according to the amount of your need; and extend and elevate the furcula and tighten the sponge with your hand within so that you fix the fracture according to its shape.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot pull the end of the furcula to the outside parts because it is reached by the prenon, then you have to make the patient recline on his neck, and put under the muscle a cushion half in size.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the ministers press the muscle from the outside parts under so that the bone of the furcula is elevated which is in the prenon above, and then you straighten the fracture and fix it with the threads.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel injuries of the furcula and bleeding, then you have to cut on that and pull out those injuries with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you devise an incision of it with one of the saws which you have prepared for that, after you have put under the furcula the instrument that serves as a vise; and this instrument is of wood or iron and this is its shape:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a spoon whose concavity is like this; and its breadth is according to what you need from it, according to the size of the bone or the thickness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But its length is according to what is possible for you in the operation; that it has two ends like this, and one end is wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the incision of the plague which you have cut when you have pulled out the injury of the bone is wide, and there is a risk of an abscess, then you join the two lips of the plague with a suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is little, or you fear an abscess, then you fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the quantity of the incision of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if there is an abscess, then you soak a cloth in warm wine and oil and place it over that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the compression of the bone when it is without plague and without section is that you place a plaster made of wheat flour with egg white, and place a piece of linen over it, and then place the sponge under the chin of it if it needs from that, and then take a bandage, so it is twisted which I hold the Saracens , that it be very long, and its breadth is of one palm or around that; and then put powders doubled over the sponge and the plaster; and then take a stake of thin table whose breadth is three fingers and in length similarly; and then wrap that cloth around the stake at the place above the fracture location; and then place bandages as it is turned, and turn that over its neck and under its chin, and reduce that to all parts, and when times that the compression of the fracture with compression descending, and that is what is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all that it is not bleeding over the broken bone; and so you have to see the patient every day, that when the binding is softened or you see the stake is already bleeding, then you straighten that and strengthen the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the pillow of the patient under his neck, and place under his chin from below the pillow in the night a little cushion; so that with that is elevated the support of it of the side of that, and therefore is elevated the fracture of the furcula to elevation of the muscle; or be the arm of it tied to its neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not untie the binding unless there is sufficient healing or abscess within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you have seen its face to that, and tighten in the compression and restore that and leave it until it is restored and the fracture of the furcula is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the month in twenty-eight days, and some times in some men is done in less time of that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter .VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of restoration of fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken in its lateral place and not broken from it except its margins.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is broken in its place — and it is broken in the middle of it — and it is not connected except by contact, then according to the figure of the fracture you make the preparation of it and reduce that according to the natural figure in all manner of engine which is to you possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then place on the place powder of wheat with egg white and piece of linen; and then place doubled cloth; and then place over it stake bent of thin table according to the quantity of the spatula all or more little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if under the stake is concavity in some of the places of the spatula, then you fix that concavity with piece of linen, and then position the stake according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then strengthen above with a long bandage with decent compression and with firmness of the stake so that it is not bleeding from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.
