But when that happens, then let you pay attention to the apostoamatio of the patient, and then let it be left alone so that the apostoamatio rests; and then let the limb be embrocated with warm water and oil, and then let it be reduced gently.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And let every limb be cured by that of which the memory will come in its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And now we have ordered the chapters of dislocation according to how it is preceded in fracture, from the uppermost part of the body down to the lowermost part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter .24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure for dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So dislocated are the two jaws if not tight; and the dislocation of both is done according to one of two ways: they are pulled from their places by small movement, and are softened a little; or they are dislocated by entire dislocation and completed, so that they are softened at the joint where saliva runs from the patient's mouth and he cannot hold it closed, and his tongue is wrapped in his speech.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when its dislocation is small, then in the major dispositions it returns by itself for no reason.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is entire and completed, then let the reduction of it be administered gently, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And let the minister hold the patient's head, and let the doctor insert his one hand's finger into the root of the dislocation of the jaw inside the mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or let him insert both hands simultaneously if the dislocation is on two sides, and the other fingers of his hands be outside holding them; and command the patient to stop clenching his jaws and open those at every part; and the doctor grip the jaw and press it so that it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, especially if both mandibles are dislocated, then administer an evaporator with water and oil until both are reduced and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And when they are returned and bitten, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not relieved, then place a powder of cloth with cerot over them, made of wax and rosin oil; and then let it be bound gently with soft ligatures.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	Let the patient lie on his back, and let his head be held between two people so that he does not move to the right or left; and do not force him to chew anything for any reason; while his food should be minced lion meat, until the pains are reduced and the mandibles are swollen, then let him eat what he wants.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be administered gently, and do not work on the opening of the mouth after eating and drinking and resting, until the mandible is swollen and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of both mandibles is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and are not returned to their places, then many times afterward there occur feverish heat and constant vomiting, and very soon the patient's belly is inflated, and very soon he vomits pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then know that it is deadly; and many times the person who experiences this in seven days will die.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of dislocation of the furcula and the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The furcula is not dislocated within the chest by its connection to the feet; and sometimes it is dislocated outward at the end, and this is evident in sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And its restoration is that the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then press the area with your palm with a strong grip, for it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	Then place on it plaster and powder and strengthen that.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which is joined to the collarbone and continued from it is not dislocated in any way; therefore, know that it should be reduced and bitten according to what we have said and according to what your appliances are.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	Then place on it plaster and powder and binding, and command the patient to adhere to tranquillity and rest until he is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this method of treatment, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is dislocated only in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated at the top of the joint at the lower end.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the top of the muscle, and this occurs rarely; and it is not dislocated at the sides behind the shoulder; and it is not dislocated at the front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most commonly it is dislocated and protrudes outward at the lower end below the joint, especially in those whose flesh is thin; but in those who have much flesh, it is protruded outward with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And very soon happens to some people by blow or fall, and the muscle of it is apoplectic with apoplexy, and it is bitten by that which has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, know this while you are above him, and then proceed with the cure of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is known when it is at the lower end below the joint; for you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the intact muscle, for you observe among them a manifest difference; and you observe in the head of the muscle concavity and below the joint from the touch of the head of the muscle as if an egg, and to the patient you cannot reduce his hand to his ear, nor can he move it by any movements.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated above or below, and you then observe manifest touch, and it is not disguised.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And this dislocation is reduced easily when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And its reduction is that the minister raises the hand of him above; and then place your fingers below the joint of it, and raise the joint with strength above to its place, and the minister raises the hand of him, and extend it above; and then place it below so that it returns easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return by what we have said and so that the dislocation occurred, after many days, then know that the patient should be bathed in warm water and be administered a poultice to soften and loosen it as though his neck were frozen with frost, and fenugreek, and honey in water, and be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Then the patient should lie on his back and place his hand below the joint of it and wait in elevation and compression, and then the doctor places his foot on the ground, and lifts the head of the muscle with strength, and pulls the hand of the patient so that it is not bitten at the lower end, and another minister holds the head of the patient, which is not bitten at the lower end, for that returns to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce it according to this manner: and there should be present a man who is longer than the patient, and he stands on that side, and inserts his muscle below the joint of the patient and lifts the joint of him above so that the patient is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the lower end of his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is young, then know that it should be suspended with him for another cause, for its weight, for the dislocation returns at once.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced similarly according to another manner: and there should be placed on the ground a pole long whose top is round in shape, like mortar, which is not thick nor fine, and then it should be placed below the patient; after he has been laid over the top of the pole, and the patient stands according to the length of the pole, and then his hand is extended from the lower end of the other part; and his body is extended on the other part with strength, for the joint returns to its place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce it by all the causes that we have said, then use this cure: and take a pole whose quantity is in the length of two cubits, and its breadth is four digits, and its thickness is separated according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	Then on the round head are tied lions' clothes so that the pole does not bite the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	Then it is placed below the joint of the patient, and its hand or arm is extended over the pole to the lower end, and the pole is tied over the helper and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then the arm is placed over a rung of a ladder according to its breadth, and the hand is extended from the lower end, and his body is suspended on the other part, for the joint returns at once.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument of it is completed according to each manner that is possible for you, and then know that you place below the joint a sponge of wool of equal quantity; and then place plaster prepared from powdered earth with rose oil over all the muscle, as it is rolled above, and then bind it from the lower end with binding decently; and the binding should be rolled over the plaster, and its hand be joined to his neck, and let him lie, and his hand not be bitten for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And that which is to be stopped, the food of the patient little, while the member is comforted, for it is more quickly healed.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food should be given more frequently or water and exercise should be taken; and if it is stopped and not softened, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times by humidity that happens to it or for another cause, then in that case a cautery should be applied with three pricks, as is said before in the chapter of cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and after seven days the ligament is not attached and the joint is not healed, and the plaster and compression are removed from it several times, and it is not healed, and he cannot raise that arm to the parts above, then know that his nerves which are at the head of the muscle, are cut or stretched or softened, and know that the joint will never be attached in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Of the dislocation which is made of the foot and the breast or the parts behind, the reduction is made by impulse and extension with the hands, while it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And the other compression should be administered on that one as it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the healing happens with difficulty in that member and there is delay in its movement, then the patient should take a bath several times until that difficulty is relieved and it returns to its first nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .XXVII.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of healing of dislocation of the collarbone.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the joint of the collarbone is dislocated with difficulty and returns likewise with difficulty; and it is dislocated to all sides, and most to the front side, and its dislocation is not hidden from you because when you adjust the dislocated collarbone with your hand, that is made manifest to you, for the joint is hollow and the arm cannot be bent, nor can it be touched with that one's own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And that which is dislocated to the sides and you reduce the dislocation as soon as it comes to an abscess, for if it comes to an abscess, its reduction is difficult, and often it is not healed at all; and especially when it is to the back side, for it is the worst of all kinds of dislocations, and of greater pain, and many times death ensues from it.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And its restoration, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the hand of the patient be stretched with two hands, and the arm of the patient be expanded, and the hands of the doctor are on the collarbone and under it, and he presses the joint with the tips of his fingers or with the root of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is to the front side, then it returns as he bends his hand with his hand, while he strikes the collarbone with the root of his palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey reduction, then administer violent extension and great motion.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend the arm, and they hold that joint in such a way that it is not moved because of the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then the arm is to be rolled all around, as it is wrapped with folded cloth over the hand of the patient, or ligament.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he anoints that with some oil in order that it be made smooth with facility; and then he presses the joint with violent impulse until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then its reduction should be stopped over that plaster in which it is stiffened and dried with egg white, and it is stretched with descending compression, and the arm is suspended from the neck, and is left for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it is released; and if the joint is formed in its place, then you release the ligament of it and leave that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see the joint is not stronger, then you repeat the plaster and the ligament, and leave that for several days until it is stretched out; and then release that.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to it difficulty with the reduction of the joint and its disposition is in movement, then administer humection in a bath and subtle friction, and compression, until it is relieved; or pause over the joint all-healed, as it is a poultice of soft fat; and then release that, and leave it for the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then release that one, and put that in a bath; and when he rises, then you rub the joint with tempered friction, and then repeat over that all-healed, as it is a liniment of oil, once a day, and the second, and the third.
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already occurred to the brain due to the heat of the bath while it was wet.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, pause over that split of wet and hot cow's udder over it; and do that several times, for that is wet and returns to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of healing of dislocation of the ulna, which is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The hand sometimes is dislocated, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, and the contrary is of the other joints, but however if there is swiftness in the reduction of it in the hour in which it is dislocated, before that the place becomes an abscess or an abscess occurs in it.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you stop the joint of the hand of the patient on a table and the minister extends the hand of that one, and the doctor stops his hand or his palm over the prominence of the joint, and he presses that until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But however if it is considered that the palm is already struck to the belly of the hand, then the patient stops his two hands on a table because of extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is before the two of the hand, then let the position of the hand of that be intriniceamment over the table, so that the hand of the doctor boxes over that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And then if it returns at once, good; and if not, then strengthen that with plaster yielding the abscess and leave that; and do not repeat that, for if you do, you will not endure nor be able to reduce it further than you pass over it days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But however the joint is bent according to its tortuousness; and if the patient feels no cause but that the hand is softened and cannot be strengthened by any cause, then know that the nerves are cut or torn, and then there is no power in it except that it is tightened with cautery close to the break of it and strongly indeed that confers any cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the ulna is returned, then stop over it that plaster which we have recommended, and let it be left and tightened for five days; and then release that and let the hand of him be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if its movement is hindered and some difficulty occurs in it, then loosen that with lukewarm water and with friction several times, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the healing of dislocation of the phalanges.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes the phalanges are dislocated all the way around.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any phalanx of those is dislocated to the back of the palm or to its belly, then stop the phalanx and push the dislocation of it with your fingers, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And support the head of the finger, suspend that which is dislocated on both sides, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then extend the dislocated part and straighten it on the same day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night comes, take that second part according to the narrative, and do not cease from loosening it during the day, and exercise with movement, and do so for several days until it is stretched out straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same if it is dislocated in the belly of the hand; take that part and do to it your first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And likewise do for the other dislocated parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a complete dislocation occurs to any of the vertebrae of the back or neck, and they are completely torn from their sockets, then in that case there is no cure, for death seizes the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that the ejection of the patient is outside of his will, and he cannot retain it; and many times some members of him are made soft, or two legs of him, or two arms of him, or one of those; or a vertebra is torn from its socket, for many times the removal of these is made to four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore it is torn from the back parts and is named dislocation.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the cure for this is that you should consider if the dislocation occurred due to fragility, because in that case there is no cure and there is no healing at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But for that which comes from falling or hitting or similarly to those, the Ancients have already spoken of the methods of cure with a prolix speech, of which the most returns by profit; but I and briefly from that of which the few excuse the excess of it, by my proximity to my own intention and exposition, by which I have here exposed and formed from diverse instruments, by which I will show and space out that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in dislocation which occurs from the front part in the feet, there is neither generation nor healing of that; and likewise in that which is made on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those there is no cure except for that which occurs specifically to the back with what I will now count.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And that the patient be extended on his face close to a wall, and be extended under him instrument wet so that he is not tied at the feet.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stick be placed, fixt in the earth at the end of the bed around the head of him, and another stick in a line that extends his feet in the other extremity of the bed.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister hold the stick, and it should not be fixed in a hole; and another minister hold the other second in that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap around the head of the patient and let the teeth of the lion clip under him; and extend the end of the clip to the stick which is supposed to be the head of him, and take that on him; and then tighten all the clips and take those on the other stick which is supposed to be the feet of him.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then each minister extend the clip to the end of the stick, and let them not be torn from the two sticks and the clips of their sockets in which they are fixt, but on the contrary do not be fixed as I have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor place his palms on the vertebra with strength within until he returns, or that he be placed over it a table, and then that he adjust his feet over the table within until he returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if he does not return by this form, then take a table of which the breadth or length is in line with three cubits, and dig in the wall from which we have said that it is proper to the patient a place in which to put between the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the middle of the table on the vertebra, and the doctor place his feet over the other end, and tighten be within until the vertebra is bound and returns to its socket.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open with a turn which is wound around the hand; and that you fix to the earth under the head of the patient at the end of the bed two sticks, the length of which is one cubit, and fix the head of him in the end of the bed winding two sticks; and let the length be between each stick one palm, and now it is made in each stick a hole in which to run torn, and each be set firm in earth so that it is not torn.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a round stick in which is the turn, and let it be wound around the two holes of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a hole in which is formed the stick, the length of which is one palm with that which is wound around; and likewise in the other two sticks.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the clips which you have tightened in the feet of the patient in the hole which is supposed to be the head of him, and the clips which you have tightened in his thighs in the turn which is supposed to be the feet of him.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then each turn and stand a minister who twists the turn with his hand, and the doctor bends the vertebra according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then when the vertebra is returned and the socket bent, then cover that you stop exciccatum plaster with oil, and then stop; and then pause over the plaster a board of which the breadth is three digits or around those, and the length of it is quantity that takes the place of the dislocation, and over the part of the vertebra.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let him be tied by the clip which we have said, and use the patient of subtle nourishment within until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any swelling remains in the socket at the end of the healing, then cover that they be administered medicines that moisten and loosen by administration of the board for a long time, which we have recounted; and now is administered in that socket sheet of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes swelling occurs in the back of the neck, and it is caused by dislocation; and it is that bone which now swells so that it does not cover that be made projection on him with this medicine, for he will surely cause death to you.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the cure of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not end only dislocation, and does not occur to those that occurs to other joints of small removal and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated according to four ways, for it is dislocated to the parties within, or to the parties without, or to the parties before, or to the parties behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most commonly it is dislocated to the parties within, and seldom to the parties before or to the parties behind.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of its dislocation to the parties within is that when you bend the hip of the patient who has healed with the patient, it is longer and the joint is more prominent than that which has healed; and the patient cannot bend his foot because of the stretching, and it is the socket that the stretching has made apotemized from apothema cauterized, so that the head of the hip has been drawn here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of that person to whom dislocation happens is that the parts are pushed out, it is that the accidents of him are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of that person to whom dislocation happens in front is that he expands his chest according to the compliment, but above all does not bend that part which is painful, and if he tries to go forward and cannot, and his urine is retained, and his testicles are swollen, and he must walk on tiptoe.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of that person to whom dislocation happens behind is that he does not expand the bottom, or cannot bend that part which bends the testicles, and his chest is shorter than the other, and the testicles are softened, and the head of the thigh is drawn towards that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of this dislocation is that you consider, according to time, if the dislocation is old and ancient, and has been long established with you, administering its reduction and remaining according to its disposition, then it will not be completely cured; and therefore no compression should be used upon it.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But with the person who has the recent dislocation, and it is one of the four kinds of dislocations, then you should return to that which returns the joint and extend it to the parts within and without, and alternately to the right and left, for it quickly returns and does not require any other cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this manner, then you should prepare to extend the chest of him from the lower part, or with his own hands, or with a bandage which is tied above the chest; and another extends the hand of that one above the navel, so that he inserts his hands under the nipples of him; and another tightens with a bandage the root of the thigh, and holds the other end of the bandage.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And if you see that the dislocation is on the chest from the end of the chest, then you should cauterize that which is under the nipple of the breast; and it should be made to extend with a bandage of twisted wool from the cautery on the chest from the end of the bandage.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And it should be the extension of all those in one direction, so that the patient is elevated by his body from the earth and he remains hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns with what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary in all species of that which I say about its own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In its own reduction, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is to the inner parts, then the patient should be laid on his back; and you should place the bandages over the root of the thigh in that place which is between the head of the thigh and the navel; and you should extend the bandage above the navel to the highest part of the breast.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister should strongly take his arms and hold the large place of the patient's thigh, and extend it to the outer parts through violent extension, for that returns in its own place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of the quickest cure by which that member is reduced, compared to the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is excused from you and does not obey the entrance with this species of cure at all, then it should be bound by both feet of the patient together with strong bandages, quickly, above on both heels and above on both soles.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each of his parts should be the quantity of four digits, and the chest of the patient should be extended more than the other by the quantity of two digits.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the patient should be suspended over the top of the post, and it should be in the middle; and its length from the earth should be the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And command a strong young man to lessen the head of the thigh, and another young man should be suspended by the patient, and the other young man lessening the thigh with strength should push, for the joint returns to its place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the own reduction, when it is dislocated to the outer part, then the patient should lie on his back according to that which we have recommended in having gout; and the bandage should be tightened over the thigh of the patient properly and over his feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two posts should be placed, one at his feet and the other at his head; and two posts adjusted to the middle of the mat which is placed over that upon which the patient is not damaged by the post being between his thighs, so that the extension to the lower parts is not drawn back.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each minister should extend to his own part, and the doctor with his hand should draw out the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey the reversal, it will be very good; and if not, pause over that diligently and as we have said in gout for that to draw out.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But the patient should lie on his back quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is to the front parts, then the chest should be extended slightly, and according to this measurement narration over mat; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand on the patient's navel, and another presses that with his other hand, and with that pressure he extends that to the lower parts to the navel.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	If the dislocation is in the parts behind, then it is not necessary that the patient be extended to the lower parts and elevated above the ground; rather, let him be laid on a hard surface, just as if the joint is dislocated to the outside parts, according to what we have said about the placement of the patient on two surfaces. And he should be on his back with his limbs extended, as we have said before.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And let there be applied a compression with a board over the place where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Now that the reduction is complete, and if you see the sign of it, then you shall extend two limbs on each side of the patient; and when you see those parts become equal, and the patient's limb externalized and expanded for some excuse, then know that the member according to which he is returned. Then adjust both thighs and apply plaster and bind with a bandage so that no joint is injured in any part. And let the patient remain at rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then loosen the bandage and plaster, and compare one limb to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Now, if you see those parts equal in appearance, then know that the dislocation is already closed, and then let the patient go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause for softening, then return and plaster that, and externalize it according to your first stretching, and let him remain in three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then loosen that, and let him delay walking on any leg for some days, until he is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of dislocation of the jaw.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The jaw is dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated to the outside parts, and to the inner parts, and to the lower parts most to the back parts; but not to the front parts.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you command the patient to apply his limb to his thigh; then know that the jaw is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is that you make the patient bend his head straight down, so that he extends his limb if he can on that; adhere your two hands to his face, and let him put his foot between your feet; then let someone else adhere his jaw with their palms, and let them hold those between their fingers over his jaw with strength, and another servant extend his foot while the jaw returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of its reduction is that his limb adheres to the thigh with an easy non-laborious elevation.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that and let the limb adhere to the thigh, and then tie those together with a bandage for three or four days, and then loosen them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the patient of walking for some days, until he is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of it to you is excused, then administer strong extension with bands of which in the cure of the hip previous narration was made.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes is dislocated by small removal, and sometimes it is dislocated according to accomplishment; and its dislocation is made either to the inner parts or to the outer parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle swollen proceeding to the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure of its removal is by easy reduction, and it should be extended with ease with hands and equalized while returning.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in its cure when it is dislocated according to accomplishment, let the patient bend his head straight down, and let there be one servant strong and valiant from the back part of that in the middle location of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then you with your right hand hold the foot from the highest part, and with your left hand from the lowest part of the foot in the location of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then pull the foot to you with your right hand, and then with the left hand twice, and then extend with the left; and press the instep of the foot with the right towards the limb without labor.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that twice according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then press the instep of the foot to the limb the third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then if it returns in one time or two according to this manner, and if you see the foot equalized, it is good; but if not, then repeat the operation on him, for it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if to you is prohibited the reduction of it with that which we have commanded, then let the patient lie on his back on the ground, and stretch a rope tightly on the ground beneath him, and let there be a cushion between his thighs, and you have wrapped a cloth over him so that he does not kick.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then the servant of him shall hold his thighs, and then another servant extend the foot with their hands or with band that lies on the neck of the foot; and then each servant shall extend against extension of his fellow, and the rope be extended between the thighs of the patient holding that so that the body of him is not drawn to the lower parts because of his extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the doctor equalizes the dislocation with their hands, and another servant shall hold the healthy thigh to the lower parts, for the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	Then when the dislocation returns and you are made aware of the health of its reduction, then apply plaster and externalize that with strong bands, and bind the foot to the limb.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And if you fear or beware of the nerves which are behind on the ankle, so that the band over it is not violent and that does not lead him strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then let him remain for two days or three; and if the band is softened, externalize that.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then loosen that on the third day or the fourth, and prohibit the patient of walking for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk before that space, there is no security that the dislocation is not dissolved and ruined, and then that he does not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if there happens to him pustule cautery, then let you administer in the healing of him that which in which our narration preceded, in another place of cure and of brooding, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter .xxxiiii.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Let that which is dislocated be equalized with little extension without labor; and that which is difficult, then it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some knuckles of the neck of the foot, then let the patient bend his foot on even ground or on a table, and be standing as if he was walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then you stand on your feet, and put your foot on that which comes from the joints, and then press that with your foot with strength while it returns, and see that equalized and not prominent in the location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Then rest the belly of his foot on a table that takes all his foot, at which are two caps, and then externalize that with decent and firm stretching for three days; then loosen that and let him rest from walking for many days, until he is stretched out and healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the species of dislocation that are done by plague or fracture or by any wound.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When you encounter one of those causes, and you persevere in the cure of it and in the restoration of the patient, many times death occurs.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that reason one should not be hasty in the treatment of the patient, but rather he who is wise in the art, with great compassion and pity, being tardy, not rash or presumptuous; and one must use in the beginning medicines that produce suppuration only slightly, and let the patient go to divine judgement, unless it be to him from whom one hopes salvation from destruction, for the alleviation of the illness, and in which some hope appears.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore try at once to make the reduction of it at the beginning of the cause, before an abscess occurs.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And therefore if the limb returns as we desire, then administer treatment that will produce an abscess and cure the wound with those among the drying ointments that are appropriate for it.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is due to a fracture and it happens that in the bones there are separated pieces, then you persevere in their setting, and do in that case what we have said in the simple illnesses of that which precedes in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your ability that of the instrument in the ways of fear as you have been instructed by my preaching; for what is better for you, you owe to your Creator, and more permanent for your glory, and healthier for your true body those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus end the words of Albucasim perfectly, of which may God be blessed.
Amen.	Amen.
